report.summary: Blue arrow not moving when "follow me" disabled
report.label: Bug
report.description: When "follow me" (blue button) is enabled a blue arrow is in center of map and map moves around. When "follow me" is disabled blue arrow should also move around, just map should be stationary.

report.summary: Alot of stored caches freezes Locus
report.label: Bug
report.description: When somebody has more than i think 128 stored caches (maybe 256) and select show in Locus it freezes. Need to check this bug out and if it is a problem... Fix it.

report.summary: Images from logs
report.label: Bug
report.description: Logs can have images attached. Currently you can't view them with c:geo.

report.summary: Deleting caches in "Stored Caches" need refresh
report.label: Bug
report.description: When the user deletes all caches of the "Stored" caches list, the caches are deleted from the database BUT they remain in the list view until the user exits the "Stored" caches list and the re-enters the "Stored caches" list afterwards. This is confusing most of the users (including myself). Steps to reproduce : import any gpx file via Stored / Import GPX (e.g. 93 caches are added in the "Stored" caches list) Select Manage/Drop All to remove all caches out of the list (deletion proceeds) .... after deletion: The list of caches (in my case 93) can still be seen in the "Stored" caches list [BUG] For my understandig the list of caches shall be empty after a "delete all caches" command. Robert

report.summary: Long HTML text does not show
report.label: Bug
report.description: If a cache has a really long description it's not parsed correctly. The example is GC2WKX2

report.summary: Listing not available for GC2PYCW
report.label: Bug
report.description: Listing of "Vzpominky stareho sklerotika" (http://coord.info/GC2PYCW) is not available in c:geo. The relevant section is missing in cache details.

report.summary: Import GPX to different lists
report.label: Bug
report.description: I am not sure, wether this is a bug or an improvement proposal, however I am pretty sure it was working up to 2.26RC2: When importing GPX-files the import data is always stored in the "Standardlist" although I selected another list to be shown before the import-operation.

report.summary: TB-logs not shown when date format is set other than GC-default
report.label: Bug
report.description: Opening a trackable c:geo only shows the "goal", "about" and the photo but not the last logs. In my opinion this feature would be helpful for the user (e.g. to look where the TB has already been in the past, etc.)

report.summary: map direction wrong if device is held in portrait mode
report.label: Bug
report.description: The direction of the blue arrow is wrong, if you hold your device in landscape mode. I know that c:geo does not support different layouts. What I mean is a different problem: If you are walking with your device held normally, the arrow will show the right direction. If you continue walking the same direction but start rotating the device, then the arrow on the map rotates, although the map doesn't rotate and you walk the same direction.

report.summary: Visually disable nearby button in main screen without GPS fix
report.label: Bug
report.description: This is similar to issue #66 but I'm logging this separately as this is about visually disabling the nearby button as long as there is the GPSr either switched off or there is no fix. In fact, the button is currently already disabled, yet there is no visual clue to the user. As a possible visual clue I would like to suggest to cross out the button instead of grayingit as this should be more visible even in bad lighting conditions. For instance, it could be crossed out in red.

report.summary: Settings: search for map file screen has wrong title
report.label: Bug
report.description: The activity screen shown while c:geo scans for potential map files currently says in its title that it isa looking for gpx files. This seems to be a reuse issue of the import activity.

report.summary: Sometimes I can rate, sometimes not
report.label: Bug
report.description: Sometimes I can rate, sometimes not. c:geo does not tell me, why it sometimes does not provide the "rate" function to me. Of course I have entered my gcVote password.

report.summary: Another OutOfMemmory
report.label: Bug
report.description: Looking in market and see this too many times. java.lang.OutOfMemoryError at java.lang.String.(String.java:468) at cgeo.geocaching.cgBase.replaceWhitespace(cgBase.java:4566) at cgeo.geocaching.cgBase.request(cgBase.java:4527) at cgeo.geocaching.cgBase.request(cgBase.java:4279) at cgeo.geocaching.cgBase.requestLogged(cgBase.java:4259) at cgeo.geocaching.cgBase.searchByGeocode(cgBase.java:3056) at cgeo.geocaching.cgeodetail$loadCache.run(cgeodetail.java:1227)

report.summary: waypoints not shown from gpx
report.label: Bug
report.description: After gpx Import the waypoints are shown in log section and the waypoint section is empty.

report.summary: refresh missing after circles setting has been changed
report.label: Bug
report.description: If you enable/disable the circles around caches from the options menu of a map, then a refresh is missing. The change only gets visible on next interaction with the map.

report.summary: Multiple signature insertion
report.label: Bug
report.description: It is not at all reproducible, but it now happend the fourth time while logging a cache: After selecting "Besuch loggen" the signature is autoinserted correctly. While I am typing the log-text the app suddenly does not react for some seconds and without doing anything automatically inserts the signature again multiple times (as far as I remember always five times) into the text-field. In my signature I am using [NUMBER] [DATE] and [TIME] fields and my signature starts with a line feed (this is to have space to insert my own text in front of the signature). Maybe one of these is causing the problem. Device: Samsung Galaxy SII with Gingerbread 2.3.3.

report.summary: GC14XNH: Logging causes crash
report.label: Bug
report.description: When selecting "Besuch loggen" for GC14XNH the app reproducibly crashes. On all other caches logging is OK.

report.summary: Turn By Turn not working
report.label: Bug
report.description: I don't know if anyone else is having this issue with this, but in the latest build I am unable to use the turn by turn feature. In both Google Nav and TeleNav, it starts to load the app, then goes back to cLgeo.

report.summary: Problems in mapview switch
report.label: Bug
report.description: when switching the map view some problems may occur: class cast exceptions WRT GeoPoint IntentReceiver leak when switching from Google to OSM Caches on live map not loaded after switch

report.summary: Caches on live map not always loaded
report.label: Bug
report.description: The following sequence led to an empty live map: start c:geo start live map (caches are loaded) switch directly to home screen switch back to c:geo (showing live map with caches) close live map open live map again: no caches areloaded (and shown) workaround: pan/zoom map to trigger cache load

report.summary: Cannot upload log from overview in maps-view
report.label: Bug
report.description: I can't send a log for offline stored caches (from gpx/PQ) from the overview in maps-view. When I open the cache in detail-view it works.

report.summary: List name no longer on top of screen
report.label: Bug
report.description: I noticed when I am picking a list of stored caches, the name of the list is no longer displayed. Regardless of my current list, it only displays "c:geo"

report.summary: When storing for offline, the cache information is probably processed a second time
report.label: Bug
report.description: I noticed that it sometimes takes a while to finish when you click "Store" in the cache overview. Maybe the cache information is downloaded/processed again? Shouldn't it be more efficient to just use the available data from the view? But again, I maybe totally wrong here. PS: Bananeweizen seconded that there might be a possibnle issue: "Please create a separate issue, I think you are right in that the cache is parsed two times."

report.summary: search by address does not work
report.label: Bug
report.description: From FB: My problem is, when I search by address it doesn't work. Am I supposed to use city and zip code? Capitalize the letters?

report.summary: Timeout when listing too many stored caches
report.label: Bug
report.description: Since I'll be abroad, I stored around 2000 caches (coming from GPX files) in c:geo. Listing the stored caches causes a keyDispatchingTimedOut if I try to press anywhere during the first 10 seconds.

report.summary: Selecting Navigation-Radar crashes c:geo (with no Radar installed)
report.label: Bug
report.description: No description provided.

report.summary: Show on map (stored list, nearby) becomes live map
report.label: Bug
report.description: No description provided.

report.summary: Localization PT update
report.label: Bug
report.description: Not really a bug, more like an improvement. The localization PT is missing quite a few translations now, so I'm going to work on it. Some of the translations for the main menu will never be shown entirely there (as they're somewhat long strings) and can probably be switched to something else.

report.summary: Live Map only shows caches for 3-4 seconds
report.label: Bug
report.description: Release 2.26 (15-08-2011). Live Map only shows caches for 3-4 seconds. Then you get only the map, no caches. If you zoom in or out, the caches reappear for 3-4 seconds, then they are gone again. It used to work with the last c:geo (Radovan Paska aka carnero).

report.summary: "found" attribute not shown in cache details
report.label: Bug
report.description: Cache details activity does not show "found" attribute. Cache icon on map lacks smiley, cache does not get hidden if "hide found caches" is set. Cannnot be corrected by updating cache data from gc.com - icon will then be hidden from map but details view is not updated. Cache had been correctly stored in DB before update. Version: latest market version Language (c:geo and gc.com): german

report.summary: "own" attribute not shown in cache details
report.label: Bug
report.description: Cache details activity does not show "own" attribute. Cache icon on map lacks star, cache does not get hidden if "hide own caches" is set. Cannnot be corrected by updating cache data from gc.com - icon will then be hidden from map but details view is not updated. Cache had been correctly stored in DB before update. Version: latest market version Language (c:geo and gc.com): german

report.summary: History map shows also all other stored geocaches
report.label: Bug
report.description: The newest market version 15.08.2011 (or is that 08.15.2011 or is that 2011.08.15 or is that ...) shows on the history map not only the caches from the history but also other stored caches. However, this issue may be already present in older versions.

report.summary: switching map type changes zoom
report.label: Bug
report.description: open map with Google, the last zoom is used. change the zoom. switch to OSM. you no longer have the current zoom (but probably the one from the settings).

report.summary: Caches not displayed in "Nearby" Map
report.label: Bug
report.description: Using 2.26 RC3, Android 2.3.4 Motorola (Sprint) Photon. Caches are not displayed on the map for "Nearby" caches. Single caches ARE shown in "Live Map" and "Navigate To" map modes. Looks to be the same bug in issue #67 that was closed except force stop of c:geo doesn't fix it nor does panning/zooming.

report.summary: Log visit problem(s)
report.label: Bug
report.description: On facebook they report a problem that c:geo says that log is posted succesfuly but it does not show on GC.com Another problem is that c:geo reports log not sent, but log is actually sent (multiple) times. Please someone check this. (Maybe even before other issues) See also #139, #216.

report.summary: Trail gets disaligned on OSM
report.label: Bug
report.description: I have reproducibly the following issue on version 15.08.2011: When I use OSM:mapnik in "Live Map" and drive around I see that the trail (Spur) gets disaligned. Example: I drive along a windy road and the trail follows the road at first but after the next turn the trail from some minutes ago seems to drift away from the road. It looks like the trail is averaging to become a straight line from trail start to current position as longer as I use it. However it is not fixed to the position I was some minutes ago. On GM it is OK, I do only see this with OSM.

report.summary: "date hidden" in cache detail is wrong
report.label: Bug
report.description: http://dosensammler.info/2011/08/06/cgeo-datumsfehler-oder-geocachen-inklusive-zeitreise/ In the article the wrong date is "7. Dezember 2012". Seems to affect all caches

report.summary: Only 35 logs are displayed
report.label: Bug
report.description: I don't know if this behavior is wanted or not, but only 35 logs are displayed (counted them at 5 caches). I couldn't find anything where this number is set.

report.summary: Nearby list is not working
report.label: Bug
report.description: Sometimes it loads very long (user from facebook) and on my device: Galaxy S (Android 2.3.4) it's not loading. Just black display.

report.summary: "Any destination" does not display on "map"
report.label: Bug
report.description: When navigating to "Any destination" using coordinates, the destination is not displayed on the map when you go to the Navigate -> Map menu option. c:geo - open source, version 20.08.2011.

report.summary: Bug in coordinates input
report.label: Bug
report.description: When type coordinate in DDD° MM.MMM' and MMM' is under 100 is not correct save. E.g. 009 is saving 900 and 99 is change in 990. In Plain mode this is not happing.

report.summary: Drop cache from list removes from list but not from memory
report.label: Bug
report.description: To reproduce it: Store a cache for offline use Open default-list Menu -> Manage -> Drop all List is empty Open cache again (search, nearby list) You have two options in detail-view: refresh and delete What I expect: The cache is not only removed from list, but also from memory (at least as stored offline, can stay in cache until it is deleted from our garbage collector). There's another issue ralated to this: After dropping all caches the database-size isn't decreased. I explained it with that it is not possible to reduce pagesize in WAL-mode, but I had also no success after changed it to another logging-mode and run VACUUM. See issue #212.

report.summary: Map in landscape view
report.label: Bug
report.description: From emal: Using samsung nexus s Android version 2.3.4 Cgeo ver. 22.08.2011 When browsing the live map in landscape view, the rightmost third of the screen never shows any caches. Can anybody look into it?

report.summary: Reached MAX size for compiled-sql statement cache
report.label: Bug
report.description: I was just using cgeo with logcat enabled, and noticed this warning: W/Database( 1101): Reached MAX size for compiled-sql statement cache for database /data/data/cgeo.geocaching/databases/data; i.e., NO space for this sql statement in cache: SELECT _id, geocode, updated, type, prefix, lookup, name, latlon, latitude_string, longitude_string, latitude, longitude, note FROM cg_waypoints WHERE geocode = "GC1M3C8" LIMIT 100. Please change your sql statements to use '?' for bindargs, instead of using actual values Probably nothing serious, but I guess using parametrized queries is considered good practice wit databases. See paremeter selectionArgs in query() doc.

report.summary: Improve date-parsing
report.label: Bug
report.description: Our current cgBase.parseDate()-method isn't good, I'll improve it. This will also fix some bugs with date-parsing.

report.summary: Found Caches not marked
report.label: Bug
report.description: In the saved caches list, the found caches aren't marked green anymore. In the details view of a cache the point that i found this one is missing too. This problem exists since a few days. I've installed the latest update of c:geo today but this didn't change anything.

report.summary: Icon for log images invisible on white background
report.label: Bug
report.description: Best would be to have it filled with black color and to give it some black outline

report.summary: maps problems!
report.label: Bug
report.description: From facebook I am suffering from crashes with the latest version from 26.08.2011, didn't have the issue with the previous version. After idling at the map, my HTC Sensation goes to sleep. When I wake the device from sleep and open the lockscreen, it does not bring me back to the map, but instead arrives at the main menu of c:geo. When I click the Live map from the main menu, the app crashes. And here is a log from logcollector from my Desire. I experienced similar behaviour: 08-28 07:02:35.423 E/c:geo (15064): cgMapOverlay.createItem: java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException: Invalid index 90, size is 7 08-28 07:02:35.423 W/dalvikvm(15064): threadid=14: thread exiting with uncaught exception (group=0x400259f8) 08-28 07:02:35.503 E/AndroidRuntime(15064): FATAL EXCEPTION: Thread-41 08-28 07:02:35.503 E/AndroidRuntime(15064): java.lang.NullPointerException 08-28 07:02:35.503 E/AndroidRuntime(15064): at com.google.android.maps.ItemizedOverlay.populate(ItemizedOverlay.java:311) 08-28 07:02:35.503 E/AndroidRuntime(15064): at cgeo.geocaching.googlemaps.googleCacheOverlay.superPopulate(googleCacheOverlay.java:67) 08-28 07:02:35.503 E/AndroidRuntime(15064): at cgeo.geocaching.mapcommon.ItemizedOverlayBase.populate(ItemizedOverlayBase.java:26) 08-28 07:02:35.503 E/AndroidRuntime(15064): at cgeo.geocaching.mapcommon.cgMapOverlay.updateItems(cgMapOverlay.java:80) 08-28 07:02:35.503 E/AndroidRuntime(15064): at cgeo.geocaching.mapcommon.cgeomap$DisplayThread.run(cgeomap.java:1295)

report.summary: return to list after gpx import
report.label: Bug
report.description: Currently the main screen is shown after leaving the gpx import. Instead the previous list should be available again.

report.summary: Download of already stored caches on external call
report.label: Bug
report.description: When I'm using my mobile phone in offline modus and I open c:geo with an other app by clicking on the URL to a cache, it tries to reload the cache, instead of using the stored one. I imported a PQ to c:geo and Locus, cause I only have offline maps for czech rep in Locus. When I click on a cache in Locus, there is a link to the Cache on Geocaching.com, which I can catch with c:geo. But then I get the message, that the download went wrong. So, when catching the gc.com-url, maybe check, if the cache is already stored. PS: Is there a way to see cache-description in locus?

report.summary: Changing map don't keep position
report.label: Bug
report.description: I want to keep my position while i change map's mode. Scenario : open main map (google) disactivate autolocation (blue dot) change to map to OSM offline (my case) move to another position move back to google -> blue dot is back and you move to current position. it occurs only between OSM and google. not between google maps / google satellite May be do you need only to store status of autolocation...? Thanks LudoO

report.summary: Small problems in Android 1.5
report.label: Bug
report.description: I just tested c:geo on the Android 1.5 emulator, and I noticed there is no reaction to clicking the buttons in action bar. This is because Android 1.5 doesn't recognize the "onClick" XML property in the buttons, so the method never gets called. This is of course fixable, but the question is if it's really worth it. I'll leave that decision to the people who have access to the market statistics and who get the user complaints :-) P.S.: another thing I noticed is that the title bar in 1.5 doesn't disappear like in later versions. I guess this is also easily fixable.

report.summary: Show map from a list display all caches
report.label: Bug
report.description: From what I remember, original cgeo were able to display only caches from a list. Now when you show map into list, all caches are displayed. Reading is then complex (I got a few hundred waypoints stored, because i use offline a lot). May be a new button "show all" / "show list only" could be valuable ( like enable/disable live ) ?

report.summary: TB-icon in list not updated
report.label: Bug
report.description: I have seen this problem today the first time, and it may be difficult to reproduce: I have a list with caches and some of them have TBs shown by the icon in the list. Today I grabbed a TB from a cache on my list and it was the only TB listed in this cache. Afterwards I refreshed the cache-list (by refreshing the whole list as well as by refreshing the single cache). The cache-detail does not show a TB anymore but in list-view the TB-icon is still visible also after closing and reopening the list/app. Version used: NB31.08.2011

report.summary: Navigation bug with filter and list
report.label: Bug
report.description: in a case, shown menu is not the right one ! Scenario to reproduce the bug : Open a list Filter by type / traditional sort by name long tap on an item to move to another list open filter menu choose type here comes the menu of an item (may be the item under the menu), not the menufor cache's type.

report.label: Bug
report.description: Clicking settings or any object in main screen

report.summary: details view is populated twice
report.label: Bug
report.description: The details view is initialized twice with all data in most cases, because it loads the cache details in onResume() and from the loadCacheHandler.

report.summary: Caches don't show on map from nearby list
report.label: Bug
report.description: I am running Gingerbread on HTC thunderbolt. When I click "nearby" I get a listing of the closest caches. If I then hit menu and "show on map" the map loads up but does not show any caches. This used to work, however the last few versions its been broken. I have tried uninstalling and reinstalling, logging in etc.

report.summary: Storing cache overwrites all other stored caches
report.label: Bug
report.description: Version: build from 38afd18 Step by step: initially no caches stored open map click on a cache select "store" click on another cache select "store" do it as often as you want close map, open stored caches only the last stored cache is visible Also if you select "store" from detail-view or from "store all/selected". When you store 3 caches with "store all/selected" all 3 are stored. When you store another one only 2 are stored (1 from the 3 and the new one).

report.summary: Search broken after filtering results
report.label: Bug
report.description: Today I filtered my search results for multi-caches. Since starting a new search I only get multi-cache results. None of the taditionals (or other types) is show anymore. Even my saved caches are filtered the same way! The "home screen" says 10 saved caches but when opening te saved ones I can only see four caches - all of them multi-caches. Cancelling/resetting the filter does not make any difference. If this is not a bug but wrong usage then please help me, otherwise please fix this issue. Thank you, fama-berlin

report.summary: List entries get lost frequently
report.label: Bug
report.description: Since I use the NB11.09.11 or later, I have the problem, that caches disappear from the saved lists. Reproduce: open live map and save caches shown on the map verify the amount of stored caches in the saved list from homescreen open Nearby Caches, just scroll through the list and return back to homescreen open saved list and you will see that some or sometimes all of the saved caches are gone

report.summary: Another bug in coordinates enter dialog
report.label: Bug
report.description: One is cosmetic and one real bug If you enter coordinates with leading zeros (N46 04.005) it's displayed like N46° 4.005 That 0 would be great If you enter the same coordinates in "Plain mode" you always get "000" at the end. And yesterday I misstyped for 1. Instead of 005 I wrote 905. Save it and try to fix it. The dialog has your coordinates not the coordinates written on buttons.

report.description: At least in the compass view you have a negative bearing (e.g. -40° instead of 320°). I don't know if this is a wrong order of calling the bearingTo()-method or if it's the result of using the Android-method. Using build from current HEAD.

report.summary: Errors in Nightly 13.9.11
report.label: Bug
report.description: got a mail yesterday, I asked him about the error messages... Fist may be #438? Hello Karsten, I am using a SG3 (GT-I5800). I upgrated c:geo from NB 03.09.2011 to the latest revision NB 13.09.2011. After having installed the latest NB, I wasn't able anymore a) to search for the nearest caches (second main menue option) the app was searching caches for about a minute b) to search via live-map (first main menue option) the map showed up, some caches were found and displayed on the map. In both cases the app finally displayed an error message. I tried both options serveral times always with the same result. As I hadn't deleted the NB 03.09.2011, I installed this version again and both (live-map and nearest caches list) worked as supposed to. Finally I re-installed the latest NB 13.09.2011 again and noticed the same problems as described above. I hope this report will help you to find and to fix the root-cause of this issue. Kind regards, Bernd

report.summary: Login OK even if password wrong
report.label: Bug
report.description: Ok. I might get down to why so many users have login problems. Go to settings, click check login (Should say OK) Change your username (or password) that login must fail (e.g. Add 1 letter to user) Click Check login You get "Login OK" and wrong password stored in database. I don't have time to check.

report.summary: Newline in signature
report.label: Bug
report.description: My signature was for long time: [NUMBER] but now the empty line is never working. also if I enter a blank. Only if I enter a letter/symbol the line appears again.

report.summary: cache gets logged when opening navigation menu
report.label: Bug
report.description: Invoking the map app selection sub menu from the navigation menu leads to the cache being logged (offline) and the menu going away.

report.summary: Log button not visually disabled
report.label: Bug
report.description: When I am not logged on to gc.com, the log button is disabled, but this is not visible for the user. After the implementation for #200 (toast on failed login) I now might have an idea why this button is no longer reacting...

report.summary: Mysterious login problems - gc.com sends 'set-cookie' header
report.label: Bug
report.description: Today all of a sudden I had mysterious problems interacting with gc.com using the release version - even before the update. Luckily after some tries I could reproduce and debug it on the emulator and found that gc.com in my case sent 'set-cookie' header instead of 'Set-Cookie' - which lead to successful login and 'not logged in' when requesting the cache page. Currently no idea why this happens.

report.summary: Can't decrypt some logs
report.label: Bug
report.description: Example Open GC1F9GF log from onika2 I can't decrypt log

report.summary: New HTML format for spoiler images
report.label: Bug
report.description: The format for spoilers image seem to have changed during the GC.com upgrade. We do not currently load spoiler images for caches that are not in our database. See GC2QM0K for example (unless you're having Marseille caches in your database :-) If someone wants to tackle this, that would be great, and we would be able to do a new release on the market.

report.summary: Live Map only shows caches for 3-4 seconds on a NookColor
report.label: Bug
report.description: Live Map only shows caches for 3-4 seconds on a NookColor. Release 15-09-2011 for Market. Live Map only shows caches for 3-4 seconds. Then you get only the map, no caches. If you zoom in or out, the caches reappear for 3-4 seconds, then they are gone again. It used to work with the last c:geo (Radovan Paska aka carnero). Hasn't worked since cgeo-opensource started. Video: http://www.rkkda.com/tmp/2011-09-15-182108.mp4

report.summary: Crash when looking for non-existent cache by GC
report.label: Bug
report.description: When looking for a cache, I missed a character and searched for "GC1F9G" (instead of "GC1F9GF"). I got a FC without any log information or stack trace.

report.summary: Description of some caches not readable
report.label: Bug
report.description: Some caches description doesn't show up correct. Examples: GC217HR GC1QB2K

report.summary: FC in coordinate input
report.label: Bug
report.description: Following scenario: New installation try to enter coordinates the first time. Format selection is PLAIN, controls shown are degree,minutes,seconds switch input style to something else -> FC Essentially this is an ArrayIndexOutofBounds exception in the coordinate parser when trying to parse an empty string. This is due to the plain text controls being empty, even if trying to workaround this situation by entering some coordinates. Only workaround is to pre-fill the dialog with own coordinates (if available) version: 1a961ab

report.summary: GeopointParser produces incorrect results
report.label: Bug
report.description: In some cases the parser produces incorrect results when parsing a coordinate string like "N 49° 56.031", something the formatter happily and correctly produces given the correct input 49 + 56.031*60 = 49.93385. I have created a test case for it, but as it has to do with regex I suppose somebody else will be able to fix it faster then me.

report.summary: Waypoint editing broken
report.label: Bug
report.description: I tried to change a waypoint, now it ist GONE! All the comments are deleted and the name is overwitten by "waypoint 1". This was a Multicahce with 4 Waypoints and Point 3 is overwritten (I only tried to put in some coords...) I tried to create a new waypoint and tried to give it the coordinates: N49 11,929 E008 09,357 but it ALWAYS changes this to N49 11,933 E008 09,350 ? This is with the new version from 15.09.2011 I really would like to change back to the C:GEO Version from 26.08.2011 :( Edit: typos

report.summary: Hints are no longer shown

report.label: Bug
report.description: Import caches from oc and then delete them They stay on map.

report.summary: Storing caches offline
report.label: Bug
report.description: Recently when storing a cache for offline us I had problems I select store, it then brings up a box 'saving cache for offline use....' and goes no further, I can back out of it, and can use the home button to do something else, but c:geo is stuck on that screen. Old way to restore c:geo is to power off the phone and back on again. Once up and running the stored cache is there and available for use.

report.summary: Login does not work on Honeycomb tablet
report.label: Bug
report.description: With todays market version and nightly 1709 cgeo reports it can not login with my eeepad android 3.2. Also trying manual in settings only reports that gc.com is not reachable It was working with older versions, but howeverI have none to test it. Using my phone with Android 2.3 everything is OK, same network, same version, same time. Can someone please doublecheck with a tablet ? Regards, Lineflyer

report.summary: Position inaccuracy
report.label: Bug
report.description: We've just used c:geo in anger for the first time over the weekend. A brilliant app (Thank you!). There seems to be a strange issue with GPS accuracy. We have a premium account and were correctly loggged in. However, c:geo consitently gets the cache position wrong by 30-40 metres. This applies for both the compass and the maps (live map and locus). The system recognises where we are perfectly but messes up with the cache position. However, very strnagely, the downloaded static map gets the cache position perfectly (but we cannot navigate on these tiles!) For instance at GC2ZRG4 the cache is next to the main path (as seen on google maps and as found by us). The static map also shows it there. The live map shows our own position correctly but both the compass and c:geo map point us 30 metres off the path. This happened consistently with every cache we did so we ended up just having to use the Garmin...... We are running the most up to date version of c:geo on a HTC HD2 which is currently running Core Droid Desire HD Froyo v 1.7. Any solutions The Sweeney Toddlers

report.summary: Force Close when touching Live Map button.
report.label: Bug
report.description: I am running version 16.09.2011 on a Samsung Continuum running Froyo 2.2.2. Everything seems to work fine except, when I touch the Live Maps button (which is kinda the core of this program), the app force closes immediately. c:geo also FC's when clicking "show on map" from within a cache description. Let me know what information you might need from me. I can u/l a logcat file is you need that as well.

report.summary: Help HTML not opening on Android versions 3 and 4
report.label: Bug
report.description: I have installed c:geo nightly 20.09. and the help-app from markt on my Asus Transformer. If I try to open the help (e.g. from main screen) it only shows "Please wait" and a failure message in the background. If I deinstall the help-app the help-button works correctly (going to online-help via Brwoser). On my phone the same versions are running well with offline-help. Screenshot follows

report.summary: Waypoints sometimes replaced by "unknown"
report.label: Bug
report.description: Today I went caching with the market version 24.09. and encountered that waypoint sometimes get lost. I found a way to reproduce: Search for caches (e.g. by adress) which are not in the database Select a cache with waypoints and store it (the waypoints are correctly shown up to now End c:geo Start c:geo again and do the same search as before (e.g. by adress) Select the previously saved cache from the results Select one of its waypoints and it shows "Unbekannte Koordinaten" with the red-dot symbol Refresh the cache-details Waypoints are OK again There may be other ways to have this error (e.g. when selecting the cache from saved list), but I found only this one reproducibly. Regards, Lineflyer

report.summary: live map
report.label: Bug
report.description: Ive been using this app for a couple wks now and has been great up until today when i select live map it works but wont show any cache i travelled throught a coulpe towns today and nothing shown. ive tried unistalling and reloading still nothing is there anything you might be able to help me out with this thank you.

report.summary: Found caches not always properly hidden
report.label: Bug
report.description: Sometimes, found caches are still shown on the map (with exclude found caches option turned on - naturally). This seems to be somewhat related to the loading process not being complete. As if the filter is applied AFTER all caches in the view have been loaded. Not entirely sure, but i believe it also happened after the view was completely updated. The caches aren't even marked by smilies. This is particulary problematic when you are moving the map around much, exploring the area. I believe there was a bug some time ago that the found-filter sometimes stopped working at all. A workaround was to disable->goto map and re-enabled the option (also not entirely sure about that). Could be some problem with already "cached cashes" too?! Regards, Rev

report.summary: Extra HTML in cache location
report.label: Bug
report.description: Some caches (but not all) seem to include an extra

report.summary: wrongly logged error when logging with TB
report.label: Bug
report.description: If you open the log cache activity without holding a trackable in your GC account, an error is logged in the system log. This is because the parsing expects the table with the trackables to be there always. I would like to fix that, but for a good test driven change I first need test data, that is a logging web page with trackables. Can someone who currently has at least one TB in his account, please open a web page to post a log on an arbitrary cache (http://www.geocaching.com/seek/log.aspx?ID=****) , save that web page and commit it into the repo or send via mail? I don't really want to hunt some caches now just to implement that fix. :) Alternatively you may also take the issue and fix it yourself...

report.summary: Ever increasing directory on sdcard
report.label: Bug
report.description: It looks like the directory /sdcard/.cgeo contains lots of cache/trackable jpeg pictures that are never cleaned up. Shouldn't those be cleared when they get out of the database?

report.summary: OSM map file will not be found in .cgeo directory
report.label: Bug
report.description: If you download a offline map from mapsforge.org and put it in /sdcard/.cgeo directroy it will not be found if you press the 3-dot-button under Settings->Map sources. Creating a new dir it works. Because of the dot in .cgeo?

report.summary: Incorrect storage time in cache details
report.label: Bug
report.description: I can not tell the specific error, but often the storage time in the cache-details ("Stored in device x days ago") can not be correct. I recognized sometimes that e.g. the las log shown was from 10 days ago and the storage time said 1 day ago. After refreshing I can see new logs older than 1 day. In general the days shown often are less than the real last save date. Mabe there is some operaation resetting the value although the cache details have not been updated. This might be in conjunction with updating the app (by instllaing nightly builds) but I am not sure. If I find a way to reproduce I will post it.

report.summary: Pictures disepear once loaded for external use
report.label: Bug
report.description: Since yesterday I lost downloaded pictures in the spoiler and in the logs... When I refresh it works a few minutes and when I load new caches they dissapeared again.... It's the first time it happens since month I use C-GEO. Could you check and Help ?

report.description: Noted in the development version when GC.com changed its login variables: the login error was in the log, but success (without the avatar) was reported on the screen. Maybe a forgotten corner case of #602, will investigate.

report.summary: GSAK GPX Import - No child waypoints parsed
report.label: Bug
report.description: Hi, when I export a bunch (e.g. 500 Caches) from GSAK to a GPX File (v 1.0 or v 1.1) and import it to c:geo, no childwaypoints are imported. The rest of the information is fine. To narrow the error down: When I import a single cache (direct GPX from GC or exported via GSAK) the child waypoint is parsed correctly and also shows on the map. But it doesn't work with a GPX file that contains multiple caches. I can provide you with sample GPX files for testing. Thanks for your work John

report.summary: FC in getView
report.label: Bug
report.description: 10-16 08:47:35.521 E/AndroidRuntime(5341): at cgeo.geocaching.cgCacheListAdapter.getView(cgCacheListAdapter.java:488) 10-16 08:47:35.525 W/ActivityManager(190): Force finishing activity cgeo.geocaching/.cgeocaches

report.summary: FC in Progress.dismiss
report.label: Bug
report.description: 10-16 08:41:57.494 E/AndroidRuntime(5139): at cgeo.geocaching.activity.Progress.dismiss(Progress.java:15) 10-16 08:41:57.494 E/AndroidRuntime(5139): at cgeo.geocaching.cgeodetail.setView(cgeodetail.java:1085) 10-16 08:41:57.494 E/AndroidRuntime(5139): at cgeo.geocaching.cgeodetail.access$400(cgeodetail.java:74) 10-16 08:41:57.494 E/AndroidRuntime(5139): at cgeo.geocaching.cgeodetail$4.handleMessage(cgeodetail.java:188) 10-16 08:41:57.599 W/ActivityManager(190): Force finishing activity cgeo.geocaching/.cgeodetail I think there are several things to fix in Progress: methods should be made synchronized because when using background tasks several things can happen simultaneously if the user goes back and reenters a cache details activity for example Progress.show should take a handler rather than a boolean cancelable to install the proper handler in this case (which will ultimately dismiss the dialog before letting another activity / background task use it) in Progress.dismiss, dialog should be set to null in any case A better fix would probably not to have a static Progress but to have a Progress instance as a field in cgeodetail.

report.summary: Bad dialog entries when user cannot be located
report.label: Bug
report.description: If the user cannot be located at all and uses "search / coordinates", the initial dialog presented to it ignores the mode of coordinates selection (plain, degrees, deg+min, deg+min+sec) and display the wrong fields. I'll fix this in the release branch.

report.summary: Zooming out too much may confuse c:geo
report.label: Bug
report.description: Google Maps seems not to restrict itself to the range of longitude we deem acceptable. For example, look at a cache, zoom out until you see the whole earth, and you might get: E/cgeo (11001): cgMapView.draw: cgeo.geocaching.geopoint.Geopoint$MalformedCoordinateException: malformed longitude: -335.1517 This can even go further as in: E/cgeo (11001): cgMapView.draw: cgeo.geocaching.geopoint.Geopoint$MalformedCoordinateException: malformed longitude: -560.1517 where you see the whole Earth several times on your screen. We should fix this in two parts: Geopoint should take care of the modulo operation and accept any longitude as valid when it comes from microdegrees. We should not allow zoom levels allowing the representation of the whole earth as we are not ready to deal (in live map for example) with physical earth locations being present several times on the displayed map.

report.summary: Resume refreshing after FC
report.label: Bug
report.description: From email: I still offering feature "RESUME" The idea for Manage -> Refresh All. After every succsessfull cache downloading put its number (just number in cgeo, not the name) into some file at the disk. If in time of download cgeo is crashes, user could start cgeo againg, then choose Manage -> Resume Refresh All to start downloading not from the 1-st cache, but from last downloaded. As I see it will be a solution for this issue. Every can download GPX file, and Refresh it again and again :) This is something between bug, refactoring and future request. What do you think?

report.summary: Trackable names display changes
report.label: Bug
report.description: Following the update of gc.com, trackable names are now displayed into a h2 section with a class information. I fixed the regex in both the release and master branch (6c1d069). Closing, it is just for further reference.

report.summary: Do not check bounds when creating Geopoint
report.label: Bug
report.description: As we generalize the use of Geopoint, we get it by the fact that Google Location objects are not always in the expected bounds. In particular, our current adjustments are probably wrong when dealing with a viewport which encompasses the 180° meridian. Any latitude and longitude should be accepted. Since we use Android methods to compute distances and bearings, we do not have to deal ourselves with wrap around and such.

report.summary: NullPointerException on login without network
report.label: Bug
report.description: When trying to login and there is no network, a NPE occurs (loginResponse is null in cgBase,454)

report.summary: cache details options menu does not adapt to changes
report.label: Bug
report.description: Refreshing the cache may completely change its properties. The menu currently stays as on first opening the cache.

report.summary: Go4Cache UI hardcoded English
report.label: Bug
report.description: All Go4Cache UI strings are currently hardcoded.

report.summary: Enabling waypoints in Maps and tapping on Geocache marker brings up Waypoint instead
report.label: Bug
report.description: This seems to be a problem with the OSM offline map view: if waypoints are shown on a map and a waypoint happen to be near the geocache it is associated with (such as a Parking waypoint), then tapping on the geocache marker brings up the waypoint instead, albeit it is layered below the geocache marker and thus not shown. Similar, if multiple waypoints and/or geocache markers are in close proximity the layering of the display is the inverse of the hit-test layering: the user taps on the topmost marker, but c:geo detects the lowestmost marker instead. Probably both issues are related, thus I filed them together in a single issue.

report.summary: Cache details cannot be loaded from gc.com webpage listing
report.label: Bug
report.description: When I browse a gc.com listing in my browser and selects a cache you get the option to open it in cgeo. After selecting cgeo loading starts but quickly fails with message from text label "err_dwld_details_failed". No error message in log. If you load the cache from cgeo live map once, then opening the same cache from browser is successful. I'm using latest nightly build.

report.summary: Batch-actions for trackables not working
report.label: Bug

report.summary: Geocache-directories in internal memory
report.label: Bug

report.summary: Bad format for event coordinates when added to calendar
report.label: Bug
report.description: Hi, I found a problem related to event caches. Use case: Open an event cache in c:geo Menu -> Add to calendar Close cgeo Open your calendar application Find and open the event The "location" of the event has coordinates and is clickable on my Sony Ericsson phone. Click on the location. Google Maps will open but will not find anything because the coordinates mm/ddd are separated by "," where GoogleMaps requires "." (After editing the calendar item and replacing "," with "." then GoogleMaps will load location). Thus. Coordinates added to calendar should have "." instead of ",".

report.summary: Go4cache popup needs improvement
report.label: Bug
report.description: After some change in the code the popup text is now not really correct: It e.g. shows "Heading to GCxxxx 24 Minutes" It should rather say " Heading to GCxxxx 24 Minutes ago" Same applies also for other languages, e.g. german "Auf dem Weg zu GCxxxx 24 Minuten" to "Auf dem Weg zu GCxxxx vor 24 Minuten".

report.summary: import GPX without ImportActivity
report.label: Bug
report.description: As discussed in #823, there is still an issue with the GPX import (activity being destroyed at a bad time). This could be solved by importing the GPX file directly in the main activity (or the cache list activity respectively). Would solve that activity leaking problem and also make the screen "a bit more colored" during the import operation. :)

report.summary: Compass cpu-usage (mainly while screen off)
report.label: Bug
report.description: Mucek4 told me at the event, that the compass uses cpu-time while the screen is off. Also the compass needs a lot of cpu during normal operation (constantly 90-100%). Compared to other navigation-apps this is too much(like Locus, 5-80%).

report.summary: restore dialog after manual restore
report.label: Bug
report.description: If a new version is installed and the user restores the database directly from the settings activity, he will still get a "do you want to restore" dialog afterwards in the main activity. Probably the dialog should be shown only after the initial settings check with login data and stuff has been done.

report.summary: coordinate input dialog does not fit in landscape mode
report.label: Bug
report.description: Is it possible to use a different layout when the device is in landscape mode? The dialog is a bit to high on my HTC Legend then (the "finished" button text gets cut somehow).

report.summary: minor fault in waypoint description
report.label: Bug
report.description: Create a new custom waypoint. Its description in the cache details activity then starts with " . benutzerdefiniert", i.e. some check for an empty/blank string seems to be missing when constructing that string. (assigned to SammysHP because of his changes in that area)

report.summary: Waypoints not updated
report.label: Bug
report.description: When I edit a waypoint (e.g. change its name) the view page in the details does not get updated. only after closing and re-opening the details the new waypoint name is shown.

report.summary: CacheSize and CacheType: refactor null-checks
report.label: Bug
report.description: I have seen a strange thing, which is hard to describe (NB 3011): If I have the live-map activated and click on a random cache it shows e.g. in the german version Typ Traditional-Cache (Unbekannter Typ) If I switch cgeo to english (incl. restart) I see in the same situation: Type Traditional-Cache (Unbekannter Typ) That leads to the following questions: Why is this prompt always in german ? Why is it "Unbekannter Typ" because that is the prompt for an unknown cache-type not the size, which is normally displayed there. I am quite sure, that in older versions the size information was available in live map. At the moment it is only available, if the cache details have already been loaded (and thus stored) before

report.label: Bug

report.summary: move to other list doesn't work
report.label: Bug
report.description: if the internal list id is larger than 100, because this has been implemented as a context menu with menu ids. This pattern needs to be replaced with an AlertBuilder instead (probably also at other places in the app).

report.summary: global search cannot handle blanks at end
report.label: Bug
report.description: global search doesn't trim before searching.

report.summary: Spoiler-images are downloaded in a downscaled version
report.label: Bug
report.description: Actually it's a gc.com-bug, but it affects our spoiler-image-display. Since the last gc.com-update the url looks like this: http://img.geocaching.com/cache/display/ff090f89-c3e8-474b-9f43-f663e38b97e1.jpg This version is downscaled to 200 px for the long side. You must remove the /display to get the full version: http://img.geocaching.com/cache/ff090f89-c3e8-474b-9f43-f663e38b97e1.jpg

report.summary: Log order wrong when requesting friends logs
report.label: Bug
report.description: When requesting friend logs is active, the log entries are no longer sorted after gc.com. Probably the HashSet juggling in cgBase, 1298-1293

report.summary: creating calendar entry on event date still doesn't work
report.label: Bug
report.description: although I thought to have it fixed in 611db0e.

report.summary: Static maps not updated
report.label: Bug
report.description: Steps to reproduce Update final coordinates in gc.com website Open c:geo, go to the saved caches, go to the one you just modified Press update, and wait for it to finish Press Menu, Navigate, Static maps Expected result Static map of new coordinates Actual result Static map of old coordinates Notes I'm using nightly build from this morning. Also, I tired to delete the cache, and save it again, and then, when I tried to display static maps, I get a Toast message saying it can't find them. Then, I pressed the back button, to show the list of saved caches, and the cache I just downloaded wasn't there, so I guess there is also something broken.

report.summary: rotation of log screen leads to "loading page"
report.label: Bug
report.description: If the screen of the logging activity is rotated, the button for logging becomes "loading log page" again and can no longer be used.

report.summary: Inventory Page of Cache Details Initially Shows White-on-White for Light Skin
report.label: Bug
report.description: A small glitch which becomes visible with the light skin (white background, black text): if the inventory page is available, it initially shows all list items white-on-white, so nothing is readable and only the list item dividers are drawn. After the user wipes over the list items they get painted properly and become visible. This seems to be an initial display problem.

report.summary: Default trackable-log type
report.label: Bug
report.description: When you write a new log for a trackable, its initial type is "Found it".

report.summary: Also load short description in an AsyncTask
report.label: Bug
report.description: Also the short description can contain html (with images). It should be loaded with an AsyncTask like the long description.

report.summary: Smaller wait time for proper coordinates
report.label: Bug
report.description: This is related to issue #375: I used to disable GPS to save battery power on bigger trails and while its relatively easy to switch it back on, c:geo takes lots of time to notice that new coordinates can be queried. I wish there would be a "query now" or "update now" button in the compass or - which would be most preferred of course - enough intelligence that c:geo picks up new coordinates much faster than it does now. Most of the time its quicker to completely force quit the app, restart it and open the last cache than to wait for it to get new coordinates...

report.summary: Parsing cache problem
report.label: Bug
report.description: I made a new RC version and decided to try it. This was the resoult. The problem is (i guess) my personal note copy-pasted from autoresponse email on of one cache. Koordinate zaklada so: N 46° 27' 55,65'' E 15° 53' 41,68'' Namig: sem v objemu 3 gabrov (Carpinus) Coordinates of the cache are: N 46° 27' 55,65'' E 15° 53' 41,68'' Hint: I am hugged with 3 hornbeams (Carpinus) FATAL EXCEPTION: Thread-23 java.lang.NumberFormatException at org.apache.harmony.luni.util.FloatingPointParser.parseDblImpl(Native Method) at org.apache.harmony.luni.util.FloatingPointParser.parseDouble(FloatingPointParser.java:283) at java.lang.Double.parseDouble(Double.java:318) at cgeo.geocaching.geopoint.GeopointParser.parseHelper(GeopointParser.java:126) at cgeo.geocaching.geopoint.GeopointParser.parse(GeopointParser.java:60) at cgeo.geocaching.cgCache.parseWaypointsFromNote(cgCache.java:1062) at cgeo.geocaching.cgBase.parseCacheFromText(cgBase.java:1169) at cgeo.geocaching.cgBase.parseCache(cgBase.java:790) at cgeo.geocaching.connector.GCConnector.searchByGeocode(GCConnector.java:123) at cgeo.geocaching.cgBase.searchByGeocode(cgBase.java:1823) at cgeo.geocaching.CacheDetailActivity$DetailsViewCreator$RefreshCacheThread.run(CacheDetailActivity.java:1652)

report.summary: DefaultNavigation not working after install
report.label: Bug
report.description: After installing the RC from today and selecting "StandardNavigation" in a cache-view nothing happens. In the settings the "Compass" is already selected, but first after selecting it again it works normal later.

report.summary: Default navigation: map. Missing cache context
report.label: Bug
report.description: When selecting map as default navigation, all caches in the area are displayed when selecting the default navigation for a cache

report.summary: Forced English not working in some menus
report.label: Bug
report.description: If c:geo is forced to English the content of the "Navigate" menu from cache-details is still shown in system language. Some time ago there was also #625 dealing with a similar problem, but it was solved/closed.

report.summary: Logbook chronology not ok
report.label: Bug
report.description: Nightly 1001- 0c8fcf0 Open cache via gc-code search, cache is not saved The newest friend-log is shown in the normal logbook as first entry independently of the log-date If you save the cche and update it, the problem disappears

report.summary: Live map popup broken
report.label: Bug
report.description: NB 1001 - 0c8fcf0 Clicking on a non-saved cache on the live map, the popup is empty beside the cache-name. No GC-vote, No detail button, No save-button.

report.summary: empty log image title
report.label: Bug
report.description: A photo in a log can be without title. In that case we show an empty string as the headline above the image, which doesn't look nice. Example: GCBHV1, log of 2011-10-16

report.summary: Deleting an offline stored cache during relocation
report.label: Bug
report.description: If I open the stored caches, the app tries to get the new location and resorts the listitems according to that. But this takes some seconds. If I have choosen an item before this is finished and choose "delete" for a cache it can end in a wrong deleted cache, because the order changed during this process. Although the Dialog shows the right cache title for what the operation should be done. It happened some times and i don't know what cache the app removed instead.

report.summary: Crash when trying to load more caches with filter applied to stored cache list
report.label: Bug
report.description: Steps: Store some caches offline Filter the stored list, such as to just show multi-caches. Note that the bottom says "No more caches". Click on one of the caches to view it Go back to the filtered list of stored caches. Note that the bottom now says "Load more caches: currently: XX" Click to load more caches Crash There are no more caches to load because I am looking at stored caches. The problem is in the calls to setMoreCaches in cgeocaches.java. It only compares the current list of caches against the search results. It doesn't account for any filters.

report.summary: Handle missing calendar provider
report.label: Bug
report.description: At the moment an exception is thrown.

report.summary: Handle missing calendar add-on
report.label: Bug
report.description: At the moment an exception is thrown.

report.summary: StringIndexOutOfBoundsException in calendar
report.label: Bug
report.description: From blafoo: StringIndexOutOfBoundsException. CalendarActivity, line 155. GC3B473

report.summary: Refreshing stored cache can make it move to default list
report.label: Bug
report.description: If a stored cache is refreshed from the small popup window after clicking on it in map view, it moves to the default ("Stored") list. Steps: Store some caches offline in a list other than default ("Stored") list View the offline caches on the map Click one of the caches to bring up the small description window Click "Refresh" When refresh is done, hit back to close the window and then back again to close the map Cache list will update and cache you just refreshed is no longer there. It has moved to the default ("Stored") list This does not happen if you choose to Refresh in the full Details tab.

report.summary: Reliable check in search result
report.label: Bug
report.description: I have seen the following issue today with NB2301 0e9faa4 but also with older NBs: Steps: Search for caches e.g. by adress (Example: Gotenstraße Hamburg) On the result list click the map-icon (upper right) to map the search-result On the map all the caches are shown as unreliable although they are online requested in the search. Only after opening the detail for a cache, returning to the search result and displaying the map again the specific cache is shown as reliable. Is there no possibility to check the reliability in the search or is the check just missing ?

report.summary: Links in cache-logs not working
report.label: Bug
report.description: As mentioned in #1033 the not working links in TB-logs are also an issue for cache-logs: Example GC2Y6EQ , I attached a GCVote link to my log from 24.01.2012.

report.summary: Change icon in map for caches with offline log
report.label: Bug
report.description: Imagine there are several similar caches located in a small area. All are saved in a list, but the names are long with a appending number. So they are hard to distinguish. On the map started from the list all look also the same because they are of the same type. Now during the cache tour every cache is logged offline as found (or DNF) and in the list they are marked. But on the map they look still similar. It would be an improvement to "mark" them also on the map. Maybe an overlay or a slightly changed color could do it.

report.summary: Compass starts without being chosen
report.label: Bug
report.description: When the Navigate menu is selected, the compass is displayed without being chosen. (My Default Navigation is set to Map) Steps: Open a list of caches (can be Stored or Nearby) Long press a cache to open the menu Select Navigate About the same time the menu is displayed, the compass will show up. Hitting back takes you back to the Navigate menu where you can then select something other than Compass. I thought this might have been due to refactoring by Bananeweizen in 9b0459d, but the previous commit has the same problem.

report.summary: Delay when navigating to a cache in Nearby
report.label: Bug
report.description: Steps: Select Nearby from the main screen Long press on one of the caches in the list (that you have not looked at recently) Select either your default navigation or Navigate There is a delay before anything happens If I'm looking at the list and I select to show on the map via button in the top right, it is instant. So, the coordinates are already known. There should not be a delay when choosing to navigate to the cache. I haven't looked at the code, but it seems that it is either retrieving more information from the website or doing some other slow operation.

report.summary: friends log without login
report.label: Bug
report.description: Friends log is shown although no login data is given in settings. just testing in mediamarkt...

report.summary: OC-caches no longer shown on live map
report.label: Bug
report.description: In pull request #1035 there seems to be a minor bug: OC-caches stored in lists used to be shown on the live map. Now I can see that they just "flash" for a short time if I move the live map to an area with stored OC-caches and then disappear. Can someone confirm this ?

report.summary: Logbook,WPs,Inventory not shown
report.label: Bug
report.description: Since NB from 26.01. it appeared to me, that the logbook-page of stored cache are no longer available. Only after updating the cache, its available again but after a while (or restart of the app, or some other action) the logbook is again no longer shown in cache-details. Right now I can find a way to reproduce it but I am quite sure its a new issue in the nightly from yesterday (26.01.).

report.summary: Crash in map
report.label: Bug
report.description: With the developer version on my mobile I get crashes in the live map after some seconds. The version is some days old and I can't exactly say what may have changed in the meantime. 01-28 00:55:39.060 I/ActivityManager( 97): Starting activity: Intent { act=android.intent.action.MAIN cat=[android.intent.category.LAUNCHER] flg=0x10000000 cmp=cgeo.geocaching/.cgeo } 01-28 00:55:40.020 I/ActivityManager( 97): Start proc cgeo.geocaching for activity cgeo.geocaching/.cgeo: pid=4528 uid=10029 gids={3003, 1015} 01-28 00:55:46.840 I/ActivityManager( 97): Starting activity: Intent { cmp=cgeo.geocaching/.maps.google.GoogleMapActivity } 01-28 00:56:14.520 D/cgeo ( 4528): POST http://api.go4cache.com/get.php 01-28 00:56:14.820 D/cgeo ( 4528): POST http://www.geocaching.com/map/default.aspx/MapAction 01-28 00:56:16.910 D/cgeo ( 4528): 200 (2390 ms) POST http://api.go4cache.com/get.php 01-28 00:56:17.450 D/cgeo ( 4528): 200 (2632 ms) POST http://www.geocaching.com/map/default.aspx/MapAction 01-28 00:56:19.380 D/cgeo ( 4528): POST http://www.geocaching.com/map/default.aspx/MapAction 01-28 00:56:19.500 D/cgeo ( 4528): POST http://api.go4cache.com/get.php 01-28 00:56:20.632 D/cgeo ( 4528): 200 (1250 ms) POST http://www.geocaching.com/map/default.aspx/MapAction 01-28 00:56:20.870 D/cgeo ( 4528): 200 (1364 ms) POST http://api.go4cache.com/get.php 01-28 00:56:25.820 D/cgeo ( 4528): POST http://api.go4cache.com/get.php 01-28 00:56:25.990 E/AndroidRuntime( 4528): at cgeo.geocaching.maps.CGeoMap$LoadThread.run(CGeoMap.java:1173) 01-28 00:56:26.000 W/ActivityManager( 97): Force finishing activity cgeo.geocaching/.maps.google.GoogleMapActivity 01-28 00:56:27.070 D/cgeo ( 4528): 200 (1251 ms) POST http://api.go4cache.com/get.php 01-28 00:56:27.610 I/ActivityManager( 97): Process cgeo.geocaching (pid 4528) has died. 01-28 00:56:27.620 I/WindowManager( 97): WIN DEATH: Window{454ec408 cgeo.geocaching/cgeo.geocaching.cgeo paused=false} 01-28 00:56:27.730 I/UsageStats( 97): Unexpected resume of com.gau.go.launcherex while already resumed in cgeo.geocaching

report.summary: Missing offline-markers in lists
report.label: Bug
report.description: The orange markers indicating offline-logs are not visible in all lists.

report.summary: Offline-Logs are not handled in list-refresh / general bug in list-refresh
report.label: Bug
report.description: The date and time of logs are missing in the history list. The second line for each cache is the same as in other lists.

report.summary: Repeated offline logs don't refresh logdate
report.label: Bug
report.description: At least in he history list the order stays the same.

report.summary: Map location from search not working
report.label: Bug
report.description: Found in NB2801 221e215 Search e.g. by location In the results click on map icon or select menu Show on map Result: Map is shown but with some other location (probably the last used location or current position) I guess, this is also related to the other issues starting with NB2601 ?!

report.summary: Background missing for location and visual login
report.label: Bug
report.description: As found after implementation of pull request #1051: In older versions the location information had a "darkened" background like the main menu items. In the current versions the location-info line as well as the login-info do not have any background. As I am using a light background I can not see the information clearly anymore.

report.summary: Visual login is not showing find-count
report.label: Bug
report.description: As mentioned in pull request #1051: The find count on the homescreen seems to be always 0 after the feature has been implemented.

report.summary: Live map caches "flashing"
report.label: Bug
report.description: Today I went caching with NB3101 7fba2c2 and have seen the following issue reproducibly: I started Live Map and the caches are shown normal after (very short :-) ) loading time. When driving around (with my car) the map starts to scroll and at some point of course an update is performed. At the start of this reload (indicated by the progress indicator in the upper right) all caches disappear some seconds (depending on the network speed) until the reload is completed. After that the caches are again shown normal.

report.summary: Restore DB prompt although already restored
report.label: Bug
report.description: Just a minor thing: If you start c:geo after a fresh installation you will be directed to the user settings to enter your gc.com login. If you continue in the settings-menu and also restore an existing DB-backup while in this menu and go back to main menu, still the prompt appears telling you that the DB is empty and a backup is available.

report.summary: Offline marker in lists not reliable
report.label: Bug
report.description: On yesterdays caching trip with NB0302 I had some problems with the offline-logging. I stored some offline logs (just typed a few words and pressed back). The toast message "Log saved" was shown. After that the following things appeared somehow randomly among the caches: The orange marker was not shown for all caches where I saved a log but for some it worked. If I deleted the offline log the orange-marker stays in the list for all caches where I have tried that After accessing the offline-log again (back in my warm car) and sending the log it gets marked green+orange in the list I assume its related to the latest changes, but I wanted to create a separate issue to test if it is fixed after the problems are solved.

report.summary: Find count cannot handle values over 999 again
report.label: Bug
report.description: Thousands are separated with . or , and currently clipped. Instead of 1,234 only 1 is displayed.

report.summary: New live map behavior when zooming out/in
report.label: Bug
report.description: This issue is I think somehow related to #716. If I just continuously zoom out on live-map the behaviour is the following: At some zoom-level (I think depending on the number of caches or a limit from gc.com) no new caches will be shown but the caches from the last zoom-level stays on the map If you zoom out e.g. showing whole europe the icons start flickering and reloading is performed for a very long time (according to the progress indicator) With the "old map" AFAIR the caches just disappeared at some point when zooming out and no more loading was done. The current behavior looks somehow different and I don't know if this might cause high traffic to gc.com ?! A side-issue for this: If I zoom in again to a high zoom-level afterwards and scroll through the map, it won't load caches anymore. It behaves like offline (not trying to load from gc.com) Only If I switch off the update and on again, the caches are loaded.

report.summary: Problem on editing waypoint coordinates
report.label: Bug
report.description: I found two problems when editing waypoints, but i believe they are related to each other. I found this in the emulator. Don't know if it's easy to reproduce on a real device. The location is set to Longitude 13,8 and Latitude 51,3. When creating a new waypoint from current location in format DDD° MM.MMM the initial displayed value (grey text) is "N 51 18.000" and "E 013 48.000" (without °). But when opening the popup to edit the coordinates the north value is displayed as "N 51° 17.1000" ! (18.000 == 17.1000?) Create a new waypoint. The proposed value (from current location is X) Then click to change the coordinates to another value Y, press "Done" but not Save. Change the value again and the popup to edit the coordinates is initialized with value X (and not Y as expected).

report.summary: Modified coordinates not recognized
report.label: Bug

report.summary: Default navigation and map
report.label: Bug
report.description: This one is from email... So i noticed a new issue on the app. The settings that I've set up is to have maps as the default map source to make it easy to navigate. When I am in a cache detail page and want to view the cache on the map I hit menu and default navigation to open google map to view the location on the map. All I get is a blank map with no cache location. Ok no problem I go back into the setting and change the default map back to radar and go back to a cache detail page. I then click menu and navigation then map to load google maps. I then am able to see the cache location. Kinda weird that it is viewable in one setting but not the other. Thanks for the great app.

report.summary: Can't open owner details of cache when different name is used
report.label: Bug
report.description: As a cache owner it is possible to let a cache have another visible owner name than the real user name. Cgeo cannot currently open details for the cache owner in this case. Look at my cache GC15593 for an example. Clicking on the user name will open a menu, but it is not displaying the real user name. When I wrote this feature for about a year ago I introduced "ownerReal" in cgCache. This variable was given value from the link "other caches hidden" below the cache description.

report.summary: Progress indicator in Live Map
report.label: Bug
report.description: Requesting the needed informations in the Live Map takes somes seconds. It is not clear/visible to the user when the requests are finished esp. in case of an error. If no caches are shown: are the requests still outgoing ? Or are there just no caches around ? With the start of searchByViewport() i'd like to start the indicator, with the return i'd stop it. My idea is to use an counter because there can be more than one call to searchByViewport() at the same time.

report.label: Bug
report.description: Reported by a colleague and I can reproduce it with NB2602: In GC3BFQB the cache-description contains a single image only but nothing else. In cgeo it shows up empty and no link to the picture.

report.summary: finalDefined not correctly stored/initialized
report.label: Bug
report.description: The finalDefined flag is not persisted correctly. To reproduce: Store an unmodified cache (without GC edited coordinates) for offline use. Add a final waypoint. -> Cache is shown with flag in cache list, everything ok. Close and kill c:geo (a simple close is not enough to get rid of the process in memory). Restart and open the list containing the cache -> Flag is gone, finalDefined=false. Open cache details, go back -> Flag is there, finalDefined=true. To my understanding the reason is the following: The flag is set when a waypoint is added. Therefore it is correct after adding a final waypoint or after loading all waypoints from the database. But the flag (which was set on adding a waypoint) never gets stored, because the cache itself does not get stored after adding a waypoint. Therefore it is not correct after running a new c:geo instance, where only the cache details without waypoints have been loaded. A possible solution would be to store the cache after modifying waypoints but that may have other bad side effects (like data usage when caching in the wild).

When clicking on the icon the popup shows it as "Found", so the information seems to be available but not used in the live-map. It is not reproducible, meaning if I open the live-map again the situation changes or even the problem disappears. The rate is approx. 1 out of 30 for me which is not marked.

report.summary: Doubled caches on live-map
report.label: Bug
report.description: With NB0503 - 12e87a9 I have seen the following twice up to now but not reproducible: A cache is loaded at the outer range of the live-map (with unknown cache-type at first) I move in to this location and the live-map is refreshed At the end I have two icons representing the same cache: The unknown icon stays, the correct icon on the reliable coordinates is still shown besides it. If I click on one of them, the exact same information is shown in the popup (including the correct cache-type) Please see this example where the unknown-icon and the mystery-icon actually are the same caches. As you see also after zooming in and refreshing by moving the map the problem stays. The problem disappeared after closing and reopening the app. I don't know if closing and reopening the map solves it (did not try).

report.summary: Merge between nearby search and map results faulty
report.label: Bug
report.description: With NB1103 I have seen a lot of "jumping" cache-icons (marked as reliable all the time) on the live map. To that time I used the "speed dependent" strategy, which seemed to cause it. On the start I was not moving so the map was filled with the nearby search, then I started driving and the cache positions started "jumping". Trying to reproduce this, I found the following way: Use "detailed" strategy to populate the map You will get the reliable results from the nearby search (as PM) Change the strategy to "fast" and force update of the map (e.g. by moving a little) Result: Some of the reliable icons may change their position on the map (to a wrong position) Result of nearby search (coords verified with website): Result after update with fast-mode (the multi has moved to a wrong position) :

report.summary: Light skin goes black when scrolling
report.label: Bug
report.description: Version: 11.03.2012 I'm using the light skin. When scrolling the Logbook and Friends Logbook, the background turns black and I cannot see the text.

report.summary: NPE crash in History view on Drop or Move
report.label: Bug
report.description: From Bonemaro. Steps: Go to History view Long press on an entry and select Drop or Move to Other List NPE occurs when the code tries to refresh the list (after drop or move completed) Crash is from cgeocaches.switchListById because app.getList return a null list. I think the fix can just be check for null list and return if present. We don't actually need to reload the history list as dropping a cache or moving to another list doesn't affect the history list. (On a side note, it might be confusing because the user is not actually dropping from history list or moving from history list, but I like the functionality present there as it allows easily taking action on all caches you have found)

report.summary: Moving map continually increases cache count (not live map)
report.label: Bug
report.description: Steps: Load a cache (from search or stored) View cache on map (I am using Google maps, but should not matter) Note that [1] is shown in title bar Move the map around so that the cache gets near edge of screen As you keep moving map around, the count will keep increasing each time cache is reloaded I'm not sure that the cache should be continually reloaded from DB, but that is a different issue. The problem is from the introduction of LRUList in 771dc28 by @blafoo. Previously, a set was used so when CGeoMap line 1154 calls caches.addAll(search.getCachesFromSearchResult(LoadFlags.LOAD_WAYPOINTS)); it prevented duplicates from being added. But, LRUList is based on ArrayList which does not handle duplicates. I'm not sure if best method is to make LRUList based on set or clear caches before calling addAll (which might introduce other problems - I haven't looked).

It stayed all the time and the progress indicator was loading endlessly. It might be, that I had some problem with the internet connection to that time. The app was still responsive and I was able to move around the map. Also my position and trail was updated normal but no new caches shown anymore. Maybe its some problem with the mapsforge map ? I happened to me only this single time and is not reproducible.

report.summary: Bug when refresing caches with modified coordinates
report.label: Bug
report.description: I found a bug, but I don't know exactly how to reproduce it. It happened often enough to discover a few symptoms. Here's what I did: I had a multi-type cache stored on c:geo (http://coord.info/GC2TDT1) I modified the cache coordinates on www.geocaching.com and sent it to send2cgeo On the phone I chose Import -> from web, the cache downloaded again Reference point with original coordinates were added - that was good Original coordinates stayed the same, modified coordinates WERE NOT stored. Only after refreshing the cache a few times, the modified coordinates finally showed up. Maybe it's somehow related when requests for static maps get blocked by google, after you make too many requests, but I don't think that's the case. Anyhow, sometimes it seems that the refresh or re-download operation fails, so modified coords are not recognized. I almost went for a walk in the totally wrong direction, but I suspected something was wrong. Any ideas?

report.summary: Got FC with latest build version
report.label: Bug
