I saw you have done a lot of good work, but I can't enjoy it :( Android 1.6 running on Archos 5 Internet Tablet Latest known c:geo version running is the current market version (04.01.2012).

report.summary: Link to cache fails to open on first attempt
report.label: Bug
report.description: If I e.g. use the http://coord.info/... link to open a cache in c:geo I sometimes but not always experience that c:geo is started and downloads the cache details (progress window shown) and instead of displaying the cache afterwards exits with "c:geo konnte diesen Cache nicht finden". Also from the app gcwatch (with AFAIK uses the GUID to address the cache) the same happens. If I try again with the same link the cache is displayed immediately (no loading) without problems. So it seems downloading is OK but it does not manage to open the detail-view. This behavior started somewhere mid of 03/2012 and is still there with NB2303/RC version. My example: http://coord.info/GC18BDH

report.summary: Waypoints on map disappear when moving map or switching orientation
report.label: Bug
report.description: Issue can be reproduces by: opening a multi-cache that contains mutliple waypoint-entries with coordinates (e.g. http://coord.info/GC1TH7Y) selecting Navigate-Map from the waypoints screen change orientation of the device In the changed orientation, only the Icon of the main cache will be displayed, the other waypoints disappeared. Imho a minor issue, as selecting a specific waypoint and displaying on the map works as expected.

report.summary: Hiding of found caches on live-map not always working
report.label: Bug
report.description: I have seen several posts on FB stating that after installing the RC-version the hiding of found caches does not always work although the relevant setting-option is active. Here is an example: There's a switch Exclude found and own which I have checked. Not all caches that I have found but the most of the caches that I have found still show up with the smiley. I have gone into these caches and they were logged by me. When I first look at the screen they are not there but a few seconds later (about 10) they show up. I notice as i zoom in or out is when this happens. Hope this helps. I can not reproduce this by myself. Is it possible that this problem appears when upgrading from market-version to RC-version only for some reason ?

report.summary: Cache not always shown at modified coords
report.label: Bug
report.description: Today while collecting solved mysteries with the newest RC I have seen the following problem: I stored caches on my list containing modified coords from the website. The stored cache information is correct (WP for original coords, cache at modified coords). When I map the location or open the live map the cache is sometimes shown at the original coords instead of the modified coords. I suspect it is an issue with merging the data coming from the map with the offline data from the DB.

report.summary: Updating stored caches from popup won't set them as reliable
report.label: Bug
report.description: Edit Lineflyer: Changed topic to match the issue Hi! I have downloaded a cache and on the live map it is shown with the organge ring. But after viewing the cache's details and navigate to the cache it is still orange. This makes absolutely no sense. I can't find an option to navigate to the exact coordinates! Thanks!

report.summary: Refresh does not show "green line"
report.label: Bug
report.description: From email: Hello, There were some functions working in the previous revisions, which are not working now (02.04.2012 revision). Issue: updating stored cache lists not working properly. Start program - Stored - (a stored list of caches opens) - Menu - Manage - Refresh All. It supposingly refreshes the stored list. If I logged my cache as "found" using my PC computer, this function used to add a green vertical line next to the cache name and add a "smiley". Now it does not do it. It does not update the cache status to "found", either. It refreshes the logs, but that's it. Start program - Stored - (a stored list of caches opens) - Menu - Select mode - (selecting a few caches) - Menu - Manage - Refresh selected. Same story as above. No green line, no "smiley", no "found" status on the cache main description page. However, after entering ("clicking on") the stored cache main page and hitting the "refresh" button, the cache status is updated to "found" and after leaving back to the stored list, the green line is back and the "smiley" (on the map) as well at this cache only. Please, fix.

report.summary: Waypoint Note edit defect
report.label: Bug
report.description: If a Waypoint creat by use and some Text is sored in note (last field in editor) it is save correct ant show correct, but when edit this Waypoint again ne note lost formating e.g. save A=1/n B=2/n C=3 /n is new line then it is load in editor as A=1 B=2 C=2 This is bad if the layout is needed

report.summary: Wrong sized overlay icons on map
report.label: Bug
report.description: Some people already told me, that the icons overlays (pencil, disk, etc.) look blurred and/or are too large. On my SGS II with Android 2.3 everything looks fine, however today I had the chance to have a look on a Galaxy Nexus S running on ICS and there is a problem indeed. (Market version 02.04.12) This is how it looks like on the Galaxy Nexus S (bad quality pic because I took a photo of the screen): This is how it looks on my SGS II:

report.summary: NPE in live map without network
report.label: Bug
report.description: When not connected, a NPE occurs when opening the live map in the searchByViewport code. The bitmap is not checked for null before its size is checked.

report.summary: Storing cache from details downloads again
report.label: Bug
report.description: IIRC this bug was fixed some months ago, but now it is back again. When you open a not stored cache and store it with the button from the detail activity, the data is downloaded again. It should use the already downloaded data.

report.summary: Map position is not always saved
report.label: Bug
report.description: If a map view is restarted after having been removed from memory and the map provider has changed, the location and zoom information are lost because they are not stored in the Bundle. Also, if a map restart is needed because the map provider changed, this information must be transmitted to the new map through the Intent starting it.

report.summary: invalid OSM Offline Map notification and disable
report.label: Bug
report.description: Some weeks ago I installed an OSM map to save some traffic. I had the feeling that it does not work correctly, but did not check that. When I investigated today I realized that I was correct. I switched data network off on my phone and no maps were loaded.

report.summary: Coords must not be null
report.label: Bug
report.description: I can no longer load the list of stored caches (I am running revision 7a00578): E/AndroidRuntime(18924): java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: coords must not be null E/AndroidRuntime(18924): at cgeo.geocaching.cgData.loadBatchOfStoredGeocodes(cgData.java:2598) E/AndroidRuntime(18924): at cgeo.geocaching.cgeoapplication.getBatchOfStoredCaches$4ebae73a(cgeoapplication.java:295) E/AndroidRuntime(18924): at cgeo.geocaching.cgBase.searchByStored(cgBase.java:1344) E/AndroidRuntime(18924): at cgeo.geocaching.cgeocaches$LoadByOfflineThread.run(cgeocaches.java:1507) W/ActivityManager( 206): Force finishing activity cgeo.geocaching/.cgeocaches W/ActivityManager( 206): Force finishing activity cgeo.geocaching/.cgeo

report.summary: Waypoints of _all_ caches are shown when I open map for _one_ cache
report.label: Bug
report.description: I guess this has something to do with the latest changes of Keith in the maps and waypoints code.

report.summary: Search nearby caches, back -> closes current cache
report.label: Bug
report.description: open a cache list open cache details from there search for nearby caches press back button -> you are in the cache list instead of the cache details

report.summary: Stored caches not acting as stored caches
report.label: Bug
report.description: I currently have every cache within a 10 mile radius stored in my device but when I open live map they are acting like caches not store and also like first time info being pull they are displaying as grey ?? with orange circles http://www.flickr.com/photos/60422826@N02/6943505096 is this a database bug where the db (.cgeo) on sdcard needs to be wiped out and start fresh http://www.flickr.com/photos/60422826@N02/6943510692

report.summary: Watchlist state toggling not recorded
report.label: Bug
report.description: If you add a cache to your watchlist from the cache details activity, it will be put in your watchlist on the server and displayed as such on your device. However, if you go back to the cache list activity and reenter the cache details activity for the same cache, it will say that your cache is not in your watchlist while it is.

report.summary: Save from popup does not update icon
report.label: Bug
report.description: Since some weeks in the NBs the popup from live map is closed right after selecting "Save". (It seems the saving is now done in the background). Thats quite OK, because it does not block the app during the cache download. However the icon of the cache to be saved is not updated afterwards. It stays marked unreliable, does not "jump" to the precise coordinates and the disk-overlay is not shown. You have to close and reopen or reload the map to make the change visible. @rsudev: That's the issue I talked about on IRC some days ago.

report.summary: Online logging not stored
report.label: Bug
report.description: offline stored cache open details log offline --> select "log cache" in menu write text, log online toast says that everything is ok cache not labeled as "found" (details and list), no log in log page kill process doesn't help refresh cache from details --> labeled as "found" and log in log page Didn't try to reproduce yet.

report.summary: both navigation settings have same default
report.label: Bug
report.description: Users will not find that feature if we use the same default. I suggest to change the long press default to map instead of compass.

report.summary: Saving HTTP headers on error
report.label: Bug
report.description: I believe the headers should not be stored here, if the entity itself was not stored (i.e. if saved is false): https://github.com/cgeo/c-geo-opensource/blob/master/main/src/cgeo/geocaching/files/LocalStorage.java#L157 I currently experience "saved==false" quite often with my broken connection, just in case someone needs a debugging session on code in that area. :)

report.summary: Live Map not starting
report.label: Bug
report.description: Unfortunately, the live map no longer works. Tested on two machines. Revision as of 24/07/12, Andorid 2.3.4

report.summary: Lists don't stay sorted
report.label: Bug
report.description: Using lastest build. Steps: Open a list of caches (either stored or nearby) Note how caches are sorted (should be distance by default) Select one of the caches to view its details Go back to list. Caches are no longer sorted by distance (I think they are now by geocode). This happens also if you sort by anything, then view details of a cache and go back to the list. It will not be in the order it was in before.

report.summary: No context menu in lists
report.label: Bug
report.description: Since a few days ago the context menu (long press) is gone in the lists.

report.summary: Offline map not shown if no network is available
report.label: Bug
report.description: While testing the new mapsforge implementation I have seen the following problem: Select offline map v0.3.0 (did not test 0.2.4) for usage in c:geo Reboot device (so that c:geo for sure is not active) Disable all internet-access Start c:geo Select Live Map No map is shown only empty background. After enabling network access again the map is loaded and keeps loading although I disabled network again afterwards. This is NOT a problem of fallback to online map, because once the map is shown I can disable network again and can still pan around on the map through germany.

report.summary: Cache type gets lost in lists
report.label: Bug
report.description: NB 0205 - 5a36c17(did not test with older NBs): After using the live map in strategy "Fastest" (don't parse cache types) I returned to the lists and for some of the stored caches some cache-information was no longer shown (cache-type incl. icon, D/T, size). Refer to screenshot: After opening the specific caches from the list the information is available again (in details and again in lists when returning to the list).

report.summary: Zoom out zooms in on offline maps
report.label: Bug
report.description: Using latest build with mapsforge 0.3 maps. Steps: Open a map view of caches (via Live Map or Stored) using offline maps Zoom in as far as possible (using double click or zoom in button) Once you can't zoom in any further, click the zoom out button The map will zoom in more instead of zooming out The only way to zoom back out is by pinching the screen. Once the zoom in button is enabled, the zoom out button works correctly.

report.summary: Orientation switch not OK for OSM-maps
report.label: Bug
report.description: With NB 0205 I see the following issue (not sure if it was already in before): With OSM:Online as well as OSM:Offline the tile-loading is not OK once I changed the orientation of the device. Starting hoizontal everything is fine: After changing the orientation the tiles for the remaining/new map-space are not loaded:

report.summary: c:geo crashes when choosing Drop All from a stored list
report.label: Bug
report.description: Steps: Go to a list of stored offline caches Click menu / Manage / Drop All Click OK c:geo crashes Error log: FATAL EXCEPTION: Thread-33 android.view.ViewRoot$CalledFromWrongThreadException: Only the original thread that created a view hierarchy can touch its views. at android.view.ViewRoot.checkThread(ViewRoot.java:2802) at android.view.ViewRoot.invalidateChild(ViewRoot.java:607) at android.view.ViewRoot.invalidateChildInParent(ViewRoot.java:633) at android.view.ViewGroup.invalidateChild(ViewGroup.java:2505) at android.view.View.invalidate(View.java:5119) at cgeo.geocaching.ui.CompassMiniView.updateDirection(CompassMiniView.java:123) at cgeo.geocaching.ui.CompassMiniView.updateAzimuth(CompassMiniView.java:96) at cgeo.geocaching.ui.CacheListAdapter.setActualHeading(CacheListAdapter.java:278) at cgeo.geocaching.cgeocaches.updateDirection(cgeocaches.java:1441) at cgeo.geocaching.cgeocaches.update(cgeocaches.java:1407) at cgeo.geocaching.utils.MemorySubject.addObserver(MemorySubject.java:24) at cgeo.geocaching.cgeoapplication.addDirectionObserver(cgeoapplication.java:135) at cgeo.geocaching.cgeocaches.startGeoAndDir(cgeocaches.java:1250) at cgeo.geocaching.cgeocaches.access$18(cgeocaches.java:1247) at cgeo.geocaching.cgeocaches$DropDetailsThread.run(cgeocaches.java:1789) I have confirmed this when dropping more than one cache.

report.summary: Load more caches button missing
report.label: Bug
report.description: The load more caches button is not shown in search results. Maybe it has to do with changes from @Bananeweizen.

report.summary: Refresh/Store cache progress doesn't show if previously cancelled
report.label: Bug
report.description: Using latest build. Steps: View the details of a cache Select Refresh or Store While the refresh or store is occurring, hit back to cancel it Select Refresh or Store again No progress dialog is shown, but the cache is refreshed or stored (as evidenced by the status changing when complete)

report.summary: Google Maps limit causes endless loop in "download static maps"
report.label: Bug
report.description: "Download Static Maps" from navigation causes and endless loop when google maos limit (1000) is reached.

report.summary: Navigate from "Any destination" not working
report.label: Bug
report.description: Found with todays NB 0705 - 6d99922 (not tested before): Go to "Any destination" from main menu Enter coordinates Press menu and select Navigate Two issues: The navigate icon is a "circle" but should be the "world map" The menu for navigation has no entries

report.summary: c:geo prevents phone from sleeping, causing excessive battery drain.
report.label: Bug
report.description: This morning my battery was at 100% and I haven't opened c:geo a single time. GPS has been disabled all day. After about 9 hours my battery is down to 56% and Android says that c:geo is responsible for 97% of that (battery usage screenshot: http://i.imgur.com/wMjhd.png, detailed battery graph: http://i.imgur.com/Nmb0c.png) The "Use details" for c:geo have Keep Awake at 1 second, which is clearly not right. You can see that my phone has not gone to sleep at all in this period. Phone is a T-Mobile G2 running CyanogenMod 7.2.0-RC0. It's the build that somebody made to fix the voicemail notification error, but I can test with a standard build or different ROM if necessary.

report.summary: Smileys on TB-page not loading
report.label: Bug
report.description: I don't know whether this is new or has been there ever since: If a TB-description contains smileys from gc.com c:geo only displays a image-placeholder (Red x). Example: TB3F651

report.summary: Download of cache-details fails
report.label: Bug
report.description: Obviously there was a site-update on geocaching.com today: Cache-Detail loading fails for market release as well as for current NB ! Log is probably this: 05-08 23:42:38.711 E/cgeo (30026): cgeoBase.parseCache: class "CacheInformationTable" not found on page

report.summary: Quick Navigate icon not visibile in white theme
report.label: Bug
report.description: From support mail and confirmed: The quick-navigation icon (on the right side of the screen) is not shown in waypoint view (inside cache details) if the app is running with white background.

report.summary: TB list not visible in white theme
report.label: Bug
report.description: If the app is running with white background the TB-names are "white on white".

report.summary: Zoom level isn't reset correctly when swapping from offline to mapnik OSM
report.label: Bug
report.description: Using the latest build with mapsforge 0.3 offline map. Steps: Display the offline map Zoom in until the scale is 60m (200ft) or less Change the map source to Mapnik OSM maps You will get blank map and no tiles will ever load. If you look at the log, you will eventually see TileDownloader: java.io.FileNotFoundException: http://tile.openstreetmap.org/19/465485/206885.png The problem is that c-geo is trying to download tiles at a higher zoom level than is available from the website. I believe this is caused by reusing the mapView and mapController when the map source is changed.

report.summary: Export: State and country fields both contain both values
report.label: Bug
report.description: Both values are concatenated and exported in both fields, so after importing again, you see "BaWü, Germany, BaWü, Germany". We could either have 2 fields state and country in the database (instead of 1 field "location") or just leave the "state" field empty on exporting GPX.

report.summary: Force closing when using not existing map
report.label: Bug
report.description: NB1605 I'm using offline maps. Yesterday I moved the map file from one folder to another. When I tried to open LiveMap (with offline maps) then I got the following error. (It can also be done by modifying the path in settings view.) E/AndroidRuntime(20855): FATAL EXCEPTION: MapWorker E/AndroidRuntime(20855): java.lang.NullPointerException E/AndroidRuntime(20855): at org.mapsforge.map.reader.MapDatabase.executeQuery(MapDatabase.java:247) E/AndroidRuntime(20855): at org.mapsforge.android.maps.mapgenerator.databaserenderer.DatabaseRenderer.executeJob(DatabaseRenderer.java:169) E/AndroidRuntime(20855): at org.mapsforge.android.maps.mapgenerator.MapWorker.doWork(MapWorker.java:73) E/AndroidRuntime(20855): at org.mapsforge.android.maps.PausableThread.run(PausableThread.java:90) W/ActivityManager( 1767): Force finishing activity cgeo.geocaching/.maps.mapsforge.MapsforgeMapActivity I/Process (20855): Sending signal. report.summary: History list not sorted by date
report.label: Bug
report.description: Also the standard second line is shown instead of the custom one with the log date.

report.summary: Waypoints of multicaches are not longer shown in cache detail->navigate->show on map
report.label: Bug
report.description: It depends on caches livemap threshold in settings (before this option was present all wpts of multis were showed)

report.summary: High battery use with compass
report.label: Bug
report.description: The compass seems to drain the battery faster than anything else in the app. Today I left the app running on compass with display switched off and an hour later my battery was nearly empty. It had not been completely full before. Looking at the power consumption graph on the device, I have never seen such a fast decrease of the battery power before.

report.summary: "creating view"can take a long time
report.label: Bug
report.description: When refreshing a cache using bad network, the last part for updating the view can take 10 seconds. There must be something in there that still depends on the network and is not done in a parallel thread. The preview map maybe...

report.summary: Gcvote missing in nearest search
report.label: Bug
report.description: In a search for nearest I have no ratings (gray background in rightmost icon of list). Only the stored caches within that list show a rating.

report.summary: Open in browser opens wrong image
report.label: Bug
report.description: Gc319tb when using the context menu of the spoiler image, the cache image is opened instead

report.summary: Offline log not indicated on map
report.label: Bug
report.description: I don't know whether this has a relation to #1440 therefore I open another issue for now: Does not depend on offline-mode activated or not Select "log cache" from (live)map and store the log (e.g. if you want to export field notes later) After return to the map the cache is not marked as having a saved log (red smiley) Only when leaving and reopening the map it is marked correctly

report.summary: Popup downloaded each time again
report.label: Bug
report.description: If I click on a cache on live map the additionl request just implemented is performed. Returning to live map and clicking the cache another time does the same request again. Can't the retrieved Information be saved so another request is not necessary (and it will not contain new information)

report.summary: Cache size not parsed
report.label: Bug
report.description: There is no cache size (not chosen) for all caches. Example. Search for a cache by name "kofcah" You see it's size Regular. Open it Not chosen

report.summary: Download of Avatar fails
report.label: Bug
report.description: relogin login popup appears login succeded But no avatar is shown ! In the log a 304 is shown.

report.summary: Export button text wrong color in light skin
report.label: Bug
report.description: When using the light skin settings, the Export button text changes color, when it shouldn't.

report.summary: Sort by state does nothing
report.label: Bug
report.description: If I access the lists and select the sorting by state I expected to get them sorted by Found/Not found. Is this the desired function? However using this I can see no difference compared to the last active sorting.

report.summary: Event date not shown for some events
report.label: Bug
report.description: We got support mails telling, that the "Add to calendar" option is not shown for some event caches. I can reproduce that with the NB and market-version. Some are working (GC3G86R) some not (GC3D6YH). Both events are in the future. What I can see additionally is, that the event-date is not shown in cache-details for the non-working case. That -I guess- will be the main problem.

report.summary: wrong date in history after online log
report.label: Bug
report.description: Yesterday I did an offline log.today I did an online log for the same cache with the date of yesterday.that changed the history.while it was correctly shown yesterday before the online log, it is now shown with the date of today.

report.summary: Live map does not reload after reopening
report.label: Bug
report.description: Since NB2905 - 54dd6bf I see the following issue: Start live map and wait till loading is finished Close live map Reopen live map. Issue: The live map is empty and will not load until another refresh is triggered (e.g. by moving the map). Only saved caches are displayed.

report.summary: Show Circles
report.label: Bug
report.description: showing circles in live map disappear after rotation of screen in RC I don't believe I recall that happening before Sent via Hubroid

report.summary: Waypoints of multi-cache disappear from map
report.label: Bug
report.description: When I want to view all waypoints of a multi-cache on a map, they disappear as soon as I move the map around. This happens on both offline and online maps. Using version 24.05.2012.

report.summary: compass gets stuck after some rotations
report.label: Bug
report.description: Show compass for a cache. Start slowly rotating around yourself so that the compass is always trying to get to the current cache direction. After some rotations (2 or 3?) the compass gets stuck and will not come to life again.

report.summary: Nearby result overwritten by PNG-parsing
report.label: Bug
report.description: Found with RC-version 2012.05.30-RC-dd31d83. Test with first RC-version will follow: We have the known limitation that owned caches are identified as multi caches by the PNG-parsing. This is no big deal, but it allows to track the following problem: Strategy: Speed dependent (in stationary environment -> Nearby search used) User: PM After loading has finished the owned caches are well identified (by nearby search): Zooming out a reload takes place and the owned caches change their type to multi and owned marker is gone: I guess this is not limited to owned caches, but due to the limitation in parsing mentioned above it most likely to happen with owned caches. It seems information from nearby result is merged wrong with map parsing results.

report.summary: Compass values are outside the [0, 360[ range
report.label: Bug
report.description: The value returned by the sensor for the orientation falls into the [0, 360[ range. However, when the direction is adjusted for the phone orientation through Compatibility#getDirectionNow(), a value as large as 270 may be added. This might be the cause (or one of the causes) of the problems recently discovered with the compass.

report.summary: Double tap (zoom in) opens cache pop-up as well
report.label: Bug
report.description: If I double-tap on the map to zoom in, the cache-popup opens if I happen to hit a cache with this double-tap as well. Tested with OSM and Google on 0034e35 (current release build)

report.summary: Saved cache replaced by parsed cache
report.label: Bug
report.description: With the newest RC (31.05.2012 can tell the version, my phone is broken) the following is occurring reproucibly: Open live map It is showing saved caches immediately and other caches are loaded normal (Strategy: Fast) Loading is completed, everything is as expected While driving around other saved caches come into view and a reload is triggered as well After this reload is finished the saved cache icon (reliable with disk overlay) is replaced by the parsed cache (unreliable, no saved icon, also the type might be lost if not recognized by parsing). This issue was for sure not occurring in the RC of yesterday.

report.summary: crash on import from mail
report.label: Bug
report.description: One of my refactorings in the caches list can lead to an UnsupportedOperationException in the caches list. The attachment import is the only case where the extras are not set, but the current code always demands them.

report.summary: cache size is alway shown as "not choosen"
report.label: Bug
report.description: Since last update (2012-05-24) the cache size in new downloaded/refreshed geocaching.com cache listings are always shown as "not choosen". As I checked the regexp pattern it seems to be OK. What's wrong?

report.summary: Live map warning may be displayed several times per session
report.label: Bug
report.description: Now that we restart the map activity when the orientation changes, the live map warning may be displayed when we rotate the screen even if it has just been displayed. We can either display the warning once, and then remove it, or allow it to be displayed once per c:geo launch only.

report.summary: export gpx
report.label: Bug
report.description: export gpx gets to about 3% then stops saying expot failed. cheers

report.summary: Offline logging does not work from cache details
report.label: Bug
report.description: Steps: In settings set to Log Offline Open cache details for a cache From menu, select Log Offline Nothing happens I think the refactoring by @Bananeweizen in b8b1121 is the source as a function in NavigationAppFactory that used to return true or false now always returns true which disrupts logic in CacheDetailActivity.onOptionsItemSelected

report.summary: Refreshing from "All caches" list will lose the list id
report.label: Bug
report.description: Seen on Facebook, and reproduced here: if you refresh all the caches while in the "All caches" pseudo-list, then your lists will be emptied. This is an unfortunate side effect of the "All caches" implementation. This should be fixed in the release branch.

report.summary: Filter applied to single cache request
report.label: Bug
report.description: When you scan a QR-Code of an Multi-Cache while Filter-Settings are set to Traditional you get an errormessage "Cache not found". Filter must be set to either Multi-Cache or All Caches for scan to work. (renamed from "QR scan does not work if filter set")

report.summary: Network operation on UI thread
report.label: Bug
report.description: A network request may be done from the UI thread when creating a cgeovisit (now renamed into VisitCacheActivity) if the template contains [NUMBER]: at org.apache.http.impl.client.AbstractHttpClient.execute(AbstractHttpClient.java:465) at cgeo.geocaching.cgBase.doRequest(cgBase.java:2908) at cgeo.geocaching.cgBase.request(cgBase.java:2889) at cgeo.geocaching.cgBase.request(cgBase.java:2880) at cgeo.geocaching.cgBase.request(cgBase.java:2801) at cgeo.geocaching.LogTemplateProvider$5.getValue(LogTemplateProvider.java:88) at cgeo.geocaching.LogTemplateProvider$LogTemplate.apply(LogTemplateProvider.java:40) at cgeo.geocaching.LogTemplateProvider.applyTemplates(LogTemplateProvider.java:117) at cgeo.geocaching.cgeovisit.init(cgeovisit.java:462) at cgeo.geocaching.cgeovisit.onCreate(cgeovisit.java:244) This may lead to Application Not Responding errors. Edit 2014-08-12: this also leads to crashes with recent Android versions which do not allow this kind of operation to happen on the UI thread, see later comment.

report.summary: send2c:geo problems with new "list all" feature
report.label: Bug
report.description: If the List "All" is opened while importing caches with send2c:geo the imported caches will not show up in any list except in the new "All" list. It is quite inconvenient to manually move these caches into the standard list if you have quite a large number of caches. Perhaps should be moved automatically into another list, if you download them while beeing in the "All" list. Keep up the good work! Best regards, Kratergecko

report.summary: Date display truncated in Logbook
report.label: Bug
report.description: You cannot see the full date for a log in Logbook. It should read "02-06-2012" but the year is truncated and only read "02-06-20."

report.summary: Login message not shown
report.label: Bug
report.description: When starting c:geo after killing the process, the login message is not shown anymore on the homescreen:

report.summary: User log replaces existing logs
report.label: Bug
report.description: Using master (it would be great if someone could check with the release as well), I noticed this week-end that when I logged a cache, the existing logs disappeared and only mine stayed until I refreshed the cache (and found mine + previous logs back).

report.summary: New version notification in landscape mode
report.label: Bug
report.description: "New release available.\nClick to install." dialog must be foreground for landscape displays. screen capture uploaded to http://imgur.com/e05nJ

report.summary: "Save static maps" available for default navigation
report.label: Bug
report.description: I don't know whether this is OK or should be removed: Currently you can select "Save static maps" as default navigation tool.

report.summary: Waypoint limit for live map not always working
report.label: Bug
report.description: With the market release (as well as NBs) the functionality of the limit for waypoints showing on the live map is working almost good, but on some occasions it is not working. I can not clearly reproduce this but it is something like this scenario: Live map is running while driving around A saved cache with waypoints is coming in range The count of caches on live map is below my configured limit (in this case: 20) and the WPs are shown The live map keeps periodically loading Suddenly the WPs disappear although the count of caches is still below the limit Closing and reopening live map makes the WPs reappear in this case Set "Unverified" because the described steps are not always reproducible for me.

report.summary: Filer not applied to live map for BM
report.label: Bug
report.description: With the current releae the filter (e.g. traditional caches only) is not applied on the live map if the user is basic member only. Reported by user and reproducible for me.

report.summary: Save for offline no longer available in search results
report.label: Bug
report.description: Users report, that the "Save for offline" option is no longer available from search results with release 2012.06.06 Could not check up to now.

report.summary: user name wrongly parsed/written in GPX import/export
report.label: Bug
report.description: With the GPX import and export we confuse the user id and the user name of the cache owner. EDIT: Just if someone wants to see the effect: Import a cache (from GPX) where the displayed user name is not the user id of the owner, like GC31DT7. It shows the user id then. Now update the cache online and it suddenly displays the display name as on the website.

report.summary: Live Map Show As List shows last search not caches shown on the map
report.label: Bug
report.description: When user selects Show As List from the menu on Live Map, it shows a list created from lastSearchResult which doesn't necessarily match the caches shown on screen, just the last batch downloaded. I think this is leftover from the old live map where a single search populated the screen. The implementation should be more simliar to how the list for storing offline is gathered. I assign myself.

report.summary: Live Map Store Offline not available
report.label: Bug
report.description: Due to the same logic that causes #1757, often Store Offline in the Live Map is disabled when it should not be. The cause is the check app.hasUnsavedCaches(lastSearchResult) used when checking to disable or not. lastSearchResult could be empty with the new live map, but caches still shown on screen. The check should be made against caches in the viewport. I should be able to tackle this one as well.

report.summary: Attributes missing and cache-size incorrect
report.label: Bug
report.description: A user who contacted us regarding #1751 does also have this problem. I don't know whether there is any relation, so I open another issue for that. Please have a look below...in the screenshot attribute-icons are missing and cache-size whould be micro: For me the cache looks normal, so set to "unverified" by now.

report.summary: 2 Links in settings are unclickable
report.label: Bug
report.description: It's not possible to click on link for send2cgeo and mapsforge website (more info in #991).

report.summary: Picture in description not shown
report.label: Bug
report.description: Last days it happend to me quite often that pictures in cache description are replaced by the placeholder (Pic-icon with red x on lower right) with the current market release (NB not tested yet). Reproducible with these caches, website shows it. Example: GC2XD3P

report.summary: Missing own spoilerimages
report.label: Bug
report.description: Hello! I recognized that spoilerimages are not listed in listing of my own caches. Same thing is reproducable on my friends app. Can anyone tell something about it? Thanks!

report.summary: "Import from web" does not get modified coordinates
report.label: Bug
report.description: When I modify the coordinates of a mystery cache on GC.com and then use "Sent to c:geo" and "Import from web", I get the origional coordinates instead of the modified ones. By "Refresh" I then get the modified coordiates.

report.summary: Waypoints not shown in Locus
report.label: Bug
report.description: Seems that waypoints are not shown in / sent to Locus with "cache details -> menu -> navigate -> Locus".

report.summary: Coords conversion to DMS not working correct
report.label: Bug
report.description: With the current market release (as well as with nightly builds) the coordinate conversion in cache details is not working correct. Open a cache Tap on coordinates The DMS fomat is displaying more digits than expected and provides wrong numbers Labeled high as this is a regression issue present in current release.

report.summary: Errors after gc.com update 26.06.2012
report.label: Bug
report.description: The recent gc.com update seems to have introduced some small glitches. Type and size seems to be no longer parsed correctly.

report.summary: Needs Maintenance for saved caches
report.label: Bug
report.description: I have a cache stored with a 'Need Maintenance'-flag. In the meantime the owner did an Owner Maintenenance. If I refresh the cache data, the log for the maintenance is correctly visible, but the maintenance-icon on the details-page does not vanish.

report.summary: Import GPX is cancelled by any touch
report.label: Bug
report.description: With nightly 20120627 I experienced that a running GPX-import is also cancelled if I touch the screen at any position (not only "Cancel" button). I think this i not desireabl, in my case I touched the screen to keep it alive.

report.summary: Regular/Medium cache size not recognized
report.label: Bug
report.description: If you open a cache of size medium/regular, cgeo shows the size as Unknown.

report.summary: Store for offline not working from Map view
report.label: Bug
report.description: If I do a search using a place name, it brings up a list of the caches. If I then map that location I can see where they are. From that screen, if I choose Store for Offline, nothing happens. If I return to the list view and do it from there, no problem. Still a great app. Thanks.

report.summary: log summary starts with comma
report.label: Bug
report.description: For event caches I see the log summary starting with a comma.

report.summary: Found marker lost on live map after opening popup
report.label: Bug
report.description: With version 2012.06.29-NB-fd3eda7 I found this (but it is probably present longer time): Don't hide found caches Open live map (Strategy: Fast) Click on a found cache loaded by live map (Type: ??, Marked found, Unreliable) Popup opens but does not report it as "Found" Close popup The map now displays the correct cache type but the found marker (smiley) is no longer shown The popup from live map on geocaching.com (where we retrieve the info for our popup) is not indicating whether the cache is found by the user. This means c:geo can not get new information on found-status and thus should not overwrite the found-info in case the popup is opened.

report.summary: Map not correctly refreshed after hide found setting has changed
report.label: Bug
report.description: Found in current master: Be sure "Hide own/found "is active Open live map and wait till loading is complete Only unfound caches are displayed Close live map Go to settings and deactivate "Hide own/found" Open live map again Still only unfound caches are displayed I think this is an issue of "caching" data, because if I move the map afterwards so that an update is triggered it works as designed. Only the initial data after opening the map is not updated as long as c:geo is running. So this is no major issue but just a glitch, however it is happening to me quite often if I am out caching and just want to quickly check which found caches are nearby.

report.summary: Crash on apply filter in lists
report.label: Bug

report.summary: Live map shows WPs of caches fitlered out
report.label: Bug
report.description: Found in NB2012.07.04 : Save a cache which has WPs with coords for offline Set WP-limit in settings to a number >>0 to enable the feature Open live map and check that the saved cache and its waypoints are shown Close live map Activate filter which does not match your saved cache Open live map Result: The cache is hidden properly but its waypoints are still shown which is not what the user expects Sent via Hubroid

report.summary: Filter and counter problem
report.label: Bug
report.description: From support email: It would be nice, if there were a counter somewhere, to show me how many caches I mark as found the offline-log function. When I am on a cache tour with 30 or more cache on one day, I am not able to count them all by myself. I can use the filter for showing all caches with a saved log, but there is still the number off all caches in the list showing. May you have an idea.

report.summary: Context menu misses entry
report.label: Bug
report.description: The context menu on the preview map misses an entry, probably the default navigation tool.

report.summary: Offline storage status label not updated
report.label: Bug
report.description: I have just read some caches directly from mail.whenever I stored one of them, the status label did not update, only on storing it a second time.

report.summary: Log text field does only show a single line
report.label: Bug
report.description: As reported in the devforum by Bonemaro: Starting with NB 2012.07.17-NB-9875e2b the signature text field in settings as well as the log text field is sized down to only one line height only.

report.summary: Updating cache using send2cgeo does not update coords
report.label: Bug
report.description: When correcting the coords at gc.com and then using the send2c:geo everything works fine. But, when the already in c:geo stored cache gets corrected at gc.com and then again using send2c:geo the coords in c:geo are not being updated. You have to push update to do this. Is this a bug? Edit Lineflyer: Topic changed

report.summary: clearing history caused force close
report.label: Bug
report.description: In the latest build, clearing history is causing a forced close.

report.summary: Spoiler image not downloaded
report.label: Bug
report.description: The spoiler image of http://coord.info/GC3E7YA is not downloaded in currently nightly on SGS

report.summary: Watchlist status not correctly refreshed
report.label: Bug
report.description: Open an unsaved cache (I did this from a publish notify-mail) Click add to watchlist After operation has finished the details still show "Not on watchlist" Update cache Now the watchlist status is correct (which means the operation was successful but just the page in c:geo was not updated)

report.summary: Calendar entry has wrong date
report.label: Bug
report.description: The "Add to calender" is working normal with my Asus TF101 tablet, but for GC3R0CA it assigns the current date instead of the event-date. This is reproducible but only for the mentioned cache. Using Market release as well as newest NB.

report.summary: Graphical problems in DirChooser
report.label: Bug
report.description: After implementation of #1901 (SimpleDirChooser) I tested it a little. Its a nice implementation but when scrolling through the available directory I see some temporary graphical problems which I try to describe below: While the list of directories is scrolling I can see some dark brown bars flickering along Furthermore the remains of the directory names as they are scrolled are also flickering on their original position for a second Its hard to describe but maybe @marco-jacob can reproduce it.

report.summary: live map from search
report.label: Bug
report.description: when doing a search and then enabling live map you have to press meme enable live and then menu enable live a second time before live map works Sent via Hubroid

report.summary: Logs gone after online logging
report.label: Bug
report.description: store a cache log the cache online the new log should be added to the offline stored logs Reality: There is only the new log in the log page, also killing the process doesn't help. Version: Current master HEAD.

report.summary: NPE when requesting unactivated TB
report.label: Bug

report.summary: Button in export field notes dialog is not visible with light skin
report.label: Bug
report.description: When you set light skin in settings, restart c:geo, then open list of caches -> manage -> export as field notes ... there will be dialog with two checkboxes and invisible button.

report.summary: Enable live when entering live map
report.label: Bug
report.description: In a recent commit the luve mode of the map was changed to remember the last setting or something similar. Now I see the following behaviour: Open live map (live is enabled) Close live map and go to lists open a cache and select navigate map Map opens with live mode disabled (which is ok for me) Go back to main screen and go to live map Live mode is now disabled This is a changed behaviou which might users think, that the live map is not working. I suggest to enable live by defaukt if the map is started from main screen. Sent via Hubroid

report.summary: TB: Last activity wrong in case last activity is today
report.label: Bug
report.description: On the TB-page (yesterday) is displayed although the last relevant log-entry is from the same day Example (at least for today): TB3NY19 I logged it as retrieved today but the header says Lineflyer (yesterday)

report.summary: Translate is opening browser instead of translate app
report.label: Bug
report.description: When I select translate for cache description or logs I see the following: Initially the Google Translate app is opened for a split of a second The app is closed again and I am redirected to the web translate tools of google I am quite sure this problem came in with 501fd91 as it is used to work normal just before. @Buuhuu Can you take a look ?

report.summary: NPE in async task when updating a cache
report.label: Bug
report.description: With current nightly I had the following problem today: A cache was stored on my device I updated the personal note on the website I updated the cache in c:geo afterwards Result: In "Creating view" c:geo freezes After timeout Android reports "c:geo stopped" and returns to the main menu Its not reproducible. My subjective impression is, that it has something to with the content of the personal note. Without personal note I did 10 consecutive updates without problem, after entering a personal note it appears sometimes. Here is what I found in the log following some lines below static map loading: 08-29 22:12:45.455 E/AndroidRuntime(29621): FATAL EXCEPTION: AsyncTask #4 08-29 22:12:45.455 E/AndroidRuntime(29621): java.lang.RuntimeException: An error occured while executing doInBackground() 08-29 22:12:45.455 E/AndroidRuntime(29621): at android.os.AsyncTask$3.done(AsyncTask.java:278) 08-29 22:12:45.455 E/AndroidRuntime(29621): at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask$Sync.innerSetException(FutureTask.java:273) 08-29 22:12:45.455 E/AndroidRuntime(29621): at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.setException(FutureTask.java:124) 08-29 22:12:45.455 E/AndroidRuntime(29621): at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask$Sync.innerRun(FutureTask.java:307) 08-29 22:12:45.455 E/AndroidRuntime(29621): at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:137) 08-29 22:12:45.455 E/AndroidRuntime(29621): at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1076) 08-29 22:12:45.455 E/AndroidRuntime(29621): at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:569) 08-29 22:12:45.455 E/AndroidRuntime(29621): at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:856) 08-29 22:12:45.455 E/AndroidRuntime(29621): Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException 08-29 22:12:45.455 E/AndroidRuntime(29621): at cgeo.geocaching.CacheDetailActivity$DescriptionViewCreator$LoadDescriptionTask.doInBackground(CacheDetailActivity.java:2019) 08-29 22:12:45.455 E/AndroidRuntime(29621): at cgeo.geocaching.CacheDetailActivity$DescriptionViewCreator$LoadDescriptionTask.doInBackground(CacheDetailActivity.java:1975) 08-29 22:12:45.455 E/AndroidRuntime(29621): at android.os.AsyncTask$2.call(AsyncTask.java:264) 08-29 22:12:45.455 E/AndroidRuntime(29621): at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask$Sync.innerRun(FutureTask.java:305) 08-29 22:12:45.455 E/AndroidRuntime(29621): ... 4 more 08-29 22:12:45.460 W/ActivityManager( 1998): Force finishing activity r.intent.getComponent().flattenToShortString()

report.summary: Waypoint edit discarded after screen lock
report.label: Bug
report.description: When during changing the text and other stuff of a waypoint the screen get's dark (screen lock) the changes are lost after awaking. Edit (Lineflyer): More precise heading

report.summary: Stored caches -> sort by date stored on device -> refresh all
report.label: Bug
report.description: This feature used to work and it was useful to use "refresh all" on caches that were cached for a longer time and then just abort the process, when you've reached a point that all caches were reasonably fresh. Now, I don't know from which update (i'm using nightly builds) this method wasn't working properly anymore, but sort still works and refresh all still does, but caches stored for a longer time are not picked first. Also using refresh all on a large number of caches stops by it self somewhere in the process, it is not dependant on wifi sleep policy or screen sleep - I tried running it plugged in to usb and wifi and screen do not power off when plugged in.

report.summary: export crashes on missing hidden date
report.label: Bug
report.description: No description provided.

report.summary: live map disables after rotate
report.label: Bug
report.description: when you do a search ans then display results on map and then press enable live if you rotate your device live map auto disables Sent via Hubroid

report.summary: "Attended" not evaluated as found

The log says: ´´´ I/cgeo (24492): Import GPX file: /mnt/sdcard/Download/export_20120910145541.gpx E/cgeo (24492): Cannot parse .gpx file as GPX 1.0: could not parse XML - org.apache.harmony.xml.ExpatParser$ParseException: At line 11, column 15667: not well-formed (invalid token) I/cgeo (24492): Import GPX file: /mnt/sdcard/Download/export_20120910145541.gpx E/cgeo (24492): Cannot parse .gpx file as GPX 1.1: could not parse XML - android.sax.BadXmlException: Line 1: Root element name does not match. Expected: 'http://www.topografix.com/GPX/1/1:gpx', Got: 'http://www.topografix.com/GPX/1/0:gpx' I/cgeo (24492): Importing caches failed - data format errorCannot parse .gpx file as GPX 1.1: could not parse XML ´´´ Can someone analyze this or do we need the input file ? I have no information whether this is from the market release (thus possibly fixed already) or the nightly build.

Test: Open cache details Remember geochecker graphic Click on geochecker and enter invalid coordinates Go back to cache details Update cache The graphic stays the same even if it changed on the website A manual update and deleting and storing again does not help Can we detect the change and redownload the graphic ?

report.summary: open in other browser
report.label: Bug
report.description: not sure if its a bug or its Supposed to be this way now but I have my account logged into cgeo and I have my sons account logged into the official groundspeak app and when I log my find I would then open in other browser and choose the official app and it would open but now I'm getting an invalid URL for geocache inside this official app and the official app hasn't changed since march it is because cgeo doesn't use coord.info URLs anymore and if not why does it not use them Sent via Hubroid

report.summary: Compass on Blaze 4G and Android 4+ not working
report.label: Bug
report.description: Hi, I recently installed this app on my phone (Galaxy Blaze 4g) which was running ICS 4.0.4 and it is great, however the compass is really messed up. I can basically make the compass spin by tilting the phone back and forward. If I let it "stabilize" when the phone is on a flat surface (screen facing up or down), it is showing North, where East is. If I keep the phone in my hand in front of my face, North is pointing to about where South is. I updated to 4.1.2 yesterday and the issue remains. As a reference, GPS Status is also going crazy and the author confirmed that he's using a deprecated api because of android 2.2 which has problems with Android 4.0+ Smart Compass (part of Smart Tools) on the other hand, works like a charm when compared to a real compass. Of course, in GPS only mode, things work fine, but need some movement to detect the direction so it makes it more tricky once I get close to a cache :). I'll be happy to provide more data, if you guys let me know what you need. Regards, Georgi

report.summary: Bad redirect if not being registered for send2cgeo
report.label: Bug
report.description: If you are not registered for c:geo, the website will print out something like "http://send2.cgeo.org Register first!", where "Register first" points to the exact same website again (including the parameter for the cache). This gives an endless loop experience for the user. The parameters need to be removed from the link.

report.summary: Search result count wrong on load button
report.label: Bug
report.description: Found with NB2012.10.31: Perform search for location (e.g. Cologne) Scroll down to the bottom, the load more button shows "Currently:20" Load more results and scroll down again The bar still shows "Currently:20" whereas the header correctly shows 40 From this time on the count is always 20 behindwhen loading more results

report.summary: User with one cache found is shown wrong
report.label: Bug
report.description: In logbook view users with one cache found are listed with “1 Ein Cache“ (german version).

report.summary: Navigation tools are both compass after reinstallation
report.label: Bug
report.description: Uninstall c:geo and re-install. Both navigation tools are set to compass, but the secondary should be map.

report.summary: Crashes on new "image tab"
report.label: Bug
report.description: I played with the new image gallery tab in the recent nightly builds. While it is working normal and stable on my SGS2 (Android 4.0.4) it is really unstable on my tablet (TF700T with Android 4.1). On the tablet sometimes the app crashes while downloading the images. It is not clearly reproducible, but e.g.: Open cache GC12C15 Swipe to image tab Images are loaded OK on the first try (after starting the app) Go back to main menu Open cache details again Swipe to image tab The app crashes while on the progress of loading the pictures Unfortunately I still have to learn how to take a log on Jelly Bean...so no log available for now. Due to the experiences in the past I would assume it is an out of memory problem again. Can someone elese with a tablet (high res display) test this a little bit and try to take a log (or can someone link me a detailed description of how to take a log on Jelly Bean devices) ?

report.summary: NPE in CacheDetailsActivity
report.label: Bug
report.description: I just had a NPE in CacheDetailsActivity, line 2083. I'm quite sure I've seen an issue (or stack trace) for that one before, but I can't find anymore. Anyhow, I think I now understand that NPE. The "view" field in the LoadDescriptionTask suddenly is null. To my mind, this happens if "notifyDataSetChanged" is called while some parallel task is running (like the loading of the long description). We do reset the views of all details views in the details view activity when a notifyDataSetChanged occurs, so this might also lead to problems with other parallel access to the views.

report.summary: Settings - themes folder: changes in textbox are not saved
report.label: Bug
report.description: No description provided.

report.summary: Pocket Querys import image
report.label: Bug
report.description: wen i import PQ with c:geo show a error in the creation of the offline maps. i'm using c:geo on a S3

report.summary: Link to spoiler not available
report.label: Bug
report.description: Tested with four caches (not my own) and they all don't have a link to spoiler in the cache description. This seems to affect also stored caches with the newest nightly. I am quite sure, that these stored caches had the spoiler link and picture available but now it is gone (cache was not updated). So I guess it is rather not a problem with the recent site-update but a problem within c:geo which came in recently.

report.summary: Refresh of a stored caches duplicates waypoints
report.label: Bug
report.description: I would assume it has to do with the recent changes but I could not yet start to analyze it. It seems, that if I refresh a stored cache the waypoints defined in the cache get added again on every refresh. Furthermore, if a waypoint is removed from the cache description, the related stored waypoint(s) are not deleted from the stored cache

report.summary: OSM Online/Offline maps not working on high-res display
report.label: Bug
report.description: Using my tablet (Asus Transformer TF700T Infinity, Android 4.1.1) non of the OSM-maps (neither online nor offline) are working. If I select the map while on live map c:geo crashes. From that point on it keeps crashing anytime I want to access the map (live or from list). The only way back is to change the map back to Google in settings. Unfortunately I am unable to take a log at the moment (because of 4.1.1). Everything is working normal on my phone and on a TF101T tablet , so my first guess would be that the higher resolution of the TF700T (1900x1200) is causing this.

report.summary: No progress on static map imports
report.label: Bug
report.description: Since the some days when importing GPX the progress windows for saving static maps does not show the progress correctly. The progress-bar stays unfilled and instead of percentage NaN is shown. Currently I am not sure if the map download is working at all...this has to be checked, therefore setting to "Medium" at the moment.

report.summary: OSM offline/online cards mode doesn't work with Android 4.2
report.label: Bug
report.description: Since I've updated my Google Nexus 7 tablet from 4.1.2 to the official Android 4.2 release this week c:geo crashes every time I switch from Google Online Map to OSM Offline/Online map. Let's be clearer: I can open a OSM map and I am able to zoom in or out for more or less detail but when I try to move the map to change the position the application is crashing every time. I tried both maps version 0.3.0 and 0.2.4. It was working fine with Android 4.1. Thanks a lot, Vikala2011

report.summary: Search for Opencaching waypoints not working for some sites
report.label: Bug
report.description: After a first look into the code (thanks to @marco-jacob) c:geo should already handle searching waypoints and opening the cache details for: OC - opencaching.de Germany OZ - opencaching.cz Czech Republic OS - opencaching.no Norway / Sweden OK - opencaching.org.uk UK OP - opencaching.pl Poland OU - opencaching.us United States OB - opencaching.nl Netherlands I did only test some of them before so I gave it a test with current master version: OC = Not working (No results) I am not sure if this is really implemented OZ = Not working (c:geo failed to download the cache details) There seems to be some functionality behind which no longer works OS = Not working (No results) I am not sure if this is really implemented OK = Not working (c:geo failed to download the cache details) I am not sure if this is really implemented OP = Working OU = Working OB = Not working (No results) I am not sure if this is really implemented Can someone give some more background infos what c:geo should support and what not ?

report.summary: own and found caches are visible on live map
report.label: Bug
report.description: In the last version (2012.12.03) of c:geo I have a problem with the visibility of caches on the live map. I activated the setting: "Exclude own and found caches", but it only works, if I am in the "live-mode" (live map > menu > "enable live"). If I disable the "live-mode" (live map > menu > "disable live") all caches are visible. On swapping the "live-mode" the view gets instantly updated with the correct/incorrect results. Anyone else experiencing this problems? Any questions I left open?

report.summary: Found marker on cache refresh not working
report.label: Bug
report.description: I experienced a problem a couple of weeks ago which I wanted to share. I'm not certain, but here it is anyway: My login name on the GC.com site has some capital letters. On my device, I had entered my login name all in lowercase. I had 'found' some caches through the device, and these then immediately displayed the smiley icon. I later 'found' a cache through the GC.com site. I wanted to pull down the 'finding' of the cache onto the device, to get the smiley icon on the live map. However, when I used the 'refresh' option on the cache, it still didn't show as found. I tried several times with no success. It seemed as though the login name was case-sensitive as after I changed the name to have the same capitalisation on the device as on GC.com, then on the next refresh it picked up that it was a 'find'. I'm surprised if this is due to case sensitivity. Perhaps it was due to some other setting I had also changed, but it seemed for me that capitalising my login name correctly was what fixed it.

report.summary: Premium caches not identified in searches
report.label: Bug

I can see in c:geo that when doing a nearby search premium-member caches are not identified as such. That leads to the problem (reported on facebook) that the "All Member Access" filter is useless in this case. Comparing with the website search results I can see that there is a (new) icon which indicates PM-status. I don't know whether this was in form of text before... Sadly this icon is sometimes displaced by other icons for that cache (e.g. Has TB, Needs Maintenance).

report.summary: GPS Cache Exhibit type not parsed
report.label: Bug
report.description: GC2MYM0 appears as "unknown type". I know...there are not many. But as c:geo is able to filter them we should either parse them correctly or cut down on the filters.

report.summary: Lost and Found cache type not parsed
report.label: Bug
report.description: GC26232 is parsed as "unknown type". AFAIK all of these are archived. The filter is supporting them explicitly. So I think we should either leave it as it is or parse them as normal event caches (like it is done now for GS block party caches) and remove the filter item for "Lost and Found".

report.summary: User should not be able to modify final coordinates for non-multi non-mistery caches
report.label: Bug
report.description: Right now, the user can modify final coordinates of non-multi non-mistery caches because c:geo and gc.com backend allow that. However, that is not reflected on gc.com interface and may be confusing for the user. c:geo should refuse those changes as well. Related to #2271.

report.summary: Existing corrupted databases
report.label: Bug
report.description: Some databases on people devices are corrupted: android.database.sqlite.SQLiteException: no such column: own: , while compiling: SELECT _id, geocode, updated, type, prefix, lookup, name, latlon, latitude, longitude, note, own FROM cg_waypoints WHERE geocode = ? ORDER BY _id LIMIT 100 We should detect those cases and propose too reset the database.

report.summary: Caches not marked as owned when importing GPX
report.label: Bug
report.description: When caches are imported via GPX, they are not marked as being owned by current user. Initial discussion can be found in #2304. Options as presented by Bananeweizen: A) Move the call to setOwn() from GCParser, line 377 into the cgCache.setOwnerUserId method. Then >the flag would automatically be set when the user id of the cache is set, independent of how the cache >was created (GC parsing, GPX...). That's an improvement as the flag and the user id are then always in >sync during parsing. B) Remove the own flag completely. Instead make cgCache.own a calculated property, for which the >cache asks its connector. The flag and the user name are then always in sync, independent of >changing the user name in the app. Option B sounds best to me.

report.summary: No error handling for add/remove favorite failure
report.label: Bug
report.description: If you have no network connection and try to Add or Remove a cache as a favorite, you get stuck with an endless dialog. I'll submit a PR and then rework as necessary as it affects same code as in #2331.

report.summary: NPE when opening live map
report.label: Bug
report.description: With 2012.12.18 some user complain the app crashes a few moments after starting the live map (with Google Maps). I was able to retrieve a stacktrace via PlayStore from a certain user. His scenario is, that the live map fails for one account constantly when opening, but if he changes to another account (both BM) it is working normal. java.lang.NullPointerException at cgeo.geocaching.cgData.loadAttributes(cgData.java:1701) at cgeo.geocaching.cgeoapplication.loadAttributes(cgeoapplication.java:497) at cgeo.geocaching.cgCache$1.loadFromDatabase(cgCache.java:102) at cgeo.geocaching.utils.LazyInitializedList.initializeList(LazyInitializedList.java:16) at cgeo.geocaching.utils.LazyInitializedList.isEmpty(LazyInitializedList.java:51) at cgeo.geocaching.cgCache.gatherMissingFrom(cgCache.java:293) at cgeo.geocaching.cgData.saveCache(cgData.java:969) at cgeo.geocaching.cgeoapplication.saveCache(cgeoapplication.java:463) at cgeo.geocaching.SearchResult.addCache(SearchResult.java:216) at cgeo.geocaching.connector.gc.GCParser.parseSearch(GCParser.java:235) at cgeo.geocaching.connector.gc.GCParser.searchByAny(GCParser.java:810) at cgeo.geocaching.connector.gc.GCParser.searchByCoords(GCParser.java:825) at cgeo.geocaching.connector.gc.GCMap.searchByViewport(GCMap.java:246) at cgeo.geocaching.connector.gc.GCConnector.searchByViewport(GCConnector.java:115) at cgeo.geocaching.connector.ConnectorFactory.searchByViewport(ConnectorFactory.java:81) at cgeo.geocaching.maps.CGeoMap$DownloadRunnable.run(CGeoMap.java:1215) at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1080) at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:573) at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:856) There are more NPEs exactly like that, with all user comments more or less refer to 'live map'. I did not check whether this might be a duplicate from what @samueltardieu already opened here based on market feedback.

report.summary: Support for secondary users in multi-users mode
report.label: Bug
report.description: We do not support multi-user mode (tablets running Android 4.2+), because in multi-user mode each user gets their own directories (accessible through Context.getFilesDir() or Context.getExternalFilesDir()) while we build the paths using Environment.getDataDirectory() and Environment.getExternalStorageDirectory(). The path we use corresponds to the primary user (for example /data/data/cgeo.geocaching), which is unaccessible by other users. The right path to use for some other user might look like data/user/10/cgeo.geocaching and will be obtained through the proper API calls. If this issue is a duplicate of an existing issue, please mark the other one as a duplicate and keep this one as a reference on the problem.

report.summary: Crash when leaving the nearby activity, before results will be shown
report.label: Bug
report.description: When you go in the nearby section, and leave this before the results will be shown, c:geo crashs. here the report: log see also #2335 I use a Desire HD and the latest NB (2013.01.05-NBb418bcc).

report.summary: Map waypoint popup is empty after editing
report.label: Bug
report.description: Waypoint on map is not reloaded after editing. Steps: View map with some cache waypoints showing Click on cache and then go to waypoints tab and edit one of them or just click on waypoint directly and edit it After clicking Save, return back to map Click on any of the waypoints from the same cache The log show NPE and the dialog is empty If you move the map (which triggers reloading caches from database), then problem is fixed. This is what it looks like. Add relevant log: D/cgeo(16425): cgData.loadWaypoint(715) E/cgeo(16425): cgeopopup.init: java.lang.NullPointerException

report.summary: "This description contains table elements..."
report.label: Bug
report.description: ...which can only be shown correctly on geocaching.com" is not the best for OC caches. :)

report.summary: Improper comparison of Locales when building Translate menu
report.label: Bug
report.description: When constructing the Translate menu, the following comparison is done: !Locale.getDefault().equals(Locale.ENGLISH)) This could compare a language_country pair (such as en_US) with just language (en) making the comparison always fail. It should just compare the languages. Yielded this if Use English was set in settings and set locale included a location.

report.summary: Window leaks when failing to load a cache
report.label: Bug
report.description: If you search for a geocode that doesn't exist, you will see errors in the log from where we leak a window. The problem is that when loading fails, the activity is finished, but the progress dialog that was up is never dismissed.

report.summary: Found are no longer detected.
report.label: Bug
report.description: GC.com changed icon for found caches. c:geo is no longer able to detect a found cache on live map and nearby search.

report.summary: Special logging types for owned caches not available from nearby result
report.label: Bug
report.description: I am not sure if this is a new bug (since the change of the ownership icon) we never supported it It was already in for a long time Procedure: Be sure to have non of your owned caches saved or cached Perform nearby search where one of the results is a cache owned by yourself Start logging view for your owned cache directly from result by long press on the cache Result: You will see that only the default log types but not the owner specific log type are shown Only if you open the cache details the owner logs are available (Deactivate, Archive,..) This probably means one of the following: The nearby search parsing does not return the ownership status since the change. We did never parse it from search results Its a bug elsewhere in the code that when accessing the log view from list the log types are not shown

report.summary: Global cache type filter not applied for OC-caches
report.label: Bug
report.description: If I select a global filter (e.g. "Mystery caches only") and perform nearby search or use the live map the filter is applied for GC-caches but not for OC-caches. For OC all cache types are shown.

report.summary: Empty notification box on startup
report.label: Bug
report.description: The last few days I am often experiencing that on startup of c:geo an empty notification box is shown for some seconds. After some seconds it either shows me, that a new nightly is available or just disappears (in case the newest nightly is installed). I am quite sure, that with older versions the box was never shown when empty but only visible together with a notification. Did something change in the code with respect to the notification ?

report.summary: View pager jumps back to details on device rotation
report.label: Bug
report.description: When rotating the device while on any of the cache detail pages (Waypoint, Description, Logbook,...) the view jumps back to the details page but the footer still indicates the page which was active before rotating the device. So, two problems here: In the ideal case the view should not be reset when rotating but stay on the active page The footer should be aligned Example: Logbook was active in landscape and I rotated the device. Now the details-page is shown but it is still labeled "Logbook".

report.summary: Log text should be limited to 4000 characters
report.label: Bug
report.description: A user reported on our support mail, that the log text on geocaching.com is limited to 4000 chars. Unfortunately it seems c:geo does not limit the log text to 400 chars. If a user in c:geo sends a log with >4000 chars c:geo reports it as sucessfully logged but transmission to the website is not sucessful in this case, thus the cache is not logged. I did not try this but the report from the user sounds reasonable.

report.summary: Login fail with unhelpful message on unvalidated account
report.label: Bug
report.description: If a user hasn't validated their newly created account on geocaching.com, the login will fail with "unknown reason". This is not helpful.

report.summary: Incorrect error message structure
report.label: Bug
report.description: The message displayed from Settings when the user cannot log in is badly structured. It gives something like: Login failed because of You have not agreed to Geocaching.com license agreement.. Wrong sentence composition + double dots at the end.

report.summary: Nearby search repeated on device rotation
report.label: Bug
report.description: Current master: Perform nearby search While results are shown change the device orientation According to network activity and progress indicator I guess the search is performed again, instead of just rotating the view

report.summary: Not deleting field note (offline log) after submitting online
report.label: Bug
report.description: Hi, I'm using self compiled version (now it is same as yesterdays master) and I have discovered one inconsistency (I don't know if it is regression or not, never noticed before). When you create field note (just by log offline -> Found) from list, active map popup, cache details ... it works correctly, but when you try to submit that field note ... Log visit offline -> log visit -> (loggging window) -> Send log button it depends where you start this sequence ... when it is started from cache detail activity it is ok ... it deletes associated field note (cache is not visible in list where you put filter status->offline log prepared) if it is started from list (long press) or map (cache popup) it sends log online, but never removes that associated field note additionally - field note is not clearable in that case by clicking on clear in offline logging menu

report.summary: Crash when deleting from list
report.label: Bug
report.description: I did the following with today NB 2013.02.10 and encountered a FC: Selected list "All" (250 caches on it) Filtered to Status "Saved Log" (16 caches selected) Selected Manage, Delete all This was the result: 02-10 20:46:21.003 W/dalvikvm(17011): threadid=19: thread exiting with uncaught exception (group=0x40c731f8) 02-10 20:46:21.008 I/SurfaceFlinger( 1820): id=955 Removed idx=3 Map Size=5 02-10 20:46:21.013 I/SurfaceFlinger( 1820): id=955 Removed idx=-2 Map Size=5 02-10 20:46:21.013 E/AndroidRuntime(17011): FATAL EXCEPTION: Thread-892 02-10 20:46:21.013 E/AndroidRuntime(17011): java.util.ConcurrentModificationException 02-10 20:46:21.013 E/AndroidRuntime(17011): at java.util.ArrayList$ArrayListIterator.next(ArrayList.java:569) 02-10 20:46:21.013 E/AndroidRuntime(17011): at cgeo.geocaching.ui.CacheListAdapter.getCheckedCaches(CacheListAdapter.java:668) 02-10 20:46:21.013 E/AndroidRuntime(17011): at cgeo.geocaching.cgeocaches$MoveCachesToListThread.run(cgeocaches.java:1714) 02-10 20:46:21.018 W/ActivityManager( 1987): Force finishing activity r.intent.getComponent().flattenToShortString() Trying again (with other caches on list) the problem was not reproducible. Possibly linked to #1350 or #1899. The FCs with "Concurrent Modification Exception" tended towards 0 in the last months.. so I guess the general problem of different sources changing the data is mainly solved but it seems this is a special case. I am sure that no background action was running (such as saving a cache, etc.).

report.summary: cgData.removeCaches is incomplete
report.label: Bug
report.description: It doesn't remove from cg_logImages and cg_logs_offline. There is also a TODO in cgData in another method stating the same problem. The users will have many orphaned rows in their tables...

report.summary: Archived/Disabled OC-caches returned in nearby seach
report.label: Bug
report.description: When having oc.de loading active this is a result of the nearby search: The setting "Hide disabled caches" was turned off to that time. Having "Hide disabled caches" activated I get the following output: I am quite sure, that this once worked after initial implementation. It seems the flags for "archived" and "disabled" got somehow mixed up or misinterpreted. In my opinion "Archived" should not be returned in any case, and "Disabled" should only be displayed if the mentioned setting is not active.

report.summary: Cache location not updated
report.label: Bug
report.description: In case approximated coords have been loaded (orange circle) and later a implicit nearby search is performed (strategy Detailed and caches move to map center) the orange circle stays and the cache location is not updated. Once you invoke rhe popup for the cache and close it again, the cache jumps to the correct position and the orange marker is gone. NB 2013.02.22
