report.summary: Unit test for WP hash codes fails
report.label: Bug
report.description: the settings are set wrongly and the file deletion does not work

report.summary: Open profile link and open owned caches fails if user changed his name
report.label: Bug
report.description: I don't completely understand this bug report from support mail and thus can not test it. Maybe someone else knows, what is meant here: Using the latest version. When user changes their GC username the open profile link fails with 404 error as it's not opening the users updated id. It also stops showing your own caches as it doesn't match the user ids up.

report.summary: Stored Lists Not Working
report.label: Bug
report.description: Testing Release 2013.03.13-NB-787597e The stored lists are not working. If the user goes into the lists, then chooses another list from the drop down menu, the name of the list changes, but the list itself does not.

report.summary: Waypoints of deleted caches shown on live map
report.label: Bug
report.description: Save a cache nearby to you Add a custom waypoint with nearby coordinates to it Verify on live map you see the cache and the created waypoint (live map wp limit setting >0 of course) Delete that cache from your lists Open live map and move and pan around a bit => Cache is gone but the WP suddenly appears again Possibly linked to #2558 ?

report.summary: Doubled cache icon after details popup
report.label: Bug
report.description: Today I did some spontaneous caching with live map. Zooming out to 1km and driving loaded several aproximated (orange circled) caches. Zooming to 800m I wanted to get updated coords by opening popup and going back to map. The cache display didn't seem to change on live map. But I got a second cache overlay (without orange circle) below the first almost invisible. I bet, both caches are in the list. NB 2013-03-12

report.summary: Trackable field not editable after invalid search
report.label: Bug
report.description: Reproducable: go to search page enter an invalid trackable code GD1EG8 click on search trackable popup shows failure field content not editable

report.summary: Sorting not OK after opening/changing list
report.label: Bug
report.description: Caches on lists should be initially sorted by distance. After opening the lists or changing between lists I can see, that caches are not sorted by distance initially but seem random. Waiting for some seconds the order suddenly changes to the correct distance sorting. The appearance of this problem seems to be depending on the GPS status for me. If I only work on "coarse location"(i.e. no GPS fix, but position by WLAN/Network) the delay is as described. If GPS signal is fixed the list opens in random order as well but immediately gets resorted. The distances shown in the list are correct at any time, so there seems to be another glitch causing this. NB 2013.03.16-NB1

report.summary: App crashes everytime i try and navigate to a custom waypoint using map
report.label: Bug
report.description: Everytime i input coordinates to a waypoint, and then try and navigate to that waypoint using the map, the app crashes. it will navigate to existing waypoints such as parking but won't work on custom ones, i.e. multi caches where i have entered the coords manually. I am running version 2013.02.21 on a HTC One X (Android 4.1.1)

report.summary: Log progress dismissed when tapping on screen
report.label: Bug
report.description: This was probably in since a long time but not relevant as logging was fast: While a log is being posted (including a picture it might take some time) I tend to tap on the screen to keep it alive. If I tap outside the upload progress window it disappears but the uploading process is still running (as after a while my log is visible on the website).

report.summary: Login expired after return to c:geo
report.label: Bug
report.description: I described something like this already in #2178 but right now I am quite sure what has happened. Today I had the following experience: Started c:geo, waited for Login OK Opened live map and went for a cache Logged the cache from live map popup and returned to live map Then I decided I need a warm up before going for the next cache, thus I "closed" c:geo with the home button on my device Approx 30-50 minutes later I "restarted" c:geo via the normal launcher icon on my home screen It came up immediately with the live map (where I left it) After I moved a bit a reload was triggered and suddenly all my found caches are showing up without found marker (I hide them by default). So it seems the login has expired but c:geo still loads data from the live map as "anonymous" user. We should be able to catch the fact, that the live map is not longer working in "logged in" mode before loading anything from it. Side effect of this: The caches loaded accidently remain in cachecache and thus bother the user until next "cold start" of c:geo.

report.summary: Light skin not working
report.label: Bug
report.description: I can not reproduce that, but a user of the version 2013.03.24-RC-678280b is reporting this on facebook: Download new version but when I go into settings the display is all black on black with boxes some checked. I use the light skin. Device: Motorola Droid x2 Android 2.3.5 I asked whether other parts of the app are also affected. => All parts are affected..

report.summary: Crash when openning logging screen if connected to wifi network with captive portal.
report.label: Bug
report.description: There is not enough network input sanitisation. I can look on this, but not now. The problem is, that sometimes you can be connected to wifi network which redirects all http traffic to some page, where you have to insert password. If you are connected to such wifi ... and try to log a cache ... cgeo crashes, instead refusing to log online. (I have suspection that it is something related to trackables, because it works for short period of time (you can type one word or so)).

report.summary: History sorted from oldest to latest
report.label: Bug
report.description: It was sorted in the other direction before. btw: Where's the regression label? As you can see the ordering switches directly after taking the screenshot. I can observe the same behavior in other ("real") lists, but they are re-ordered a few ms later.

report.summary: Personal note editing problem
report.label: Bug
report.description: This problem seems to be similar to but more severe as #2527 If I select to edit the personal note The window looks like this ("Reise" is the note content): Once I tap into the note window the note content is covered by my keyboard and due to the unusual window design (#2121) I am not able to move it to see what I am writing:

report.summary: wrong creation of search result in loader
report.label: Bug
report.description: We throw a wrong error message during every re-load of a cache list: 22:24:30.890 Error cgeo 17714 GCParser.searchByNextPage: No url found

report.summary: Log pictures not loading, if file has wrong extension
report.label: Bug
report.description: After opening GC42MEW and sliding to the image tab, two of the three images are not loaded. Only x placeholder is showing up. Same when opening them directly from log tab. On the website it is ok.

report.summary: Nearby search automatically loads more results
report.label: Bug
report.description: With the current RC-version I hav a strange problem today: Perform nearby search 20 results are returned Open several caches from this result (and also store some of them) After return to the cache result the next 20 results see to be loaded each time So after some browsing in the results I finally wondered that the result has grown to 140 caches without selecting to load more results It is not clearly reproducible for me, but has something to do with leaving and reentering the result list. Is this related to #2607 and therefore possibly alreaddy fixed ?

report.summary: Load more results not working
report.label: Bug
report.description: Ŵith the new RC from 2013.03.30 it is not posible o load more search results. Tapping the button at the bottom of the list only produced a short flash of the progress indicator but no more results are loaded.

report.summary: Clicking link in log decrypts log
report.label: Bug
report.description: Instead of leaving the log text untouched, opening a link from a log leads to also triggering the encrpytion/decryption.

report.summary: Light scheme in single log picture view not ok (Android 2.x specific)
report.label: Bug
report.description: Reproducible for me only on Android 2.x: I checked the light scheme throughout the app with 2013.03.31-RC2 on a Sasmsung Galaxy Ace GT-I8160 (Android 2.3.6). With my Galaxy S2 (Android 4.1.2) the scheme is correct. When viewing the pictures of a single log entry (not the picture tab of the cache details - this is working fine), the background is still black only the picture caption is shown black on white. As the menu is still usable I set this issue to prriotiy "low".

report.summary: Very close to a confluence point, the coordinate displayed in compass gets wrong
report.label: Bug
report.description: I know a user of c:geo who has visited GC40 and shot a screenshot. She was confused, as the north coordinate showed N 49° 60,000 instead of N 50 00,000. See screenshot. She showed me other screenshots where the east coordinate was wrong the same way. I assume the true coordinate before calculation for display was a very little bit less than N 50 00,000.

report.summary: Twitter UI not shown in master
report.label: Bug
report.description: I installed the current nightly build (2013.04.03-NB-05e241c) and noticed that Twitter sharing (when logging a found) does not work anymore. Even re-authorization of the Twitter app does not help.

report.label: Bug
report.description: If an Android keyboard completes a name and inserts a space at the end of the username to search caches of, this space will be transmitted to gc.com as well and no caches will be found. Search fields should be trimmed.

report.summary: "Log upload failed" error, but log was uploaded
report.label: Bug
report.description: Today I talked to a friend who tried 2 times uploading a log (including an image) and got an error message both times. Afterwards, his log entry was there 2 times in the cache log, but without images. So probably we show an error "Log upload failed", although in reality only the image upload of the log failed.

report.summary: Waypoints of deleted caches shown on map
report.label: Bug
report.description: Report from user: Store Cache Add Waypoint Delete Cache Waypoint still shown on map Not shown after 3 days anymore http://forum.geoclub.de/viewtopic.php?p=1089493#p1089493

report.summary: Disable trail on map does not refresh
report.label: Bug
report.description: The trail only disappears on next move.

report.summary: Follow up: Filter out stored caches
report.label: Bug
report.description: I just tried the patch from issue #2640 in the current nightly: I would appreciate having a possibility to filter out stored caches e.g. in search results. It works great. However sometimes the search result does not show full details below the cachename. ("GC... -" instead of "GC... - D 1.5 - T 1.5 - Regular - Offline") In this case the filter has no effects. If I manually open and close an offline cache the details appear. Is this an intended behavior? Is there a workaround for this?

report.summary: Photos in TB-logs are multiplied in listing
report.label: Bug
report.description: Using todays nightly 2013.04.28 I opened the TB33C8K. The newest log contains two photos. If you now scroll down to some older logs you will see, that an older log seems to contain the same photos (same description) which is not the case. Furthermore if you continue to scroll up and down through the logs the link to the attached photos in the newest log is increased by an additional link each time it comes into view. (sorry, hard to describe). So finally if you continuosly scroll up and down you get more and more of the same photo link on the log entries.

report.summary: OSM:Offline: After selecting new map it is opend at map center but not at the previous location
report.label: Bug
report.description: Open details of a cache Select Navigate -> Map Given the case that you previously used a not-matching map (e.g. Germany, Bavaria but the cache you want to view is in NRW) you then select Menu -> Map and select the appropriate map The new map is opened but centered to the map middle (?) so the cache is no longer in view or Open live map Your current position is shown by the marker Given the case that you previously used a not-matching map (e.g. Germany, Bavaria but you are in NRW) you then select Menu -> Map and select the appropriate map The new map is opened but centered to the map middle (?) so your position is no longer in view After selection of a new map the view should be initialized at your position (live map) respectively the cache coords (cache map)

report.summary: Popup is empty on live map
report.label: Bug
report.description: NB2013.05.05 Open live map Click on any cache or waypoint of a cache The popup opens completely empty

report.summary: Don't allow to check ".." in path selection
report.label: Bug
report.description: The user should not be allowed to select the checkbox of the ".." entry (or OK should be disabled, whatever is easier). This will lead to effectively unreadable pathes, like "/sdcard/..". While those can always be typed manually, we should avoid creating them using our browsing activity.

report.summary: Deleted waypoint on GC.com is not removed in c:geo (when refreshing a cache)
report.label: Bug
report.description: Hello, Here is the pb and the way to reproduce it. Pre-requisite : be an owner for a cache on gc.com: delete a cache waypoint in CGeo: download cache (or remove it then download it again) => the deleted waypoint is here! See cache: http://coord.info/GC3WRQT where there are only 2 waypoints on GC.com and 3 downloaded and displayed in CGEO.

report.summary: Images tab is blank after cache is updated
report.label: Bug
report.description: Steps: Open a stored cache that has some images for the images tab Scroll to the images tab and you'll see the images Scroll to the waypoints tab Click to Add or Edit a waypoint Go back to the cache details Scroll to the images tab and now it will be blank This happens anytime notifyDataSetChanged in CacheDetailActivity is called (adding to watchlist, add favorite, edit/add waypoint, etc).

report.summary: Imperial Units in Compass Speech Output
report.label: Bug
report.description: I haven't had a chance to test it, but from looking at the code, it doesn't look like the speech output follows users choice for Imperial Units for distances. Assigning myself.

report.summary: Speech ouput stopped on device rotation
report.label: Bug
report.description: The speech output is stopped if the device is rotated while on compass view.

report.summary: Link to manual in c:geo opens wrong website
report.label: Bug
report.description: I appreciate, that the link to the nutshell manual is still included in "About c:geo". However if I click on the line "Benutzung: c:geo Kurzanleitung" it opens http://www.cgeo.org but it should open http://manual.cgeo.org. In the code (strings.xml) the href looks OK:

report.summary: Cache type "GS block party" no longer parsed as event cache
report.label: Bug
report.description: At my last test (some months ago) GS block party caches have been parsed as event cache which is OK as they are basically events (according to log types, etc.). The current master is parsing it as unknown cache type. Example: GC3X684

report.summary: Crash on GPX export
report.label: Bug
report.description: From PlayStore in new market version 2013.05.13: ava.lang.RuntimeException: An error occured while executing doInBackground() at android.os.AsyncTask$3.done(AsyncTask.java:299) at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask$Sync.innerSetException(FutureTask.java:273) at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.setException(FutureTask.java:124) at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask$Sync.innerRun(FutureTask.java:307) at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:137) at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1076) at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:569) at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:856) Caused by: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Illegal character (1b) at cgeo.org.kxml2.io.KXmlSerializer.reportInvalidCharacter(KXmlSerializer.java:164) at cgeo.org.kxml2.io.KXmlSerializer.writeEscaped(KXmlSerializer.java:150) at cgeo.org.kxml2.io.KXmlSerializer.text(KXmlSerializer.java:560) at cgeo.geocaching.export.GpxExport$ExportTask.writeLogs(GpxExport.java:314) at cgeo.geocaching.export.GpxExport$ExportTask.doInBackground$5bb45486(GpxExport.java:205) at cgeo.geocaching.export.GpxExport$ExportTask.doInBackground(GpxExport.java:101) at android.os.AsyncTask$2.call(AsyncTask.java:287) at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask$Sync.innerRun(FutureTask.java:305) ... 4 more Other lines in log: Caused by: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Illegal character (10) Caused by: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Illegal character (8) User message: DROID RAZR got 1040 of 1051 exporting to gpx file then stopped

report.summary: zero caches on live map.
report.label: Bug
report.description: I've tried everything! Even removed the app and reinstalled it. App worked great for the first two months, now my live map will only show stored caches. Plenty of ways around this, but it still sucks.

report.summary: Nearby search no longer contains directional images
report.label: Bug
report.description: It's pure text now.

report.summary: Bad title, when invoking c:geo from mail
report.label: Bug
report.description: When the nightly is invoked from a mail to open that cache in c:geo, it does only show "Cache" as title below the c:geo icon (instead of "Import into c:geo" or something like that, as before). This is due to my refactoring to let every activity have its title declared in the manifest instead of in the Java code of the activity. To cleanly fix this new problem, I suggest to introduce a new activity for opening a cache from a hyperlink. That new activity would then only handle the intent, and afterwards forward to the cache details activity.

report.summary: Always use GPS for direction in compass if device does not have magnetic compass
report.label: Bug
report.description: Some users made me aware, that on devices without magnetic compass sensor our compass wont point to the direction of the cache while walking but does while driving/biking. My assumption is, that we try to get the direction from that not existing sensor (in case the speed is below the coded limit). Is there a possibility to always use GPS for those devices without having the user to select it ?

report.summary: Android store: c:geo 2013.05.16 not compatible for my TF201
report.label: Bug
report.description: Until now I had c:geo 2013.04.05 on my Asus Transformer TF201 tablet.Now c:geo informed me that there is an update (2013.05.16). How ever when I go into the Android Store, it tells me that it is not compatible with my tablet.

report.summary: Personal note is lost when cache is refreshed/updated
report.label: Bug
report.description: If you leave a personal note, Cgeo seems to save it at first, but if you press refresh or change its status for example after you have found it and log it. It then disappears and you may lose vital information whilst in the field caching! It only remains in place if you have previously entered it from the Geocaching.com website.

report.summary: Field-Notes export does no longer work
report.label: Bug
report.description: It seems that the buffered writer introduced in aea41c8 breaks the export. The file is created, but without content and in the log you see: 05-19 21:10:21.569: W/cgeo(8125): closeQuietly: unable to close java.io.OutputStreamWriter@40f622a8 05-19 21:10:21.569: W/cgeo(8125): java.io.IOException: BufferedOutputStream is closed 05-19 21:10:21.569: W/cgeo(8125): at java.io.BufferedOutputStream.checkNotClosed(BufferedOutputStream.java:91) 05-19 21:10:21.569: W/cgeo(8125): at java.io.BufferedOutputStream.write(BufferedOutputStream.java:122) 05-19 21:10:21.569: W/cgeo(8125): at java.io.OutputStreamWriter.flushBytes(OutputStreamWriter.java:167) 05-19 21:10:21.569: W/cgeo(8125): at java.io.OutputStreamWriter.close(OutputStreamWriter.java:140) 05-19 21:10:21.569: W/cgeo(8125): at android.support.v4.app.ActivityCompatHoneycomb.closeQuietly(RequiredFields.java:15) 05-19 21:10:21.569: W/cgeo(8125): at cgeo.geocaching.export.FieldnoteExport$ExportTask.doInBackgroundInternal(FieldnoteExport.java:169) 05-19 21:10:21.569: W/cgeo(8125): at cgeo.geocaching.export.FieldnoteExport$ExportTask.doInBackgroundInternal(FieldnoteExport.java:105) 05-19 21:10:21.569: W/cgeo(8125): at cgeo.geocaching.utils.AsyncTaskWithProgress.doInBackground(AsyncTaskWithProgress.java:135) 05-19 21:10:21.569: W/cgeo(8125): at android.os.AsyncTask$2.call(AsyncTask.java:264) 05-19 21:10:21.569: W/cgeo(8125): at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask$Sync.innerRun(FutureTask.java:305) 05-19 21:10:21.569: W/cgeo(8125): at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:137) 05-19 21:10:21.569: W/cgeo(8125): at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1076) 05-19 21:10:21.569: W/cgeo(8125): at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:569) 05-19 21:10:21.569: W/cgeo(8125): at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:864)

report.summary: Logbook username not matching to log entry
report.label: Bug
report.description: Using NB 2013.05.20: After scrolling several times up and down through the listing of GC4BRWM suddenly the logbook entries were no longer matching the username next to it. This means e.g. that the username "ApproV" who initially published the cache was suddenly shown as the user who wrote the FTF-log. It seems something gets misaligned after scrolling so that username and their corresponding log entries get out of sequence.

report.summary: c:geo can not log in
report.label: Bug
report.description: I can no longer use c:geo for geocaching, because c.geo tells me it's unable to log in. I cannot understand it. I can search and watch geocaches, and I can save them to my phone, but I can not navigate to them because c:geo can not log in. I can not use offline maps either. I can use Groundspeak's geocahing.com app, but not c:geo. I am frustrated. I really loved c:geo.

report.summary: Appname in Android select dialog
report.label: Bug
report.description: When you click on a cache or trackable in your browser then c:geo is registed as a potential application to handle the url. In a recent change 74fce89 (AndroidManifest.xml) the name of the different activities were changed. Previously the name was always "c:geo". Now it is "Cache" or "Trackable" depending on the type of url. I think the real application name should be displayed in this dialog. It is currently very annoying that c:geo appear as 1st item (Cache) and 2nd item (Trackable) since the ordering is alphabetical and "Chrome" is the other item in the list.

report.summary: Personal Notes dissappears
report.label: Bug
report.description: If i write a personal note on a cache, and then refresh the saved cache, the note disappears. Device: Galaxy S II i9100

report.summary: TTS not starting
report.label: Bug
report.description: With NB 2013.05.23 I am not able to start speech output: Once I select "Start speech" while in compass on my SGS3 it will only open a menu "Google Text-in-Sprache-Daten verwenden" which offers to download speech packages. It shows german (my phone language) is already downloaded and it offers to download other languages, however proceeding is not possible. Pressing back leads me back to the compass and speech is still disabled.

report.summary: ANR or crash after nearby search for BM
report.label: Bug
report.description: I received at least four mails from different users all seriously describing that the apps crashes or hangs after performing a nearby search. For these users the crash is reproducible. The nearby result does not show any distances in this case. All are using the newest market versionm, all are BM , all deinstalled and reinstalled the app, but the problem is persistent. I am waiting for logs, screenshots and maybe a video of the problem. Until then tagging as "Unverified".

report.summary: Trail on live map gets lost if phone is rotated
report.label: Bug
report.description: From support mail: Each time I rotate from/to landscape the trail recorded up to this location is lost. It would be appreciated if the trail would survive the rotation.

report.summary: Bold font displayed blurred in log and cache details
report.label: Bug
report.description: From time to time single users are reporting that bold font is displayed only blurred and almost unreadable. Logs are affected as well as the cache description. Recently I discussed with a user and found the following facts: Using Samsung Galaxy S3 with Stock-ROM (same as mine) Android 4.1.2 Newest market release Problem is not reproducible but once it occurs only force stop and restart of c:geo solves the problen I have the same phone but can not reproduce this. I am still in chat with the user trying to find out more details. So I open this issue for me as a reminder and for you in case you have any idea for that. Screenshots: Cache: Cache description:

report.summary: OC.de still enabled although switched off
report.label: Bug
report.description: NB2013.05.30-NB-cc69b7a: I authorized c:geo for OC.de and tried it for a while Then I switched off the "Opencaching use for Live map and search" in the settings If I perform a nearby search and continuously load more results, it also keeps showing OC-results Same on live map "Force stop" and restart does not help

report.summary: Posting log not possible
report.label: Bug
report.description: We retrieved some mails that logging is not OK with the release version. It could be a result of the site update from yesterday. I just tested it myself with version 2013.05.22 and can reproduce that. c:geo says "Log sucesful" but updating the cache details afterwards the log is not shown. Also on the webpage there is no new log. Feel free to test with GC352Y3 Log will follow.

report.summary: main screen status shows "geocaching.com * ", even if GC is disabled
report.label: Bug
report.description: I thought I had login trouble, looking at my phone (but it was only that I disabled GC in the settings hours before). We should make this status label more easy to understand, dependening on what connector is active.

report.summary: Trackable log posting not working
report.label: Bug
report.description: While testing the new release candidate. It seems TB logging is also broken: 15:16:52.390 Info cgeo 27677 Trying to post log for trackable #mycode - action: DISCOVERED_IT; date: 2013.5.31, log: Heute gesehen beim Lineflyer. 15:16:52.390 Debug cgeo 27677 POST http://www.geocaching.com/track/log.aspx?wid=06060e39-51bc-42c2-9a94-d8a801fc46ab 15:16:55.015 Debug cgeo 27677 200 (2641 ms) POST http://www.geocaching.com/track/log.aspx?wid=06060e39-51bc-42c2-9a94-d8a801fc46ab 15:16:55.234 Error cgeo 27677 GCParser.postLogTrackable: Failed to post log because of unknown error

report.summary: User Report: Refresh of OC-Caches not working since NB from 02.06.2013
report.label: Bug
report.description: No description provided.

report.summary: Log date is wrong after site update
report.label: Bug
report.description: The new logging has been rolled out at GC.com. Our current version should continue to work fine, but I encourage everyone to deeply check if something is broken.

report.summary: Wrong log for switch to english ?
report.label: Bug
report.description: For testing I also changed to german and tested the switch to english. c:geo switched to english sucessful but I did not see this in the debug logs. It reported 23:20:26.781 Info cgeo 9078 Geocaching.com language already set to English but it seemed to have performed the switch. Can someone check the logging for that case ? That could be helpful some time.

report.summary: Cookie problems
report.label: Bug
report.description: During my tests due to the log date problem I have seen that I got logged out while the app was still open but idle. Long time I experienced nothing like this. I opened the log page for a cache I got the error message that c:geo can not load the log page In the log I see a 500 error while loading the log page Trying at the PC I can enforce the 500 by logging out from the page and then trying to load the logpage. So it seems my login expired/invalidated for some reason. I assume this is a fault at the website but we should keep an eye on that. Currently this error is not handled. We could e.g. trigger a relogin in case a 500 error is received.

report.summary: NPE in parseWaypointsFromNote
report.label: Bug
report.description: While testing another thing I have seen this NPE in the logs. The WPs are not parsed any longer. It was working some NBs ago and I did not change my note until then. My personal note is Alte Koordinaten: N 51 21.252 E 007 02.675 Neue Koordinaten: N 51 21.168 E007 02.840 Note: I altered the coords due to security for my mystery ;) , but I assume that makes no difference. This is the log: 22:53:27.953 Error cgeo 7476 Geocache.parseWaypointsFromNote 22:53:27.953 Error cgeo 7476 java.lang.NullPointerException 22:53:27.953 Error cgeo 7476 at cgeo.geocaching.Geocache.hasIdenticalWaypoint(Geocache.java:1434) 22:53:27.953 Error cgeo 7476 at cgeo.geocaching.Geocache.parseWaypointsFromNote(Geocache.java:1391) 22:53:27.953 Error cgeo 7476 at cgeo.geocaching.connector.gc.GCParser.parseCacheFromText(GCParser.java:722) 22:53:27.953 Error cgeo 7476 at cgeo.geocaching.connector.gc.GCParser.parseCache(GCParser.java:334) 22:53:27.953 Error cgeo 7476 at cgeo.geocaching.connector.gc.GCConnector.searchByGeocode(GCConnector.java:141) 22:53:27.953 Error cgeo 7476 at cgeo.geocaching.Geocache.searchByGeocode(Geocache.java:1662) 22:53:27.953 Error cgeo 7476 at cgeo.geocaching.Geocache.storeCache(Geocache.java:1570) 22:53:27.953 Error cgeo 7476 at cgeo.geocaching.Geocache.refresh(Geocache.java:1554) 22:53:27.953 Error cgeo 7476 at cgeo.geocaching.CacheDetailActivity$DetailsViewCreator$RefreshCacheThread.run(CacheDetailActivity.java:1409)

report.summary: Multiple distance
report.label: Bug
report.description: Hello first, sorry for my bad english and sorry too if my post is not an issue and if it's not in the good section. I don't know if i can write it here. I have a problem with distances with a smartphone zopo with android : all caches have several distances for the same point. I saw this in the FAQ : The distance to a cache is fluctuating heavily For some users the distance to a cache in a list of caches or in the compass is jumping between some meters to some kilometers. You are probably running Cyanogenmod ROM. This is a known bug in Cyanogenmod 10. More information can be found here: http://code.google.com/p/cyanogenmod/issues/detail?id=6883 So you either have to wait for a fix for this ROM or change to another ROM. The link doesn't work. i'm not using a cyanogen ROM. Do you now if there is an issue for this problem ? Thanks for your answer

report.summary: When viewing found caches they are added to the history
report.label: Bug
report.description: When I go geocaching I just save an offline log on the field and then logs online back at home using my computer. The found caches is now listed in the History List så I know in wich order they were found. But as soon as I view the cache page for a cache found for a time ago it is also added to the list. This messes up the current "found but not logged" count and I have missed a planned milestone cache because of this bahavior. I have two possible change suggestions: Only include caches in the list that was found since the History was cleared last time Add a section for each found date in the list. With a counter for each section. ie: Today [2] Cache name no 1 Cache name no 2 2012-01-03 [1] Cache name no 3

report.summary: TTS volume can only be changed if speech output is active at that moment
report.label: Bug
report.description: Activate compass "Start speech" As long as the output is running I can change the volume of the output In the pauses between the output the volume change buttons on my device only change the ringtone volume I was not sure, whether this is a technical limitation, therefore I crosschecked with the original GCBabble and there it is possible to change the output volume also during speech pauses. I think this should also be possible within c:geo. Typically when using loudspeaker you may want to reduce the volume before the next output starts (e.g. in case you walk into a crowd of people) but you actually can not do that but just reduce your ringtone volume instead.

report.summary: Compass TTS: Wrong direction in "GPS only" mode
report.label: Bug
report.description: I first noticed that while caching on the event in Koblenz together with the c:geo team. Today I did some more fieldtesting with the TTS function: As long as I use "GPS + Compass" mode the TTS output for the direction is always accurate (i.e. same as shown on the compass rose). If I use "GPS only" (which is meaningful for using it in some pocket and listen only) the direction shown and TTS output of it is different from each other most of the time. I did not manage to find any logic in it beside one thing: If I am not moving and switch to "GPS only" (this will not get any meaningful direction shown as movement is necessary to calculate the GPS direction towards the cache) the direction shown and TTS output of it are identical. If I now start moving the displayed direction changes immediately but the spoken direction seems to remain as it was or only catch up after a long time. I set this to "medium" as using "GPS only" mode is pretty helpful in combination with TTS output.

report.summary: Page parsing impossible due to proxies on mobile network
report.label: Bug
report.description: I would like to take the posting from @BudBundi to the issuetracker to start a discussion: TB Page not correct load with vodafone DE Beitragvon BudBundi » 06 Aug 2013, 23:05 I have told that to some of you on the MEGA Eck when load a TB Page over the Vodafone DE Network it isn't showing correct. So I investigate in that a little and found that the vodafone proxy try to optimize the HTML and delete some empty divs and not used styles. You can change that when load http://perfomance.vodafone.de and change the settings to optimize off or in expert settings optimize html off. Perhaps that is something for the FAQ. Adding this to the FAQ is one point, but another point would be to compare the HTML-output with both settings and see whether we can optimize our parsing so that this optimization does not have any impact to it. As far as I know these performance proxy installation they usually only strip "unnecessary" HTML-content (like comments, unsued scripts, etc.) from pages and additionally compress pictures requested in that HTML before transfering it to the user. So it is somehow strange that these break our parsing. I also met a user recently with the same problem on Telekom-D1 network in Germany. So it is not specific to one operator but may spread widely with all operators using that kind of proxy. Here are the infos provided by the german network operators: D1: http://www.t-mobile.de/speedmanager/0,20641,24079-_,00.html VF:http://www.vodafone.de/business/hilfe-support/vodafone-performance-manager.html E+: Proxy introduction was stopped (AFAIK) 02: Proxy program was live but terminated after a few months (AFAIK)

report.summary: Trail jumps to 0° and back.
report.label: Bug
report.description: (sorry if this should be a douplicated issue, i dont found an other one with my seach before) Sometimes I have to switch from c:geo to an other app and back. For example for calculating new coordinates or making a photo. When c:geo is not active the gps gets deactivated. (Sometimes I even go to the home screen to disable gps and save energy.) After switching back to cgeo the gps needs one second to get a fix again. When I use the live-map I get a trail from N0°E0° near africa to my current position in that moment. When I switch between apps a few times (for example to calculate the next part of coordinates) there comes more and more of this trail-lines from 0° to different positions around me. At least it gets sometimes almoust impossible to see the southern part of the map. Possible solution could be to filter the 0°position from using for the trail or to filter very large jumps of the trail in little time.

report.summary: Strange sequence when import *.loc
report.label: Bug
report.description: Importing a GPX works normal but importing a *.loc shows a strange behaviour: After the file has been selected the progress immediately jumps to 100%. In the log I can see that the data is being imported but at the same time the static map download is triggered for each cache. After importing is done (acc. to log) the progress for static map download is shown normally and it seems the maps are downloaded once again. So the fault is: Static maps should not be downloaded during the file import but seperately Progress indicator is wrong

report.summary: Personal note edit box not ok with light skin
report.label: Bug
report.description: The background is dark grey instead of white.

report.summary: Finds not added to history correctly
report.label: Bug
report.description: 2013.08.17-NB Steps: Open list Open cache Compose log and send online Go back to main menu Access history Result: Cache is not shown in history Next steps: Go to list again Open cache again Refresh cache Go back to main menu Access history Result: Cache is now shown in history(date stamp is OK, time stamp is 0:00)

report.summary: Search by geocode is case sensitive
report.label: Bug
report.description: I am not sure whether this is a regression or was like that all the time??! 2013.08.17-NB Steps: Search for a GC-code which is already stored on your device but use lower case characters Result: Cache is downloaded from network instead directly opened from list Status "Saved for offline" is correctly shown, but however the network call is unnecessary I think the search entry should just be converted to uppercase.

report.summary: Filter in lists can not be resetted
report.label: Bug
report.description: 2013.08.18-NB Steps: Open list Set Filter for CacheType / Earth Cache (other filters might work as well) Open a cache from the resulting filtered cache list Go back to list Select Filter/Reset Filter Result: Still only the filtered caches are shown

report.summary: GPX import problem
report.label: Bug
report.description: From support mail: When importing the attached gpx file to c:geo (latest version from Android store) only 12 caches are imported. No other program (Locus on Android, EasyGPS on Windows) or Garmin device does have problems with that gpx file. File: http://db.tt/fKMDjy1h The file looks a little strange (e.g. the geocodes in it) But if it is syntactically OK we should be able to import it. BTW: There is also the NaN problem in the import progress dialoge here.

report.summary: Directory creation error logs
report.label: Bug
report.description: I keep constantly getting these kind of errors in my logs on my tablet (Android 4.2.1). However direction creation and file storage works normal for me: 22:17:32.203 Error cgeo 10096 Could not make directories /storage/emulated/0/.cgeo/GC245X3

report.summary: opencaching.pl authorisation not starting
report.label: Bug
report.description: I tried to authorize to opencaching.pl but the process fails when starting with a toast that initialisation of authorisation could not be started. I can deliver a log later if needed.

report.summary: Wrong merging on live map
report.label: Bug
report.description: WIth 2013.08.21-NB I experienced this. It is hard to describe, therefore I attached screenshots (First is the map with caches as it was presented, second is the list of the caches (Menu -> Show as list)). It is also difficult to describe how that happend. I have been in the very same map area yesterday with the live map active. So most probably the caches have already been cached. Today I returned there and opened the live map again....this is what I got. The map is in strategy detailed. Due to the fact, that there are unknown cache types without orange circle my assumption is that merging of nearby result with map data is confused somehow.

report.summary: Nearby search broken
report.label: Bug
report.description: After a site update on gc.com the nearby search does return incomplete results. Cache type is unkown.

report.summary: Cache remains in history after clearing its offline-log
report.label: Bug
report.description: Caches which ones got an offline-log that were cleared afterwards remain in the history. In my eyes that is not helpful but a bit irritating. The caches will (correctly) not exported in field-notes but of course counted in the sum of history records. You get a wrong number of caches when you like to know the sum of founds since your last history export/reset. Im am not shure if its related with related to #3081 or a complety different issue.

report.summary: Nearby search still broken for BM
report.label: Bug
report.description: 2013.08.22-NB1: Cache names are mising

report.summary: Backup failing
report.label: Bug
report.description: With 2013.08.22-NB1 I cant backup my DB. @mucek4 has details on that

report.summary: TB pages fails to show pictures
report.label: Bug
report.description: I tested 2013.08.22-NB1 with some TBs and the TB-icon itself as well as embedded images are not loaded. Example: TB59M9P

report.summary: Search result is not parsing "found" for owned found caches
report.label: Bug
report.description: 2013.08.22-NB1: I have an owned caches which is also found by myself (I adopted it after finding it). The search for owner "Lineflyer" lists all my caches but the found one is not marked found in these results. This used to work before.

report.summary: Pictures on image tab not loading
report.label: Bug
report.description: 2013.08.22-NB1: Search for GC-code GCA687 Go to image tab Result: Only red cross placeholders shown.

report.summary: Links in logs not clickable
report.label: Bug
report.description: Links in Logs which have not the url as text are not clickable, e.g. my log in http://coord.info/GC4H0P6.

report.summary: Personal note not parsed
report.label: Bug
report.description: The personal note is not parsed when opening cache details. I have a cache with personal notes but it is not showing up with 2013.08.22-NB4.

report.summary: missing login should open GC specific preferences
report.label: Bug
report.description: Due to my restructuring of settings, the "no login data stored" error message leads to opening the screen listing all services, not the preferences screen specific to GC.com. I think it might be useful to directly go into the GC.com settings instead. Other opinions?

report.summary: "stored" is no longer 1st
report.label: Bug
report.description: Report from facebook: In the Pick a List menu 'Stored' no longer defaults to the top of the menu...it is alphabetized along with all the other lists.

report.summary: Creating new list inconsistency
report.label: Bug
report.description: If you create new list by: Click list name on top Select create new type name press OK you get yourself on that newly created list If you create list by: press menu Select List Choose Create new list type name press OK you stay on old list.

report.summary: Backup date not correct after backup
report.label: Bug
report.description: I did a backup just now and there was still the date of the failing backup 2 days ago.

report.summary: Event caches not marked as found
report.label: Bug
report.description: No description provided.

report.summary: NPE in GeoDirHandler
report.label: Bug
report.description: From the console: java.lang.NullPointerException at cgeo.geocaching.utils.GeoDirHandler.handleMessage(GeoDirHandler.java:56) at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:99) at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:137) at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:4921) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invokeNative(Native Method) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:511) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:1027) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:794) at dalvik.system.NativeStart.main(Native Method) Seems to come from commit 5e67bd9.

report.summary: Light skin in settings broken
report.label: Bug
report.description: From support mail: I am running c:geo version 2013.08.24 and have Light Skin selected. When I go into Settings, the main screen is displayed correctly. When I select any sub-option, the text is not visible. I have to slide finger up or down (scroll) and then text will appear. Running on HTC Incredible Phone. For me on Android 4.x it is working normal. But HTC Incredible for sure has some Android 2.x version which I am unable to test. Maybe someone can have a look on the emulator. AFAIR we already had some version specific problems with the light skin in the past.

report.summary: ci job should not install URL in status if empty
report.label: Bug
report.description: The ci job to install a status message gives an empty URL to the API instead of no URL (when no URL has been entered). This causes a crash when the user clicks the notification.

report.label: Bug

report.summary: Coords in anywhere menu lost
report.label: Bug
report.description: Version 2013.08.26 -Enter coords and start navigation -Return to anywhere screen by ending navigation Result: -East coordinate is 0 -North coordinates is way off Expected: -previously entered coords should still be shown

report.summary: ANR (or crash?) when trying to attach an image
report.label: Bug
report.description: Found in 2013.08.28-NB: This is not clearly reproducible but happens for me almost consistently with the following procedure: Compose log, Attach an existing image Set scaling to "640 px" Send log Compose another log, Attach an existing image Set scaling to "No scaling" Press "OK" to leave the picture selection Result: c:geo stops reacting (does not return to logging view) After some seconds "c:geo is stopped" is shown The log does show nothing special after Debug cgeo 2293 SELECT IMAGE data = Intent { dat=content://media/external/images/media/32943 (has extras) }, just the normal login procedure when c:geo is restarting

report.summary: Cache-Popups open several times
report.label: Bug
report.description: In the newest nightly-builds I noticed that the same cache-popup on the livemap sometimes opens a few times. Sometimes it needs a second or two until that popup is open. When I touch on the cache icon again and again in that time (because I don't know if the device had realised my touch) the popup opens again after I touched the dark map to to close it. So in some cases I have to touch the map three or four times to go back to the map.

report.summary: PQ - Not all stored-caches are displayed on the map if there are to much
report.label: Bug
report.description: Sometimes not all stored caches will be shown on the map. I noticed this much times when I zoom out from a center of an imported PQ with 500 or more caches. The round circle full of caches seem to be cutted at the half and the eastern part is missing. If the shape of imported PQ is round that is easy to recognize but if it is rectangular (for example from gsak) that can be really irritating. If its really not possible to display all caches I whould like to get a short error-message.

report.summary: PQ-import dont work if "include name" is enabled at gc.com and the name contain a german umlaut
report.label: Bug
report.description: Hope this is not a duplicate, - i found nothing in the old issues. I created a PQ named "Rügen Auswahl" at gc.com and marked the option " Include Pocket Query name in download file name" there. But I was not able to import it to c:geo. I get the Error Message "Bad bite at 10". It worked with two workarounds: open the zip and rename the gpx-files so that the umlauts are gone create a PQ without this name-option. Here the not-working file: http://db.tt/WUkVQ9Hu

report.summary: GPS exhibit not recognized as event cache
report.label: Bug
report.description: No description provided.

report.summary: Trackable in hands of cacher problems
report.label: Bug
report.description: If a trackable is in the hands of a cacher then the TB page says "In the hands of XXX". This text is clickable and should open a menu where "XXX" is used as data. Right now the data is "In the hands of XXX" that will lead to opening invalid links in browser or trying to view invalid data. The problem is that UserActionsClickListener.java is using the full text of the view as data...

report.summary: Attributes on opencaching.pl
report.label: Bug
report.description: From support mail (did not have time to verify this yet): I think there is some problem with cache attributes (considering opencaching.pl). Before August update I could see the attributes (not sure if all) in text form just below cache description. Now, in new version only few attributes are displayed as icons (changing into text after touching) below cache main details screen. Most of attributes are skipped. Why?

report.summary: Menu item "Download static maps" not updated correctly
report.label: Bug
report.description: From support mail: Go to cache details, navigate, download static maps. Go back into navigate and the option to download static maps is still there. BUT.... go back out to the list view, reselect the same cache and now go into navigate - this time it recognises the maps have been downloaded and ready to use.

report.summary: Circles around physical stages of a cache
report.label: Bug
report.description: I just tested the circles feature. To be of any value to owners it should draw circles only around physical stages of a cache. That is a) the coordinates of a traditional cache b) the physical stages of a multi-cache (where a box is hidden to give further clues) c) the final coordinates of a multi-cache (if available) d) the final coordinates of a mystery (if available) I checked the current stable version (2013.08.26) and also the nightly build (2013.09.06-NB-e21a54e) and in both circles are drawn around multi-cache header coordinates and mysteries. That is a bug and should be corrected.

report.summary: TBs disappears from listing after posting a log
report.label: Bug
report.description: Open a cache with a TB. Post a log for the cache. Now the trackable tab of the cache listing is gone. If the cache listing is refreshed then the TB reappears.

report.summary: Strip HTML before using translate
report.label: Bug
report.description: Just translated description of Prague webcam cache and got HTML mixed in.

report.summary: default log type for webcam cache is dnf
report.label: Bug
report.description: No description provided.

report.summary: Refresh all from history asks for list to store
report.label: Bug
report.description: One can refresh all caches in the history list. Doing that will lead to asking for a list to store all these caches. That's unusable. It should be possible to refresh those caches and leave them on their own list each.

report.summary: Crash in dir chooser
report.label: Bug
report.description: Open dir chooser (selecting offline map theme) Select a folder but do not press OK. Access this folder instead Select a subfolder Result: Crash Stacktrace: 22:29:14.546 Error AndroidRuntime 8168 FATAL EXCEPTION: main 22:29:14.546 Error AndroidRuntime 8168 java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException: Invalid index 10, size is 3 22:29:14.546 Error AndroidRuntime 8168 at java.util.ArrayList.throwIndexOutOfBoundsException(ArrayList.java:251) 22:29:14.546 Error AndroidRuntime 8168 at java.util.ArrayList.get(ArrayList.java:304) 22:29:14.546 Error AndroidRuntime 8168 at cgeo.geocaching.files.SimpleDirChooser$FileArrayAdapter.getItem(SimpleDirChooser.java:121) 22:29:14.546 Error AndroidRuntime 8168 at cgeo.geocaching.files.SimpleDirChooser$OnCheckBoxClickListener.onClick(SimpleDirChooser.java:181) 22:29:14.546 Error AndroidRuntime 8168 at android.view.View.performClick(View.java:4211) 22:29:14.546 Error AndroidRuntime 8168 at android.widget.CompoundButton.performClick(CompoundButton.java:105) 22:29:14.546 Error AndroidRuntime 8168 at android.view.View$PerformClick.run(View.java:17267) 22:29:14.546 Error AndroidRuntime 8168 at android.os.Handler.handleCallback(Handler.java:615) 22:29:14.546 Error AndroidRuntime 8168 at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:92) 22:29:14.546 Error AndroidRuntime 8168 at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:137) 22:29:14.546 Error AndroidRuntime 8168 at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:4898) 22:29:14.546 Error AndroidRuntime 8168 at java.lang.reflect.Method.invokeNative(Native Method) 22:29:14.546 Error AndroidRuntime 8168 at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:511) 22:29:14.546 Error AndroidRuntime 8168 at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:1006) 22:29:14.546 Error AndroidRuntime 8168 at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:773) 22:29:14.546 Error AndroidRuntime 8168 at dalvik.system.NativeStart.main(Native Method)

report.summary: Map for one Cache behaves different on some devices
report.label: Bug
report.description: When I open a cache-detail-page on my devices (latest stable or nightly builds) and than >menu>navigate>map I get the map with this one cache and its waypoints only. (I think that is right and useful) Last week I tried the same on a samsung galaxy S4 (last stable build from playstore) and the result was the normal map with all other caches also displayed. I don't know a setting to change that so I think it must be a bug!?

report.summary: Stored live-map-caches are twice on the map until next map-close.
report.label: Bug
report.description: I noticed this in 2013-09-14-nb. I opened the live map, got a new cache with orange circle, opened the popup, stored the cache and got a second Icon. The orange-circle-icon stays until the whole map get closed.

report.summary: NPE when saving a scaled image
report.label: Bug
report.description: java.lang.NullPointerException at cgeo.geocaching.ImageSelectActivity.writeScaledImage(ImageSelectActivity.java:296) at cgeo.geocaching.ImageSelectActivity.saveImageInfo(ImageSelectActivity.java:162) at cgeo.geocaching.ImageSelectActivity$4.onClick(ImageSelectActivity.java:135) at android.view.View.performClick(View.java:3519) at android.view.View$PerformClick.run(View.java:14140) at android.os.Handler.handleCallback(Handler.java:605) at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:92) at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:137) at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:4424) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invokeNative(Native Method) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:511) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:787) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:554) at dalvik.system.NativeStart.main(Native Method)

report.summary: Delete from list not possible
report.label: Bug
report.description: 2013.09.15-NB: Go to stored caches list Long press on a cache Select "Delete" Result: Cache remains stored Expected: Cache deleted from device

report.summary: Move selected caches to a new list not possible
report.label: Bug
report.description: 2013.09.15-NB: Go to lists Select one or several cache(s) Press Menu and Select "Manage" -> "Move selected" Create a new list in the dialogue shown(!) Result: New list is created but cache(s) not moved to that list Expectation: New list created and caches moved to that list If the list is already existing, moving is working normal.

report.summary: Remove all and list not working
report.label: Bug
report.description: Most probably this is related to #3285 and/or #3286, nevertheless I open a separate issue for that: 2013.09.15-NB Open a user created list with caches in it Select Menu -> Manage -> Delete all and list Result: List is deleted but caches are moved to default list instead of being deleted Expectation: All caches of the list should be deleted and the list should be removed

report.summary: Filter for whereigo and letterbox shows all OC caches
report.label: Bug
report.description: Filtering for Whereigo or Letterbox (did not try all the other „exotic“ cache types) shows me all OC caches mixed with the correctly filtered GC caches in "nearby" search. As OC does not support these cache types, i propose the OC caches should default to NOT match these filters. Now they seem to default to match the filter "just in case", or erronously.

report.summary: Live map coordinates not precise warning
report.label: Bug
report.description: On my phone with today's RC the checkbox is only partly visible. The other question is shall we drop checking when checkbox is shown or not? It was added by me when orange circle were introduced.

report.summary: Map folder selection faulty
report.label: Bug
report.description: Similar to #3294 I also have an additional problem: I user to have selected "/storage/extSdCard/Locus/mapsVector/europe" selected for offline maps I created another folder "/storage/extSdCard/Locus/mapsVector/america" and moved maps there I went to c:geo settings and triggered the dir selection The scanner runs and offers maps in both directories "europe" and "america" I selected a map in folder "america" Returning to setting the choice "/storage/extSdCard/Locus/mapsVector/america" is correctly shown Leave the settings Open live map Select Menu -> Map It offers me only the maps contained in "/storage/extSdCard/Locus/mapsVector/europe" but not "america" Reenter the settings. The map folder selection shows "/storage/extSdCard/Locus/mapsVector/europe" again which is NOT what I have chosen before 2013.09.17-RC1

report.summary: Find count not working for "1 cache"
report.label: Bug
report.description: After negotiating with an user who reported that c:geo keeps showing 0 caches at the status bar in c:geo for him, I adviced :) to find another cache. So now the user has two finds and c:geo shows them normally. Prior to that the user tried resinstalling,etc,etc. with the same result that 0 caches are shown. So I guess there is really a problem recognizing a find count of 1.

report.summary: Missing Robustness when loading map themes
report.label: Bug
report.description: Trying to load the unzipped contents of http://www.android-hilfe.de/attachments/karten-navigation/230515d1376040879-mapsforge-vektorkarten-high-contrast-style-vmap-fuer-orux-locus-vmap_locus.zip as map theme makes c:geo crash. Problems with interpreting the files should lead to an error message, not a crash. Faulty or not c:geo-compatible files should be considered the norm case, not an exotic edge case where crashing might be more acceptable.

report.summary: directory chooser not working properly
report.label: Bug
report.description: Map-Themes-directory is displayed as "/sdcard' in Map-subpage of app settings. When tapping the entry, directory chooser displays "/" as path, no subdirs are shown for selection, and only "abort" is displayed as button. Device: HTC One (only integrated storage, no memory card)

report.summary: Coords in calendar is not usable
report.label: Bug
report.description: When events are created in the users calendar using the calendar addon, then the coordinates are added as well. These coords has used to open Google Maps or other apps like OsmAnd to view the position. Now it seem like the intent format has changed since Maps don't find anything and OsmAnd indicates that part of the coords are lost.

report.summary: Cache type filtering fails on live map
report.label: Bug
report.description: I can currently not provide a step-by-step for this but its quite obvious: 2013.09.20-NB Filter for a special cache type (global filter) Open live map Zoom or pan around (I guess zooming out below where gc.com hides them for PM) Some caches of other types (parsed from map, orange circled) appear and stay (also when zooming in again) Solution would be limiting the minimum zoom-level in which tiles are requested (as discussed in another issue) or refiltering after parsing (I guess this is currently only done for BM).

report.summary: Label of OAuth settings not updated after first authorization
report.label: Bug
report.description: We use two different labels "Authorize" and "Authorize again" for the OAuth settings, depending on whether the user has already authorized the service. But right after authorizing a service the first time, this label is not updated and still shows "Authorize". We miss a refresh of the settings activity there.

report.summary: Activated / Deactivated Flag
report.label: Bug
report.description: I deactivated 2 of my caches but the state in list didn't show it. After refresh it is shown correct but activating one cache it is still shown deactivated. The state should be shown correct after logging deactivated / activated.

report.summary: ANR in Mapsforge
report.label: Bug
report.description: Required: Slow connection Prepare Mapsforge to use online map Open cache list Press "Map". The (empty) map appears and map tiles are loading. Press "back" c:geo is not responding anymore (ANR after some seconds after user interaction) until all tiles are loaded in the background or a timeout occurs.

report.summary: OAuth signing is wrong
report.label: Bug
report.description: Our OAuth signing is wrong for the reserved characters of RFC 3986. OAuth requires everything except unreserved characters to be encoded: http://oauth.net/core/1.0a/#encoding_parameters I found this while trying to add support for name search in OKAPI and failed for a long time, due to us not encoding the asterisk wildcard "*". Even if our OAuth signing method is only 20 lines, to me this issue (and the hours I spent looking back and forth) makes me think it should be replaced by a ready-made library.

report.summary: No distance calculation and coords if cache is at equator
report.label: Bug
report.description: Current market release as well as 2013.09.30-NB: Example GC53 which is located at 00 00.000 E036 00.000 Distance to cache shows --- Coordinates are not shown / Navigation is impossible

report.summary: Note-Taking field doubles entered text
report.label: Bug
report.description: I just made a longer multi cache and used the note taking field below the listing to keep track of the variables i took along the route. It read like A=1 B=2 C=3 Suddenly when looking again at the list later, it read A=1 B=2 C=3 -- A=1 B=2 C=3 The content has been doubled, separated by "--". I could continue editing the (doubled) content without problems, and nothing strange happened any more. I am very, very sure i did not copy the content or type the "--" by myself. Is this a bug or some obscure type of feature i accidently triggered? I cannot reproduce the cause, but perhaps someone can have a look if something inside the note taking field looks fishy or if there is some reference to the string "--" somewhere.

report.summary: c:geo crashes on first fix
report.label: Bug
report.description: With NB 2013.10.03 I experienced several crashes in different parts of the app which didnot stop until I deactivated oc.de. NB 2013.10.02 was quite stable. So my assumption (which is totally unvalidated due to lack of logging capability) would be that something with the oc.de interface is broken from yesterday to today. A focus area of the crashes are in the search field when searching for cache name or GC-code. Reproducible for me was: Search for "GC4" Progress window is shown but before cache is displayed c:geo crashes Note: OC.de was activated in parallel to gc.com to that time I am outside the OC.de area (>200km rule applies) Edit: changed title according to description from @AlfredSK

report.summary: Save for offline not working
report.label: Bug
report.description: 2013.10.04-NB: Search for location (e.g. Köln) Press Menu, Select "Save for Offline" Result: Nothing happens

report.summary: Personal note on GC.com is only for premium members
report.label: Bug
report.description: We allow upload for non-PM too. Didn't try what it does and if it works.

report.summary: Allow font to be bigger in compass view
report.label: Bug
report.description: From support mail: I use a tablet and selected a larger system font so that I can read all details without problems (I am a little older). Its working quite well throughout the app, however in compass view the direction and distance are truncated although there is enough space.

report.summary: calendar time recognized wrongly
report.label: Bug
report.description: The event time of GC4N2MB is not recognized correctly.

report.summary: Problem with special characters in waypoint
report.label: Bug
report.description: GC4MEKX The text for WP15 is not displayed in c:geo. I assume it is caused by the special characters used in WP name.

report.summary: Direction to cache still displayed in lists although deselected
report.label: Bug
report.description: The directional arrows are still there, even the option is deselected. There is another option regarding directional arrows for basic members in the "services" - "geocaching.com" section. I deselected this one, too (Why are there two of them?) Still the arrows are there.

report.summary: Position not saved on logbook screen
report.label: Bug
report.description: From support mail: c:geo used to remember the position to which I scrolled on each tab of the cache details. Now this is still working except for the log tab. I tested this with the result: Open cache details Change to logbook screen Scroll down some log entries (and keep it in mind) Change to description screen Chane back to logbook screen Result: Position is still the same Now change to e.g. to details screen (more than one slide away from logbook!) Change back to logbook screen Result: The logbook position has been resetted and is opened at the top

report.summary: OC event caches don't show date in search results
report.label: Bug
report.description: Have event cache type as global filter. Search. GC caches have their date shown, OC caches do not.

report.summary: Any Destination crashes
report.label: Bug
report.description: (rsudev told me to open this ticket) When clicking on the Any Destination button, c:geo crashes with the following error:

report.summary: Export field notes does not remember check boxes
report.label: Bug
report.description: No description provided.

report.summary: Popup delete button don't work
report.label: Bug
report.description: With last NB when try to delete a Cache over the button in pop up in live map nothing happen.

report.summary: Twitter placeholder not working
report.label: Bug
report.description: In the twitter message template you can include these placeholders: [DATE] [TIME] [DATETIME] [USER] [NUMBER] [OWNER] Non of them is actually working. When tweeting with these placeholders they just show up as plain text as shown above.

report.summary: Hashtags for twitter are not customizable
report.label: Bug
report.description: Although we now have a customizable text, the default hashtags (#cgeo #geoaching) are still silently appended at the end. Users might instead want to use own hashtags, thus they should be part of the default text instead of being fixed. Additionally this unnecessarily shortens the maximum possible length of the tweet. Remark: Touching TB tweet does not append the default hashtags, but the cache found tweet does.

report.summary: Twitter template should not exceed 140 chars
report.label: Bug
report.description: AFAIK tweets are limited to 140 chars. Currently the text input for the template seems not to be limited at 140 characters.

report.summary: Spoiler image parsing fails
report.label: Bug
report.description: Due to the recent gc.com site update on October, 16th parsing spoiler images seems to have a problem: The unit test fails and @rsudev debugged it back to GC2JVEH failing to parse the spoiler images. Also for me in the NB neither the spoiler hint nor the gallery is shown for this cache. We decided not to push a notification as we assume it should be solvable quite easy and we could release a bugfix.

report.summary: Attributes not update correct..
report.label: Bug
report.description: ... if no one is the new state. I had a cache with NM Attribute after maintenance the attribute is gone and the cache have no attribute, but c:geo not merge it correct the NM is staying and will not go until I change the attributes and minimum one is there.

report.summary: Log-offline-menu doesn't respect cache source
report.label: Bug
report.description: Enable "Log offline" in settings Open an opencaching cache Press "Log" You'll see all log types that are available for geocaching.com caches. But opencaching has not all of these types. When you open the log form, only suitable types are shown.

report.summary: Cache description loading slow if GCVote server unavailable
report.label: Bug
report.description: It seems gcvote had some problems the last days. Many user contacted us, reporting that cache opening got stuck at "Loading GCVote" phase for several minutes. We should avoid waiting such a long time on a non responding server. Recently there was a change in the network retries. Is this issue already solved implicitly with that?

report.summary: OC waypoints imported multiple times
report.label: Bug
report.description: Load OCDDD2 repeatedly. Each time 2 more waypoints will be shown.

report.summary: Placeholder [LOG] not working for TB tweets
report.label: Bug
report.description: With current nightly I tested the [LOG] template. For geocaches it is working as designed. However for logging a TB (discovering) I composed the template: Trackable: [URL] [LOG] The [LOG]'was missing in the twitter post. The tweet was: Trackable: http://t.co/pkTNQL5pxI #cgeo #geocaching

report.summary: Twitter placeholder [NUMBER] adds finds plus 1
report.label: Bug
report.description: It seems that the number of found caches is one too high for the Twitter placeholder while it works perfect for the log template itself.

report.summary: Crash when trying to log "Will attend"
report.label: Bug
report.description: I got this stacktrace from PlayStore. The suspicious thing is, that all user messages on the fault reports deal with logging event caches cgeo Version: 20131019 and 20130919 java.lang.RuntimeException: Unable to start activity ComponentInfo{cgeo.geocaching/cgeo.geocaching.LogCacheActivity}: java.lang.NullPointerException at android.app.ActivityThread.performLaunchActivity(ActivityThread.java:2211) at android.app.ActivityThread.handleLaunchActivity(ActivityThread.java:2261) at android.app.ActivityThread.access$600(ActivityThread.java:141) at android.app.ActivityThread$H.handleMessage(ActivityThread.java:1256) at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:99) at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:137) at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:5103) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invokeNative(Native Method) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:525) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:737) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:553) at dalvik.system.NativeStart.main(Native Method) Caused by: java.lang.NullPointerException at cgeo.geocaching.LogCacheActivity.setDefaultValues(LogCacheActivity.java:348) at cgeo.geocaching.LogCacheActivity.onCreate(LogCacheActivity.java:261) at android.app.Activity.performCreate(Activity.java:5133) at android.app.Instrumentation.callActivityOnCreate(Instrumentation.java:1087) at android.app.ActivityThread.performLaunchActivity(ActivityThread.java:2175) ... 11 more

report.summary: Sort by favorite percentage should be disabled in search results
report.label: Bug
report.description: As far as I am aware of the information needed to get this percentage, we need the total amount of logs for a cache. We do only have this information if a cache is detailed and/or saved. As a result of a search may also contain (typically) not stored cache the sorting will not result in any useful order, thus this option should only be present on offline lists.

report.summary: Bug with offline maps
report.label: Bug
report.description: Just started to use offline maps and found the following bug: if i go in cgeo to stored -> klick on the map icon on the top right -> select any preloaded cache and click -> more details -> now i click on the compas icon on the top right which should open the map instead of compass (thats my setting) -> now it opens the map with all stored caches again, instead of just the one i selected. the same thing is also for waypoints if i first open the map to show all stored caches and after that i open one of this caches go to waypoints and click on one and select map. it will show me the map again with all stored caches instead of just the waypoint.. this bug also happens if i do the same as above but now i am clicking at the map in cache details instead of the compass symbol. it also opens the map with all stored caches instead of just the selected one. but if i go to stored->select any cache->click on compass or the small map in cache details it will work right. its just if i opened the map before with all stored caches. then it wont work... would be nice if you could fix it soon :)

report.summary: Waypoint description gets mixed up
report.label: Bug
report.description: Today I noticed that the userdefined description text which is shown for each waypoint in the WP tab gets mixed up when scrolling through the list of waypoints. I can not exactly give a clue on when this happens, but if a cache has e.g. 12 waypoints where the first one has the description "This is a small parking spot" and you scroll down and up the list a few times suddenly some of the other waypoints also show the description "This is a small parking spot" in the overview. Such a like this happens with all WP texts randomly. If you open those wrong described waypoints the wrong description is not shown, which probably means it is only a problem in the WP overview view. 2013.11.09-NB

report.summary: WP from personal note doubled
report.label: Bug
report.description: We used to have this problem some time ago, but it seems that happens again: I had 6 pair of coords in the personal note and 6 WPs created from them. I edited the personal note in c:geo and added a 7th pair of coords Saved the note and uploaded it I refreshed the cache to get the new coords parsed to a new waypoint Result: It ended up in having 10 "personal note" WPs, i.e. some are doubled The note looks like this: Station 1: N 51 20.123 E 006 58.123 Station 2: .... ... (I added Station 7)

report.summary: Scrolling in cache description not possible on Android 4.3.1
report.label: Bug
report.description: We received four mails on support telling this: Using Android 4.3.1 Scrolling possible in other parts of the app but not in cache description Trying to scroll it jumps around and always ends up at the top after releasing One user confirmed the behavior for market release as well as nightly build. I am still waiting for more details. I asked in what views scrolling is posible and where it is not possible. Any idea from developers side yet?

report.summary: Waypoints no longer shown on map from list
report.label: Bug
report.description: Was reported in the german geocaching forum. If you open the map from a list (with many caches), the waypoints are not shown, even though the number of caches on the screen is smaller than the limit from the settings.

report.summary: Wrong attribute icon in OC.de cache
report.label: Bug
report.description: Version: 20131219_NB Cache: OC101D5 The first attribute has the text nur bei opencaching logbar but an icon which is a red ?!. I assume this is not correct.

report.summary: Find count not updated after log submission
report.label: Bug
report.description: After posting a found log for an EC cache the find count on the main screen is not updated.

report.summary: 'More'-search doesn't work any more
report.label: Bug
report.description: I assume by the recent changes in the connector framework, the currently gc.com-specific 'more'-search was broken. Even though it is a regression, IMO it is not very critical. Instead of re-activating this short-term, we should rather try to generalize it (as it is available for OKAPI as well) mid-term.

report.summary: No found status for EC caches in their GPX
report.label: Bug
report.description: This is no bug in c:geo but I want to document this here as a reminder: The GPX file returned from ec.com seems not to include the information that the user already found the cache. This leads to the problem that already found caches are not shown as found. I contacted their support to ask whether this is intentional or not. Update: For the map API it is working.

report.summary: Caches disappear from list after return from cache details
report.label: Bug
report.description: Version: 2013.12.24-NB Steps: Deactivate all services except extremcaching.com (I could not see this faulty behavior with geocaching.com) Search location "Schwarzenberg" The search should return 20 caches Open one of the caches Press back to get back to the result list. Result: Only the previously opened cache is still displayed Log shows: 16:11:20.689 Debug cgeo 2831 DataStore.loadCaches([EC335, EC69, EC31, EC32, EC71, EC39, EC58, EC36, EC38, EC83, EC111, EC85, EC62]) returned no results (Remark: These are all caches out of the 20 which I did not open before)
