report.summary: Requests to gc.com although deactivated
report.label: Bug
report.description: Version: 2013.12.26-NB Steps: Deactivate gc.com as cache source Activate another cache source instead (ec.com in my test) Start live map Result: No tiles are requested from gc.com tile server (which is OK) but still at the start of live map a single request to gc.com is done as the log proofs: 16:10:14.875 Debug cgeo 21327 GET http://www.geocaching.com/map/default.aspx 16:10:15.531 Debug cgeo 21327 200 (644 ms) GET http://www.geocaching.com/map/default.aspx I do not know if this is necessary for some reason, but I think we should not contact gc.com if the user is not using this cache source at all.

report.summary: Bad encoding in features list
report.label: Bug
report.description: The features list for services uses an HtmlView. The content is made from plain text strings, which are not properly converted to HTML.

report.summary: Empty strings added to capability list
report.label: Bug
report.description: If any of the first 4 standard capabilities is missing, it will be replaced by an empty string instead of removing the item completely.

report.summary: Geocode search for ec.com is case sensitive
report.label: Bug
report.description: 2013.12.30-NB Steps: Search for geocode "ec242" EC returns 404 Search for geocode "EC242" Cache is returned Geocode should be capitalized in cgeo or ec.com should accept those requests as well

report.summary: EC attributes disappear on refresh
report.label: Bug
report.description: Steps: load an EC cache e.g. EC35 you should see the attributes tap the refresh button the attributes disappear

report.summary: Crash with `null` completion in lazy lists
report.label: Bug
report.description: It looks like DataStore.loadWaypoints() sometimes manage to initialize the lazy list with null. This, in turn, should only happen when geocode is blank. I think that in this case an empty collection should be returned instead of an empty list after writing an error message in the log. Another reason to not accept null as a completion value for a lazy list is that null represents a non-yet-completed lazy list, and subsequent calls to getList() will try to complete the list again. java.lang.NullPointerException at cgeo.geocaching.utils.LazyInitializedList.size(LazyInitializedList.java:50) at java.util.AbstractList$SimpleListIterator.hasNext(AbstractList.java:51) at cgeo.geocaching.Waypoint.mergeWayPoints(Waypoint.java:118) at cgeo.geocaching.Geocache.gatherMissingFrom(Geocache.java:316) at cgeo.geocaching.cgData.saveCache(cgData.java:1026) at cgeo.geocaching.SearchResult.addAndPutInCache(SearchResult.java:246) at cgeo.geocaching.connector.gc.GCParser.parseCacheFromText(GCParser.java:754) at cgeo.geocaching.connector.gc.GCParser.parseCache(GCParser.java:347) at cgeo.geocaching.connector.gc.GCConnector.searchByGeocode(GCConnector.java:156) at cgeo.geocaching.Geocache.searchByGeocode(Geocache.java:1678) at cgeo.geocaching.CacheDetailActivity$LoadCacheThread.run(CacheDetailActivity.java:729)

report.summary: No live map functionality for other sources than gc.com
report.label: Bug
report.description: Today I wanted to test some more with ec.com. With 2014.01.01-NB I do not see any requests to ec.com on the live map and consequently the map stays empty. Steps: Activate ec.com as cache source (only) Open live map Scroll around Result: Nothing is shown (in area where ec caches are present) The debug log does not show any activity (requests)

report.summary: OX caches opened from map/coordinate search are missing details
report.label: Bug
report.description: 2014.01.04-NB: Steps: Activate oc.com as cache source Open live map Select an OX cache and open it from the popup Description is empty and no logbook is shown Select "Refresh" All details are shown This is not intuitive..It took me some minutes to realize, that I have to refresh manually to get the needed details. We should directly send the request for complete data if the cache is opened from the popup.

report.summary: About-Contributors kills the app
report.label: Bug

report.summary: Online log on OC without authentication not prohibited
report.label: Bug
report.description: Just tried to log an OC cache without having it authorized in the settings. This fails only on sending the log, but does not give a meaningful error message. It also does not tell the user in advance to authorize the connector.

report.summary: Clear up GPS status in cache list activity
report.label: Bug
report.description: As in several other activities, the GPS is turned on when entering a cache list in onResume() and turned off (if noone else requires it) in onPause(). In parallel, we try to be clever by turning it off while refreshing caches, and turning if back on when the refresh is finished (regularly or through a user cancel). This two cycles do not cope well with each other. It led to #3521 where the GPS will stay turned on after we navigate away from the activity or from cgeo entirely. The fix is only partial, and will lead to the GPS not being turned on spontaneously when a list refresh is cancelled (but will resume regular behaviour when navigating away from the activity by going back in cgeo or by displaying the details of a cache). I think we try to be too clever here. The questions we should ask ourselves are: Do we need the GPS to be turned on while displaying a cache list? Do we need the GPS to be turned off while refreshing the caches? Note that keeping the GPS turned on may be overriden by an explicit user action (the user is always free to disable the GPS and this is easy to do from the status bar on most devices), and preserve an up-to-date distance and direction (if the GPS is used for it) for the caches displayed in the background window. What do you think we should be doing? Should we keep being clever or should we adopt more simple an approach?

report.summary: Attached images get rotated
report.label: Bug
report.description: While attaching pictures on my mobile (Samsung Galaxy S3) to a cache, I notice that the pictures get rotated. I've tried taking landscape and portrait and each time they are rotated. This happens when taking "New" pictures. Could the problem be fixed, or provide a way for the picture to be rotated in the app? Very happy to provide any extra information.

report.summary: Trackable geocode is null
report.label: Bug
report.description: There has been several instances of this problem. This exception appears when saving a trackable whose geocode appears to be null: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: the bind value at index 1 is null at android.database.sqlite.SQLiteProgram.bindString(SQLiteProgram.java:164) at cgeo.geocaching.DataStore.saveLogsWithoutTransaction(DataStore.java:1409) at cgeo.geocaching.DataStore.saveInventoryWithoutTransaction(DataStore.java:1494) at cgeo.geocaching.DataStore.saveTrackable(DataStore.java:1455) at cgeo.geocaching.connector.gc.GCParser.parseTrackable(GCParser.java:1602) at cgeo.geocaching.connector.gc.GCParser.searchTrackable(GCParser.java:983) at cgeo.geocaching.connector.trackable.TravelBugConnector.searchTrackable(TravelBugConnector.java:38) at cgeo.geocaching.TrackableActivity$LoadTrackableThread.run(TrackableActivity.java:253) Indeed, it is not allowed to save a log with a non-existent geocode: private static final String dbCreateLogs = "" + "create table " + dbTableLogs + " (" + "_id integer primary key autoincrement, " + "geocode text not null, " + "updated long not null, " // date of save + "type integer not null default 4, " + "author text, " + "log text, " + "date long, " + "found integer not null default 0, " + "friend integer " + "); ";

report.summary: Opening saved caches lead to crash if "Last Page" is active
report.label: Bug
report.description: A handful of users on support mail and FB are reporting that they experience force closes regularly when trying to open saved caches. It helped to reset c:geo to factory defaults in all cases, however one user investigated a bit more and reported this: If the option "Last Details page" is active, those crashes are happening. Switching that option off everything is OK. I can not reproduce this using the current market version, but the explanation is somehow trustworthy. Any idea ?

report.summary: "Import from Internet" does not open
report.label: Bug
report.description: 2014.01.17-NB This issue happens also in other scenarios but this one is reproducible for me : Open a list Select Manage -> Import from internet "Waiting for caches" dialog shown Cancel Select again Manage -> Import from internet Nothing happens I have the feeling this also happens on the first try if other operations to that list (e.g. delete, move, refresh) have been done before. Leaving and reentering the list makes it work again (for one time).

report.summary: Calendar addon violates calendar contract
report.label: Bug
report.description: http://developer.android.com/reference/android/provider/CalendarContract.Events.html: If allDay is set to 1 eventTimezone must be TIMEZONE_UTC and the time must correspond to a midnight boundary. This might be the reason for a user describing on support that full day calendar entries are not working at all, while time bound entries work fine.

report.summary: Tweets not posted
report.label: Bug
report.description: After reading @SammysHP comment on IRC I retested and can confirm that with release 2014.01.22 (did not test old release) tweets are not posted although c:geo is sucesfull authorized to Twitter. I was not able to take a log due to a PC swap (dont have QTADB right now).

report.summary: Log password box missing when changing logtype
report.label: Bug
report.description: If I open a new log window on an oc cache, that requires a log password and it opens as 'note' (because I already found the cache), the box for entering the log password isn't made visible when I change the log type to found. Consequently sending the log will fail. If I close and re-open the (stored) log, the password box is visible correctly.

report.summary: Trackable name and type not parsed
report.label: Bug
report.description: Due to gc.com changes on 28.01.2014 name and owner of a trackable are no longer parsed correctly when searched.

report.summary: Problem re-activiting GPS after longer phone sleep
report.label: Bug
report.description: From the German geocaching forum (translation by me): My current observation is, that after the phone has been in sleep-mode for a longer time, c:geo is not able to re-activate the GPS. Neither the new location symbol from Android nor the GPS symbol is shown. After stopping and re-starting c;geo it works again. (Android 4.4, cyanogenmod 11, HTC one, c:geo NB from 27.01.2014 probably) (Original text from http://forum.geoclub.de/viewtopic.php?p=1154170#p1154170): Allerdings, nach meiner bisherigen Beobachtung, wenn das Handy offensichtlich längere Zeit im Sleepmodus war, kriegt c:geo GPS nicht wieder aktiviert. Weder das neue Lokalisationssymbol von Android noch das GPS-Symbols eines GPS-Tools erscheint dann wieder in der Statusleiste. Der Workaround geht folgendermaßen: c:geo abschießen und neu starten, danach funktioniert GPS auch wieder.

report.summary: field note export exports all (non GC) logs
report.label: Bug
report.description: I just did a field note export after an offline OC log. That is uploaded to the GC website without further notice.

report.summary: Personal note parsing might be too loose
report.label: Bug
report.description: Seen on Facebook: Mike Binnemann: [basic member] I now have almost always a new waypoint with the name personal note, when I edit my personal note. These waypoints I can not delete it. Often these mird entered twice in the field even after the edit personal note. The previous text is displayed after the new text, separated only by a line of ---. Mike Exemple note: 1 T 126 2 B 12 3 S 630 4c P 51 L 1 E 14 J 11 U 12 D 1 M 7 N 5 5 IFG 257

report.summary: Radar navigation not working
report.label: Bug
report.description: 2014.02.05-NB If I start navigation from a cache using Radar (with GPSStatus) the target coords are not the desired coords but some which have nothing to do with that cache. I did not get my PC running with logcat yet, but I would guess the radar uses the last target coords it has and we for some reason stopped handing over coords when calling the Radar. Please try to reproduce, maybe there is a problem with my installation.

report.summary: Geocode search is case sensitive
report.label: Bug
report.description: I remember that this issue was solved in the past but come up again on market version 2014.02.04: Save s geocache for offline use Use the search function and search its geocode in "upper case" Result: Cache is opened immediately Use the search function and search its geocode in "lower case" Result: Cache is requested online

report.summary: Filtered list can't be shown on map
report.label: Bug
report.description: I am using Version 2014.02.04 in the moment. When I open a list I can use the "filter"-menu to show only special kinds of caches like "with changed coordinates". I like to use the "show on map"-menu for that results. I have the app locus installed so after use this menu entry I get asked wich map I like to use. When I chose to watch the caches in locus everything is OK. But when I use the cgeo-map for it I get not only the filter-result-caches but all chaches on the list.

report.summary: Sorting of list lost when deleting a cache inside
report.label: Bug
report.description: Hi c:geo team, when I sort a list by status (active, disabled, archived), I delete an archived cache and the previous sorting is lost (back to default sorting). I have to sort again by status to find again the archived caches, and so on... release 2014.02.04 on Android 4.2 Thanks for you daily job, anyway. Tof

report.summary: Archive message is shown as note
report.label: Bug
report.description: I am not sure, whether this is a limitation of the API or a bug: Looking at an archive message in an OC-logbook it is shown as empty note. Example: OC5FEE Market version 2014.02.04

report.summary: Hint images not displayed when returning from external applications
report.label: Bug
report.description: Open GC472ME in c:geo, click on hint images, click on an image to launch an external viewer, press back: images will not be displayed again, only the spinning circles will be shown. Happens at least in nightly of Feb. 19. Does not happen on release. Labelling as "high" as this is a regression.

report.summary: Search by coords is broken
report.label: Bug
report.description: Not only in CI tests but also in real life. Nearby search is no longer returning coords for me.

report.summary: No Swipe on cache details
report.label: Bug
report.description: It's not possible to swipe to the next page on the selected area:

report.summary: Special log types on unpublished caches
report.label: Bug
report.description: We support showing unpublished caches for the owner. That works normal in 2014.03.01-NB. However the special log types are not recognized. This is a minor problem in a special case, but still a bug. Here is a source of an unpublished cache with typical log types "Post reviewer note" and "Submit for Review": https://www.dropbox.com/s/j7bj3ea2j2pby0h/logbook_postreviewernote_Submit%20for%20review.htm

report.summary: Type filters on live map unreliable
report.label: Bug
report.description: A user reported that setting the type filter to "Wherigo" shows many different caches on the live map which shouldn't be there. I tested it and made the following observations: Prerequisites: Enable global cache type filter "Wherigo" Choose live map strategy "fast" Do not have any caches in the database for the testing region (e.g. clear data before) Premium member? Observations: All caches are ?? although I zoomed in to "200 m" These ?? include: traditional, multi, unknown, etc. (all cache types?) But not all caches are shown, only a small subset (but with many types) Leave the live map and return to it (maybe unnecessary) Some Wherigo symbols appear. Open one of them and it will change its type to "Earthcache" (also other types?) If you need an area to test it, try Hanover in Germany.

report.summary: Plurals problem with 1101 caches
report.label: Bug
report.description: A user reported, that he sees "One cache" as user find count in logbooks of cache quite often, which is incorrect. I am waiting for feedback about: c:geo Version Android version System language cgeo is used in english Example (trajakas289):

report.description: In the logs of TB4K4FC a recent entry has some encoded HTML in a photo title.

report.summary: Size of warning window should be higher

report.summary: Long press on a cache in a list does not provide options
report.label: Bug
report.description: Currently using 2014.03.17-NB-89b499e. Previously, when in list view, a long press would provide a context menu to allow caches to be moved, etc. This is no longer available.

report.summary: No Access to SD Card on KitKat
report.label: Bug
report.description: KitKat introduced another "security feature" and prevents all access to the SD card except for a special directory reserved for the app. I don't know any details but you can find enough via Google.

report.summary: Load more missing in all search results
report.label: Bug
report.description: 2014.03.19-NB: In all search result lists the Load more caches option is no longer shown.

report.summary: Limit for showing waypoint on map sporadically not working
report.label: Bug
report.description: Using 2014.03.19-NB (but probably existing much longer) It happens sporadically when scrolling or zooming the map that waypoints are still shown although the defined limit of caches shown is reached. I have set the "hide waypoint on map" limit to 10. I scrolled to an area on the map with well over 10 caches but still the waypoints are shown. Only after another manual operation (e.g. zoom out and zoom in again or scroll in one direction and back to the orginal position) the waypoints are correctly hidden. I can give no clear instruction of when this error shows up but my feeling is, that it happens after several zoom and scroll operations. To make this more clear, here are some screenshots: Map drawing not correct (limit 10, 15 caches shown) After moving the map just a little bit forth and back it updates and hides the waypoints as it should:

report.summary: Archived caches still shown on map
report.label: Bug
report.description: Today I was on tour. First I logged a cache. But no smiley appeared on map. I didn't think more about because sometimes it changes on move. Another cache I needed to update. It was archived and the cache icon shows grey but it didn't disappear because it was stored? However, so I removed the cache and the disc image disappeared but the grey archived cache resided. Another cache updated and removed but icon with disc resided. Another cache I removed without update because now I knew the whole series was archived. The icon didn't change a bit. I killed cgeo between but the icons stay on map although they are removed. Strange behaviour. NB 2014-03-27 I know caching last sunday the icon changed to smiley and disappeared from map.

report.summary: Failure to load all pictures on image tab
report.label: Bug
report.description: The cache GC245X3 has 243 images (which is quite unusual but good for testing purposes). When opening the image tab I can see that a certain amount of pictures but not all are loaded. Depending on the used device the amount of pictures loaded differs, but some keep missing. With the debug log it is hard to distinguish whether all of them are requested and some not returned or we just stop requesting. That would need further analysis. Anyway it ends up with having "spinning circles" as placeholder for some of the pictures but no more network traffic ongoing.

report.summary: Compass deviation -90° in landscape mode
report.label: Bug
report.description: Hi, since the last update, the compass has a deviation of -90° when holding the device in landscape mode. I'm running Android 4.2.2 with a Kernel 3.4.5 on a ASUS ME173X (Built ME173X_WW_user_4.2.4.72702_20131128) If I have another app using the compass, like GPS Status, it works well when turning the device. Rebooting and locking the screen in landscape mode doesn't have any effect.

report.summary: Navigation with external apps not working
report.label: Bug
report.description: Since 01.04. we received at least 5 independent mails claiming that using "Show on ext. map" is no longer providing coordinates to the destination app, which was working with the previous release. I asked the users what app they are using and wait for feedback now.

report.summary: How to handle the case when no location is available
report.label: Bug
report.description: With market release 2014.04.01: Switch off GPS Start c:geo The main screen shows "Last position" and correct coordinates for the last known location Perform nearby search Results are according to the last known location Open live map Result: No pointer/arrow shown The map starts up where it was last opened position or even defaults to N0/E0 (in case c:geo was not running before) Clicking on the "my location" button has no effect Expected: Last known location should be used as starting point for the map If possible the arrow should mark the last known location I am using a new device, so I am not sure whether this is a new issue or just device depending?!

report.summary: Mini-compass deviation in cache list
report.label: Bug
report.description: As for #3729, the cache list activity mini-compasses are wrong when in landscape mode.

report.summary: Wrong image when opening a spoiler with Photos
report.label: Bug
report.description: When clicking on a spoiler image and opening it with the Photos app, another image is displayed (in my case a spoiler from a previously visited cache). Sometimes the other image is displayed during less than 1 second and the actual spoiler is displayed after that but darker than usual.

report.summary: Darker image when opened with Photos application
report.label: Bug
report.description: From #3736: when images are opened into the Photos external application, they appear darker than in the Gallery application. It looks like the application opens them fine, then makes them darker after about one second. cc @jacobtardieu who originally reported this issue

report.summary: Long click in list also triggers short click
report.label: Bug
report.description: 2014.04.05-NB (but probably exisiting since the recent changes to the long click events): It happens to me quite often, that when trying a long click on a cache in a list the context menu opens but shortly after that the cache details are opened and the context menu vanishes. It is quite easy to reproduce: When you do a really long click the context menu opens as expected When you do a really short click the details are opened as expected If you do a click which is just at the time limit of a long click the described problem shows up

report.summary: Import from web does not work if started a second time
report.label: Bug
report.description: Maybe a follow up of #3550 : Start "Import from web" Send a cache to c:geo Result: OK Press "Cancel" Start "Import from web" again Send another cache to c:geo Result: Nothing happens. Kill c:geo Restart c:geo and start "Import from web" Now the queued cache from step 6 is downloaded

report.summary: CI wrong message update
report.label: Bug
report.description: Looks like the CI uses echo instead of curl for message updates: 23:10:57 Lineflyer | Started by user Lars Building in workspace /srv/jenkins/jobs/Create notification/workspace │ | [workspace] $ /bin/sh -xe /tmp/hudson5116230000040917557.sh + [ -z ] + echo -X POST │ | http://status.cgeo.org/api/update/message --data @/srv/statusSecret --data message=Geocaching.com │ | maintenance! You might encounter connection issues. --data icon=attribute_firstaid --data │ | message_id= -X POST http://status.cgeo.org/api/update/message --data @/srv

report.summary: No add to favourites after logging found
report.label: Bug
report.description: If you log found you have to refresh to add a cache to favourites. We should change this attribute on logging found. It is similar to disable / enable.

report.summary: Send2cgeo times out although caches are imported
report.label: Bug
report.description: From support mail and was also told to me by @SammysHP or @marco-dev : The timer for "Import from web" seems not to be resetted if caches are incoming but times out as if no caches have been received.

report.summary: Out of memory error while loading caches
report.label: Bug
report.description: With release 2014.04.01: java.lang.OutOfMemoryError at java.lang.AbstractStringBuilder.enlargeBuffer(AbstractStringBuilder.java:95) at java.lang.AbstractStringBuilder.append0(AbstractStringBuilder.java:140) at java.lang.StringBuilder.append(StringBuilder.java:125) at cgeo.geocaching.DataStore.whereGeocodeIn(DataStore.java:2865) at cgeo.geocaching.DataStore.loadCachesFromGeocodes(DataStore.java:1631) at cgeo.geocaching.DataStore.loadCaches(DataStore.java:1582) at cgeo.geocaching.SearchResult.getCachesFromSearchResult(SearchResult.java:243) at cgeo.geocaching.maps.CGeoMap$LoadRunnable.run(CGeoMap.java:1073) at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor.runWorker(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:1088) at java.util.concurrent.ThreadPoolExecutor$Worker.run(ThreadPoolExecutor.java:581) at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:1019) We probably have to limit the number of caches loaded in one request.

report.summary: Crash when the long-clicking on a value string
report.label: Bug
report.description: With release 2014.04.01. java.lang.ClassCastException: android.text.SpannableString cannot be cast to java.lang.String at cgeo.geocaching.CacheDetailActivity.onCreateContextMenu(CacheDetailActivity.java:360) at android.view.View.createContextMenu(View.java:8358) It was triggered by a long-click on the geocode according to the user.

report.summary: Crash when starting compass from popup
report.label: Bug
report.description: 2014.04.13-NB: It happend to me several times today, that c:geo crashed when trying to start the compass from a waypoint popup on the livemap (via Menu -> Naivigate -> Compass). It is not reproducible, meaning on the next try it usually works. No log yet, Sorry.

report.summary: Somehting is strange with oc autorization
report.label: Bug
report.description: With 2014.04.13-NB I can see a new settings menu for opencaching services. However If I e.g. active the opencaching.us service I do not see any menu to authenticate to that site. Returning to the main menu I see "Not autorized" on the main page.

report.summary: No field note export for opencaching sites
report.label: Bug
report.description: From support mail: If I log a OP-caches offline and afterwards export the field notes the result file is empty. If I log a OP- and a GC-cache offline and export the fiels notes only the GC-cache is contained in the file. I am not familiar with the field note support on OC-sites but I can confirm the behavior (possibly the same for all non-GC caches).

report.summary: Slow list if many caches stored
report.label: Bug
report.description: 2014.04.20-NB (but most probably not new in this version): For my holiday I stored a list with an imported PQ of 1000 caches. This slows down a c:geo a lot: Scrolling through the lists is stuttering not always but most of the time Opening a single cache from the ist and returning from the cache to the list takes considerable time (1-2 seconds) The situation gets worse in the following scenario: Open cache list with 1000 caches Apply a filter (e.g. Attribut -> Medium hike) Open details of a cache from the filtered list Return to the list In this scenario two things are noticeable: Even the attribut selection list in the filter menu is stuttering when scrolling It takes 7-10 seconds until the list is shown after the last step Setting label "Unverified" as I have no possibility to take a log currently. Mabye someone can try to reproduce with a 1000-PQ. This is one of my usual holiday usecases and I never experienced such problems before (last time used in February). It is not related to the mini-compass (tested by disabling it in settings).

report.summary: Combination of filters seem to work unreliable
report.label: Bug
report.description: Seen with 2014.04.21-NB and also read about it on IRC: Sometimes when using the filters it seems to be possible to apply a combination of filters (i.e. after selecting one filter, select another one and both are applied). While this can make sense for some usecases, there seem to be problems with that: Only the latest selected filter is shown in the headline of the list Sometimes applying a new filter seems to cancel the filter applied before (not sure under which conditions) but not always. Sometimes selecting "Reset filter" does not really cancel them, but still only a subset of the caches on the list is shown but there is no UI indication anymore, that there is still something filtered out Will check if I find a reproducible case for this one.

report.summary: Crash when opening cache link from cache description
report.label: Bug
report.description: Open GC1BABN Click on the first link to the listed other cache in the cache description ("Respeitem...")

report.summary: Waypoints not shown after compass
report.label: Bug
report.description: From Twitter: have problem showing a set waypoint on map. In cache-details, list of wp, compass, show on map - Can't see the wp on map. Open cache with more than one waypoint Press compass button on one waypoint Menu → show on map Only that waypoint will be shown Expected result: All waypoints and the cache itself are shown. Not sure if this is an intended behavior or a bug.

report.summary: Login problem on existing installation
report.label: Bug
report.description: Over the last weeks we received around 30 mails with same symptoms: Login fails (acc. to main screen) Same on wifi and mobile network "Identify as Android browser" does not help "Check login" reports Unknown communication error Reenter and check credentials done without success For all(!) of these users the problem was solved by one of the following: Reinstall c:geo Delete all data in Android settings Any idea, what went wrong here? Any idea, how to get more clues on this (besides having a log)?

report.summary: "Import from android"enabled in history
report.label: Bug
report.description: That import menu item should not be enabled when looking at the history.

report.summary: Unrecognized cache type
report.label: Bug
report.description: I did a nearby search with only OC.DE being active. All caches are fine, except for OCF1F1. It is shown as unknown, but the description looks like an event. My app version is a self made one which is some weeks old. So if no one can reproduce, I will look at that with current code after my holiday.

report.summary: Cannot hide owned caches on live map; OpenCaching.us
report.label: Bug
report.description: While on the live map and pulling up map settings, toggling "Show own/found caches" will only turn off your finds on the map, not your hides. As evidenced by my GitHub username, I am the OpenCaching.us webmaster, and may be able to answer technical questions about our site. I am only a server admin though, most definitely not a coder. :-)

report.summary: "Webcam photo taken" log does not mark cache as found
report.label: Bug
report.description: 2014.05.03-NB: Open a saved webcam cache Post a log of type "Webcam photo taken" Result: Log is correctly shown in logbook Status is NOT changed to "Found" NO green marker in lists After manual refresh the cache is correctly marked as found.

report.summary: List menu becomes invisible
report.label: Bug
report.description: Open a cache list. All menu items are available. Switch directly to the history list. The "list" menu item is now invisible, correctly. Switch directly to a real cache list. The "list" item remains invisible, wrongly. It only works correctly again when exiting the list activity to the main screen and then reopening the lists.

report.summary: Exported GPX files are no longer readable by Garmin device
report.label: Bug
report.description: It seems to me that the GPX files exported from c:geo are no longer readable by Garmin. I'm using the export function to generate GPX files that I then upload to my Garmin device (Garmin Oregon 450t). This worked like a charm for years already. With the last c:geo update (version 2014.04.30) I happily noticed that the process of exporting GPX files significantly sped up. However, the resulting files are no longer accepted by my Garmin device. I tested this with an older GPX file that I generated with c:geo as well and that file worked just fine again.

report.summary: GPX import not executed when started from mail in
report.label: Bug
report.description: 2014.05.07-NB Received a GPX file (exported from cgeo) via mail Opened the file in my mail program Selected c:geo as target app c:geo opens and asks for a list to store the caches After selecting the list nothing happens (only the list is shown) Manually importing the file (via Manage -> Import GPX) works without a problem. I am not sure whether this used to work before with my mail client, therefore setting "Unverified". But IMO it should work if c:geo can be selected when opening the file, or not?

report.summary: External navigation with "MapFactor Navigator" not working
report.label: Bug
report.description: As written in #3731 users reported that with the release 2014.04.19 the following procedure stopped working: Open cache details Menu -> Navigate -> "Show on ext. map" Select the app: "MapFactor Navigator" The fix applied for #3731 does not seem to help. With the current 2014.05.11-NB I can still see, that this procedure is not working. MapFactor Navigator is started but remains on the startup screen. Hint: If I use this procedure I can start navigation with MapFactor Navigator: Open cache details Menu -> Navigate -> "Google Maps Route" Select the app: "MapFactor Navigator" @Bananeweizen : Disregard my email concerning Sygic navigation. It turned out the user used the wrong method to invoke Sygic.

report.summary: Slow reaction when dealing with huge lists
report.label: Bug
report.description: 2014.05.12-NB: For testing another issue I imported 4000 caches to a list. This slows down the UI significantly: When leaving the cache details back to that list, it takes around 3-5 seconds to open the list. App not responsive during that time. Applying a filter takes up to 10 seconds. App not responsive during that time. Deleting a subset of the caches on the list (e.g. preselected by applying a filter) most often leads to an ANR-error.

report.summary: show list on map does not zoom correctly
report.label: Bug
report.description: the zoom calculation does not take the orientation into account. reproduce: search for caches of user "hinagicu" with landscape orientation. result: 3 caches on GC. show on map. result: only one is visible. zoom out, all become visible.

report.summary: Coordinate dialog has transparent background
report.label: Bug
report.description: The dialog to edit wayoint coordinates now has a transparent background (in dark skin, Android 4.0.3). That makes it hard to read

report.summary: Select mode not available on list menu
report.label: Bug
report.description: After entering the list and immedietely opening the menu, the item "Select mode" is missing. it only appears if you wait some seconds after opening the list.

report.summary: Doubled gcvote in popup
report.label: Bug
report.description: Details to follow

report.summary: Leaving search function on main screen broken
report.label: Bug
report.description: Press the search icon on the top of the main screen Press back to close keyboard Press back again -> Another(?) search field appears instead of the search field beeing closed

report.summary: TB-details should show TB-name in header
report.label: Bug
report.description: After actionbar implementation the TB-detail view shows "c:geo" instead of the TB name (as it was before).

report.summary: Up navigation wrong in some actions
report.label: Bug
report.description: For some actions, the up navigation target is defined in the manifest (those, which can only have one parent). For all others, we need to dynamically set the target in code, otherwise they will lead to going to the main screen, which is not expected. http://developer.android.com/training/implementing-navigation/ancestral.html

report.summary: Crash when refreshing static maps
report.label: Bug
report.description: 2014.05.20-NB: Open list Open cache from list Press Navigate icon and select "static maps" Press refresh icon on the top right Result: Crash. Log can be provided later

report.summary: Hide disabled menu items
report.label: Bug
report.description: We have some menu items which are disabled instead of hidden. The Android design guidelines prohibit that: "If an action is unavailable in the current context, hide it. Do not show it as disabled." Examples are "Strategy" and "Store for offline", when opening a map from a cache list.

report.summary: Map popup: "Navigate" not working
report.label: Bug
report.description: When pressing "Navigate" in the menu of a map popup nothing happens.

report.summary: ¨Open in browser¨ function needs to be reworked
report.label: Bug
report.description: Due to a change on the gc.com servers the ¨trick¨ with calling a URL including a // no longer works as intended (for details see IRC log of May 21st).

report.summary: Switch to "History" breaks sorting in other lists afterwards
report.label: Bug
report.description: Version 2014.05.22-NB-19a24f4 Go to saved caches Caches are sorted by distance Select list "Verlauf" (english translation?) edit Lineflyer: History Select any other list Caches in other list are sorted differently (log date?) Go to menu, sorting I see sort order "log date" I select sort order "distance" Order does not change Checking menu, "sorting" again, it still shows "log date" Same happens when jumping to "Verlauf" directly from main screen, and selecting any other list there. It seems as if selecting list "Verlauf" locks sort order to log date. It gets unlocked when going back to main screen and selecting "saved caches" again. Then ordering is by distance, until i select "Verlauf" again. Expected behaviour: Restore previous sort order when going from "Verlauf" to any other list.

report.summary: Own log not added to friend/own log page after logging
report.label: Bug
report.description: 2014.05.22-NB: Open stored cache Post a log Result: Log is locally added to the logbook page Log is not locally added to the friends/own log page

report.summary: Units.getSpeed() returns uncommon string
report.label: Bug

report.summary: compass uses same icon for different things
report.label: Bug
report.description: In the compass menu, the "set destination" and logging menu items all use ic_menu_edit (the pencil).

report.summary: Share button leads to 2 popups
report.label: Bug
report.description: Today I used "Weiterleiten" (Share) on a cache. It lead to a popup menu directly below the share button, listing 3 or 4 share possibilities. And at the same time another selection menu popped up with more than 10 items.

report.summary: Menu button does not open overflow menu in popup
report.label: Bug
report.description: While in all other activities I can also open the overflow menu by pressing my device menu button, this does not work on the popup Galaxy S3, Android 4.3 2014.05.25-NB

report.summary: Update send2cgeo via Greasmonkey not OK
report.label: Bug
report.description: Today I tested upgrading v0.29 to v0.30. Firefox 29.0.1 Gresemonkey 1.15 Existing v0.29 installation take from here: f3b46da I opened the script manager of Greasemonkey, then right clicked on the existing send2geo installation and selected "Look for Updates" It detected and updated the script to v0.30 (at least it is shown now in the script lists) Looking deeper by using "Edit script" it turns out the script is still v0.29 (and still not working on live map). Can someone retest this please ?

report.summary: update list title before loading
report.label: Bug
report.description: With the new UI, the title of a cache list is only updated after loading the complete list. Until then it is basically empty. This makes the spinner "triangle" in the actionbar jump around every time you open a cache list. While we don't know the number of caches in advance, we should at least set the title of the list before we actually load its caches, to avoid that "jumping".

report.summary: Actions for selected caches not present in management menu
report.label: Bug
report.description: 2014.05.26-NB: Go to a list of many saved caches Scroll to the very end Activate selection mode by swiping to the right Mark some of the caches Scroll to the beginning of the list (keeping the select mode active) Press Menu - Manage Result: Only the default actions are shown (e.g. Refresh all, Delete all) Expect: Refresh selected, Delete selected, etc. should be shown In the second try it works normal. It also seems to work normal if selected caches are still "in view" on the list.

report.summary: Resorting of event lists not working
report.label: Bug
report.description: 2014.05.26-NB: Set global filter to "Event-Caches" Perform nearby search The resulting list is sorted by event date as default Select Sorting - Distance Result: Still sorted by event date Remark: Connectors for oc.de and GC active (if this makes any difference)

report.summary: When filtering subset count is not shown on lists
report.label: Bug
report.description: 2014.05.26-NB: Open list of saved caches Filter in a way that only a subset of the list is returned (e.g. Size - Regular) Result: Not that the count in the header still shows `xx Caches`` where xx represents the total and not the filtered amount In nearby search however it works liek before: Perform nearby search Filter in a way that only a subset of the list is returned (e.g. Size - Regular) Result (as expected): The heading shows yy caches/xx caches where yy is the filtered amount and xx is the total amount (like it was before implementing the actionbar)

report.summary: progress of refreshing caches
report.label: Bug
report.description: To me the progress of refreshing caches looks quite confusing (just testing in the wild). It always jumps from 0 to 2, and it reaches 100% some time before the dialog closes (probably when it starts downloading the last cache). Looks like an off by one error somehow. Is that just my imagination? For reproduction, take GC caches only, as all other sources are to fast.

report.summary: Importing .loc files from GC.com fails
report.label: Bug
report.description: Tried to Import a list from GC.com, which I've exported as loc file: Problem is the same as discribed here: #1987 (comment) Except: After hours on 100% only aprox. 53 Caches was imported. this is the list: http://www.geocaching.com/bookmarks/view.aspx?guid=645bd6da-fa8a-498f-bcce-1dd7169d3109

report.summary: Insert signature inserts placeholder instead of values
report.label: Bug
report.description: E.g. signature contains [NUMBER] only this string but not the number of finds is inserted. 2014.05.29-NB

report.summary: NFC sharing transmits wrong URL
report.label: Bug
report.description: As discussed yesterday on IRC with @schwabe c:geo is not offered as target app on the destination phone. Reason is probably, that the transmitted URL is malformed.

report.summary: ¨Start talking¨ menu item on compass not changed after selection
report.label: Bug
report.description: Open the compass Select ¨Start talking¨ The menu item is still labeled ¨Start talking¨ instead of ¨Stop talking¨

report.summary: Long press options in logbook no longer working
report.label: Bug
report.description: 2014.05.31-NB: In the last release it was possible to long press a logbook entry to do one of the following actions: Copy Translate to Share At the moment there seems to be no action associated with a long press anymore.

report.summary: Short press actions for WPs no longer working
report.label: Bug
report.description: 2014.05.31-NB: With the last release short press on a waypoint in the waypoint tab offered a menu for: Edit Duplicate Prefered navigation Navigate Caches around Now short press does not result in any action. Long press for editing however is still working.

report.summary: list switching does not respect current filter
report.label: Bug
report.description: Activate a filter on a stored list. Switch to another stored list. The filter is still shown as active, but the list content is actually not filtered.

report.summary: switching list reloads all current caches
report.label: Bug
report.description: When switching a list, we reload all current caches, before actually loading all caches of the new list.

report.summary: number of caches wrong in footer bar
report.label: Bug
report.description: Start a search. Activate a filter. Hit "more caches". Afterwards the footer shows the filtered number, while it showed the overall before. We could either fix this or get rid of the numbers (as they are already at the top in the spinner). Anyone with strong opinions about that?

report.summary: Will attend not counted in log summary on OC-logbooks
report.label: Bug
report.description: Open OC10CB8 In the logbook summary on the logbook tab the "WIll attend" logs (and maybe other log types as well??) are not counted

report.summary: [User] template does always use the GC username
report.label: Bug
report.description: Later

report.summary: Cache subtitle not shown
report.label: Bug
report.description: Open OC10C06 in c:geo and on the website You will see, that this cache has a kind of subtitle (shown onn the website right below the title). This subtitle (which may contain relevant information) is not shown in c:geo 2014.06.03-NB

report.summary: existing gcvote not shown during logging
report.label: Bug
report.description: If a user has already voted, this is not shown when creating another log entry. The stars should be "pre-filled" then.

report.summary: Wrong resource type used
report.label: Bug
report.description: In CacheDetailActivity.java, there are two instances of descriptionView.setBackgroundResource(color.darker_gray); According to the documentation, setBackgroundResource expects a drawable, not a color, or 0 to mean no background.

report.summary: Menu hard key not working
report.label: Bug
report.description: From FB: Galaxy S2 Slimkat 4.3 - Upper Right (3-dot) Menu Button works, hardware key does not - menu opens, but none of the menu items are selectable. I'm sure it's a nightly issue, but wanted to let you know anyways. Keep up the good work! I asked the following and waiting for answer: Thanks for the feedback. Please allow some questions (either here or via support mail): Is this a Custom 4.3 ROM? Please check the setting for the three-dot button in Menu - Settings - Appearance. Any change depending on its setting? Version of the nightly build

report.summary: Static Maps download failed for caches not offline
report.label: Bug
report.description: Set to not automatically store static maps, Choose a cache from map that is not stored for offline. Go to details. Choose maps/store static maps. You get a toast "No static map found". It works fine with caches store for offline usage.

report.summary: Waypoint context menu missing
report.label: Bug
report.description: I can't open a waypoint context menu anymore on my sg3. 2014.06.07-NB-2a86e7c

report.summary: Turning compass on/off is counter-intuitive
report.label: Bug
report.description: Turning the compass on/off is counter-intuitive in the compass activity, as you have to click on the "compass" icon and gets no visual feedback. This setting should never be placed onto the action bar.

report.summary: Doubled friend log in standard logbook
report.label: Bug
report.description: Not sure whether a special case or a general bug: I have a cache where I see the friend log (only log on friend logbook page) doubled in the normal logbook page. The cache has only 18 logs, so all its logs are contained in the normal logbook page. 2014.06.06-NB

report.summary: Duplicate short description not recognized
report.label: Bug
report.description: OCE142

report.summary: RxJava periodic timer is not stopped in onPause
report.label: Bug
report.description: We had several user reports issues with hangs/ANRs after unlocking a phone that has been locked on the map screen for an extended period (10 mins till over 1 hour). Digging into this I was able to see, that the unsubscribe in CGeoMap.onPause does not stop the LoadTimerAction from being called. According to my limited knowledge this is what unsubscribe is for. I was unable to finally deduce if this is an implementation Problem (incorrect Api usage) or a bug in rxJava. If the latter is true, it seems to be present even in the latest 0.19.0 version (I could not fully switch to that, but had to fake/comment out stuff related to the GeoDir handler in order to build it) Any of the more experienced (@samueltardieu @Bananeweizen ) that can shed some light on this or provide pointers for further research?

report.summary: NPE in rx code
report.label: Bug
report.description: Sometimes I see exceptions occur in rx code. I believe this is the status fragment, but I'm not sure, as I did not yet catch the exception in the debugger... See Netflix/RxJava#1354

report.summary: Problem to authorize with OC.de
report.label: Bug
report.description: From support mail. Any idea? I have a problem authorizing opencaching.de with cgeo. After I'm redirected to the opencaching site, I answer to authorize with yes, then a URL is invoked in the browser that begins with " callback://www.cgeo.org[...] " Of course the browser gives an error. I think this callback-function is supposed to open cgeo, not a browser page. I'm using a Pipo T9 Talk Tablet with 4.2.2 and lightning browser.

report.summary: Crash when trying to open lists
report.label: Bug
report.description: With 2014.06.13-NB I can no longer open the list of saved caches. Log will follow later.

report.summary: Share menu not working
report.label: Bug
report.description: If I select to share a cache from cache details page using 2014.06.14-NB nothing happens.

report.summary: History menu contains not working "Import"
report.label: Bug
report.description: The menu of the history contains an item "Import", but nothing happens when pressing on it (only the menu closes).

report.summary: "All caches" list not remembered
report.label: Bug
report.description: If the list "all caches" is shown, it is not selected after going back and pressing "lists" again. Also, when long-pressing the list icon and selecting "all caches" from the menu, the activity starts with the default list.

report.summary: Crash when starting log activity
report.label: Bug
report.description: 2014.06.15-NB Crash when selecting log visit for an OC cache Details later

report.summary: Hide top menu item if no submenu is available
report.label: Bug
report.description: Create an empty list (or delete all caches from an existing list) Select Menu - Manage Result: Nothing happens which looks like malfunction but in fact there is no further submenu to be shown on an empty list.

report.summary: Waypoints disappear when turning device
report.label: Bug
report.description: When I use the livemap an zoom in to 100m and turn the device, the waypoints/stages disappear. When turning back, the waypoints appear again. When zooming to 50m, 20m or 10m the stages disappear after turning and do not appear again since I zoom out to 100m. The configured number of caches to show waypoint was above the shown waypoints.

report.summary: Caches vanish from lists when storing them
report.label: Bug
report.description: Market release 2014.06.11: Disable Menu -> Settings -> Offline-data -> "Ask for list" Perform a search (e.g. by city) Select "Store for Offline" from the resulting list Cache storage progress is shown normally After storing has been finished you will see that the number of total stored caches (on the main menu) did not increase nor are those caches visible in any of the lists. A fix for this should go to the release branch if possible.

report.summary: New date formats on gc.com
report.label: Bug
report.description: According to our FAQ and my experience we support all of the date formats of gc.com except dd/MM/yyyy as we can not differentiate it from MM/dd/yyyy So we support and detect: yyyy-MM-dd yyyy/MM/dd MM/dd/yyyy dd/MMM/yyyy MMM/dd/yyyy dd MMM yy See: http://faq.cgeo.org/#1_6 Right now the amount of people having problems with log dates and contacting us has raised. I checked the website and have seen the following new(?) date formats: dd.MMM.yyyy dd.mm.yyyy Seems gc.com introduced '.' as separator as well. At least four users gave feedback, that they were actually using one of these but did not actively change to that. So might be, that they changed some defaults based on whatever rule. Shall we do anything for that? dd.MMM.yyyy should be detectable and usable, but dd.mm.yyyy is not usable I think (due to the existing mm.dd.yyyy)

report.summary: Enable live not working from wp map
report.label: Bug
report.description: 2014.06.21-NB: This scenario was working in the past and I used it quite a lot: Open a cache which has saved waypoints Open map for a waypoint Select "Enable live" on the map Expectation: Map is working as live map now (showing saved caches as well as loading live caches) Result: No loading, no caches shown

report.summary: Usage of Mytery instead of Unknown in GPX exports
report.label: Bug
report.description: From support mail: I'm using export from cgeo and import to Locus. I noticed this issue Mystery vs Unknown C:geo exports mystery caches with Geocache| groundspeak:typeMystery Cache/groundspeak:type Locus expects Geocache|Unknown Cache groundspeak:type/groundspeak:type At http://www.geocaching.com/about/guidelines.aspx#mystery I found this information: Note: Cache owners creating a mystery/puzzle cache will select "" from the cache types on the cache submission form http://www.geocaching.com/hide/cachebasics.aspx. I think "Unknown Cache" is the correct cache type.

report.summary: Wrong sized overlays on map again
report.label: Bug
report.description: With #1399 a similar/the same problem was solved. I just purchased a SGS4 with has a higher resolution as SGS3 and now those overlay icons loog missized again (refer to screenshots in original issue, it looks quite the same). As my SGS3 was OK with the same build I guess we have the same problem now with one higher resolution step. Remark; For the SGS3 it was solved with this commit: a0566f5

report.summary: send2cgeo hangs with Firefox/Greasemonkey
report.label: Bug
report.description: At least 10 users are mailing on support, that send2cgeo stopped working: Although browser and phone are registered, after clicking ¨Send to c:geo¨ ¨Please wait¨ is shown endlessly send2cgeo seems to work in general and also for me some days ago with Firefox. I assume we either have a server problem or a sepcific (new) Firefox or Greasemonkey version? Can someone crosscheck...I dont have a PC with me in Italy.

report.summary: Cache not added to history if unsaved and logged from popup
report.label: Bug
report.description: Been running the latest nightly builds for som time now and there's one annoying bug with the ones I've used this week. The history doesn't contain all the offline logs resulting in missing found logs when exporting the feild notes. I noticed this the first time July 16th and it's the same today. All caches are saved and updated on the phone prior to caching. The offline logs are saved and I'm able to open the logs from the individual caches, but they simply don't appear in the history. Today 2 of the caches are not shown, last time it was 3 or 4. Currently running 2014-07-18-NB1-0822830 and can confirm that the bug is still there.

report.summary: ANR in CacheListActivity
report.label: Bug
report.description: I just had an ANR in CacheListActivity. I opened a pocket query ZIP file from the launcher and selected c:geo. The app opened, but nothing happened afterwards. This is in a location, where I normally only get a GPS fix after quite some time. I run a one or two days old build with enabled Play service location provider. My feeling is this could be a "block until GPS is ready" issue again.

report.summary: Cannot import lab cache from gpx
report.label: Bug
report.description: Got a report right now. Lab caches cannot be imported from gpx. Can attach a file when at home.

report.summary: New fused provider breaks BT-GPS
report.label: Bug
report.description: Previously it was possible to have location switched off and use BT-GPS and an external GPS receiver via the mock location provider. This seems not to work any more.

report.summary: No borders shown around favorite rectangle on white theme
report.label: Bug
report.description: If no gcvote rating is present, the favorite rectangle on the lists do have a black border (1dp) on the white theme. However if a rating is present (background is green/orange/red) the border is missing. I do not see why this is the case, because the border color is defined. Probably another appearance of the confusing alpha values in the ARGB color definitions. Will try investigate this.

report.summary: Navigate to additional waypoint shows main cache in map
report.label: Bug
report.description: When navigating to one of the additional waypoints of a cache (e.g. stages of a multicache), the cache itself is displayed on the map instead of the selected waypoint. When trying to navigate to that waypoint again, it works. Steps to reproduce: open a cache with multiple waypoints go to the left-most screen (list of waypoints) select a waypoint (e.g. a station of a multi-cache) so that you get the context menu select Navigate select Map Current result: main icon of that cache is displayed (on its correct location) Expected result: selected waypoint should be displayed on the map Workaround: go back to the waypoint list repeat the steps Notes: seems to be timing related on slower devices the problem only happens occasionally

report.summary: GC membership information may be wrong in logs
report.label: Bug
report.description: The membership (basic vs. premium) given in the logs right after a change of account is still the one of the previous user.

report.summary: Database should be cleared when changing username
report.label: Bug
report.description: When changing the username in the application, some information in the database becomes obsolete (found, favorite, friends, etc.) and cannot be easily rebuilt without doing many requests to the various connected sites. The user should have the choice to partially erase the database (connector dependent) when switching from a valid logged in user into another one on any connector.

report.summary: Wrong date in geocaching.com after logging online
report.label: Bug
report.description: I have recently noticed multiple instances of following feature: I'm in GMT +02 timezone (Helsinki). I have this timezone setting both in my phone and in geocaching.com (just checked). If I submit a new log (i.e. Cache found) before 10 am Finnish time, using "Today" as submission date, the log will show with the previous date in geocaching.com. I.e. today 21.8. I submitted online two cache visits between 9 and 10 a.m. from my Android phone using c:geo. When reviewing these logs with my computer, I find out that both instances have been saved in geocaching.com with date 20.8. This has happened before, also i.e. with a morning meet log. It seems that somewhere in the chain the time stamps are not handled correctly. I have also reported this problem to geocaching.com, since I've learned that similar problem occurs also with some other online software, at least neongeo.

report.summary: frozen compass
report.label: Bug
report.description: When using the app on Samsung Galaxy Note 2, you open the compass to direct you to the cahe coordinates, it remains static. Distance to coords changes, gps position moves as expected, but compass doesnt move or is jumpy and then freezes. Ive uninstalled and reinstalled to no effect. This was working perfectly up until a day ago.

report.summary: Showcaseview crashes on Android 2.3.x

com.github.amlcurran.showcaseview.AnimatorAnimationFactory.fadeInView(AnimatorAnimationFactory.java:40) at com.github.amlcurran.showcaseview.ShowcaseView.fadeInShowcase(ShowcaseView.java:315) at report.summary: No action bar on map activities on Android 3.x

report.description: It looks like Android 3.x does not exhibit any action bar on our map activities. To avoid a crash (see #4240), we allowed users of Android 3.x to launch the map but without any bar nor menu. This makes the map mostly unusable.

report.summary: Cache placed date parsing is wrong
report.label: Bug
report.description: It looks like the HTML code has changed. To check, look for keyword "CITO", the CITO events do not have the date in the search results.

report.summary: Trackable location disappears in logs
report.label: Bug
report.description: Trackable location in logs disappears when the activity is restored. To reproduce: open a trackable, go to the logs page, put your phone to sleep, turn the phone back on, the locations will be removed in the left column.

report.summary: Do not migrate nonexistent settings
report.label: Bug
report.description: Right now, Settings.migrateSettings() is called if the right version is not found. However, in the absence of settings (for example in a fresh installation), this method is called and for integer settings install settings that might be different than the default found in the corresponding setter. This led to #3723 because the default was present in two places. We should avoid callling migrateSettings if no previous settings are present, for example by checking for the presence of a known key which had always been there, or by checking (if possible) for the presence of those shared preferences.

report.summary: unpublished caches not recognized
report.label: Bug
report.description: No description provided.

report.summary: No D/T/Size parsed if CAPTCHA is active
report.label: Bug
report.description: Login as Basic member (be sure no cache is saved/cached) Enable Captcha in settings Perform a search (e.g. nearby) Enter the correct Captcha Result: The list has coordinates (exact distances) but no D/T/Size info is shown Login as Basic member (be sure no cache is saved/cached) Disable Captcha in settings Perform a search (e.g. nearby) Result: The list has no coordinates (approx. distanances and arrow picture) but D/T/SIze is shown

report.summary: Screen rotation stoppes talking compass
report.label: Bug
report.description: 2014.09.02 Way to reproduce: open a cache navigate via compass press talking icon and c:geo starts talking (why does it sometimes takes so long?) rotate screen 90° A message is displayed "talking stopped"

report.summary: configChanges=screenSize is missing
report.label: Bug
report.description: I'm just experimenting with changes in the compass. It would stop the speech service on rotation although we implemented our own configuration change handling for this activity. Google says we need to add one more configuration change "screenSize": http://stackoverflow.com/questions/6968105/orientation-change-in-honeycomb Might be relevant for other activities too.

report.summary: Dialog "Uploading Waypoint…" although not uploading
report.label: Bug
report.description: The dialog is shown every time you press "Save" after editing or creation of a waypoint. It should be shown only if this waypoint is uploaded. Btw: How can you upload waypoints? You can only upload changed coordinates of a cache.

report.summary: Everywhere function: No history when navigate via compass
report.label: Bug
report.description: Input coordinates Press the compass icon Press back, the coordinates are not in the history. Press back (go back to main screen), coordinates are added to the history. Additional issue: With history items there is a overflow menu button (three dots) with "nearby caches" and "clear history". Sometimes the button is shown but when you press it, it changes to the arrow for loading nearby caches.

report.summary: Sorting selector sometimes not prefilled
report.label: Bug
report.description: 2014.09.08.-NB: Followup of #3914 and #4260 Steps: Clean start c:geo (no sorting set for this session) Open list with non-event caches Check sorting menu, sort by distance is active Change to a list of event caches Default sorting changes to event date (=hidden date) automatically Check sorting menu --> No entry is selected but should be "Hidden date" Also related to #4321

report.summary: Refresh captcha boutton doen't refresh...
report.label: Bug
report.description: Login as Basic member Enable Captcha in settings Perform a search (e.g. nearby) Tap the refresh icon. Would expect a new captcha to be shown...

report.summary: Map scale icon jumpy
report.label: Bug
report.description: I have encountered a problem with map scale icon, which frequently jumps by itself, or upon scrolling the map (no zooming action), between the actual map scale and a different scale (corresponding to a significant zoom out). See picture, shows the same area, same scale, only slight scroll.

report.summary: Unstable location
report.label: Bug
report.description: This may be related to the map scale issue. My list of caches, sorted by proximity, jumps wildly. I have a cache at 149m, then after a few seconds I see it at 3.26km, then again at 149m... GPS fix is stable, position icon on map is stable. GPS fix on map in other apps is stable. Position in GPS status app is stable. I am connected to internet via wifi, I have GSM off. The same happens with GSM+WiFi all off, or with all on. At first it may seem like jumps between coarse and fine location, but in airplane mode there is no coarse location provider (eg. GSM tower)

report.summary: Checkbox not correct if c:geo performs autoswitch to imperial units
report.label: Bug
report.description: Having tested these builds: (posted in #4097) https://www.dropbox.com/sh/f9nj0u9tnhgnm7t/AACKQQLMrQ0uKfSO71XlcRnVa?dl=0 both JIT and non-JIT exhibit the same problem: freshly installed cgeo (old one uninstalled) starts by showing imperial units on the map. In settings, appearance, the corresponding checkbox is unchecked. I can only get metric units by toggling on then off this setting. The current release version in googe play does not have this issue. (tested).

report.summary: Contextual action bar item calendar does not work
report.label: Bug
report.description: Long tap the time of an event. The contextual action bar has an item to add this to the calendar. It does not do anything.

report.summary: Share cache invokes different action
report.label: Bug
report.description: Share a cache and select the "show all" entry from there share menu. On my system that starts locus immediately.

report.summary: Translation warning at wrong time
report.label: Bug
report.description: Long tap a log entry to invoke contextual action bar. That already leads to the long text translation warning toast.

report.summary: OX caches should have blank before rating
report.label: Bug
report.description: OX caches have a line like Traditional Cache(2.0/1.0/3.0) There should be a blank before the opening brace. We could even think about removing all information that is already shown elsewhere.

report.summary: HTML links with area tag in description does not work
report.label: Bug
report.description: This one is from support email: If a link on picture is done using area tag and not a href links in c:geo does not work. Example caches are GC2B09B (hyperlink on the pic) and GC4ZR3R (maplink on the compass). Shall we do anything or it's too excotic?

report.summary: Map popup shows earth cache size
report.label: Bug
report.description: In cache details we hide the size for earth caches. In the map popup we wrongly show it. When fixing this, make sure the same condition is used. I guess we hide it for all virtual caches.

report.summary: Copy Paste operations in personal note not visible on white theme
report.label: Bug
report.description: From support mail: Galaxy S2, Android 4.1.2 version: 2014.09.02 The title bar in text selection mode seems to be white on white:

report.summary: Picture comments not shown
report.label: Bug
report.description: From support mail: I have a cache where I failed due to the invisibility of an addtional info. Cache: GC47DP5 The hint picture "Hinweis wie du zu A kommst" contains a subheading. I can't find it in c:geo. I did not check where this subtitle is coming from but can confirm that we do not seem to support this.

report.summary: Translate encoded hint does not work
report.label: Bug
report.description: When invoking the translation menu on an encoded hint the result is just garbage. We should make the cache details creator set explicit ids for each line (which must be defined in ids.XML) instead of using id.value everywhere. When we have explicit ids for each line then we can easily take the necessary string from the cache member fields instead of reading it from the text controls.

report.summary: No "caches nearby" after restart
report.label: Bug
report.description: Use power safe mode in our settings. Restart device. Open the app. The nearby button remains disabled as the GPS does not get activated in the main activity.

report.summary: Avoid duplicate shortcuts
report.label: Bug
report.description: We currently allow creating the same shortcut multiple times. We should delete an existing identical one. http://stackoverflow.com/a/20864800

report.summary: Unknown trackable if network not available
report.label: Bug
report.description: Have no data connection. Lookup a trackable code from main screen. A trackable result opens without any details except the geocode. We should show an error instead.

report.summary: No menu item for attaching picture
report.label: Bug
report.description: From FB: Android 2.3.6. The menu item for attaching a photo to a log seems missing. I had a mail conversation with another user a week ago and from his description it looks like the same problem. Neither the overflow nor the icons contain the corresponding menu item. Ihad no chance to retest this on a 2.3.x device yet.
