report.summary: Wrong initial positioning on live map
report.label: Bug
report.description: Today I was out caching with 2014.10.09-NB and had the following problem, which I try to describe: Low power mode activated in c:geo I started at home where I had Wifi active in my home network I drove 35km to the cache location Activated the live map The initial position before GPS fix is accquired is still "at home" making the position jump 35km forth and back on each standby and resume of the map Most probably the location provider had no better information, so it took the last available approximated position until the fix is done. What I don't understand is, that this happens repeatedly altough after the first fix the location provider should rather assume that I am on the last known position. Is this a problem/behaviour of the Google Service or can we do anything about that. I never experienced this "problem" in c:geo versions without Google Location Service.

report.summary: Crosscheck new preferences page
report.label: Bug
report.description: Recently gc.com changed the content of http://www.geocaching.com/account/ManagePreferences.aspx which is used in the login process of c:geo. It is now forwarded to https://www.geocaching.com/myaccount/settings/preferences with a new UI. I tested that the date format seems still to be detected correct, but I did not test all possible formats (so I am not 100% sure). Additionally I don't know what else other information we retrieve from the mentioned URL. Please notice that now also HTTPS is used. Can someone confirm that all is working normal at this point?

report.summary: Application stack not correct coming from mail
report.label: Bug
report.description: Open a cache from a mail. Afterwards hit the up button at the top left. This returns to the mail client instead of navigating up.

report.summary: Select mode by slide right sucks
report.label: Bug
report.description: If I slide right on a list to select one item and switch to select mode, the context menu opens up and I need to press back every time. Context menu should open only by longer touch or select mode should not start by slide rigth an entry anymore.

report.summary: Last zoom not remembered
report.label: Bug
report.description: 2014.10.18-NB Open map Zoom in to e.g. 100m per unit Close live map Open live map again Zoom is reset to a higher value

report.summary: String missing in crowdin translation
report.label: Bug
report.description: 2014.10.18-NB: Today I stumbled over an english string in my german version. I took a quick look and it seems caches_clear_offlinelogs_message is not in the german strings.xml and not listed for translation on crowdin. Why (or did I simply overlook it)?

report.summary: Disable optional action bar actions by default
report.label: Bug
report.description: I just imported a cache from mail on my tablet in landscape mode. During the import 2 pencils were visible in the action bar, after the import one of them vanished. Conclusion: In all actions that take more than a tiny amount of time to initialize we should disable optional actions by default (instead of declaring them visible in the XML and then hiding them in the code).

report.summary: Search result limited to 40 caches again
report.label: Bug
report.description: Issue #4012 seems to be reappearing (some mails on support mail in the last weeks). Market version Premium-Member Here is a german step-by-step which I can't reproduce but believe in (will translate later if necessary): Bei EinstellungenAppsc:geoCache gelöscht Bei EinstellungenAppsc:geoDaten gelöscht c:geo deinstalliert Handy neu gestartet Aus dem Play Store c:geo neu installiert Ohne Wiederherstellen meiner Datenbanksicherung und ohne etwas an den Einstellungen in c:geo zu ändern (nur Accountdaten von geocaching.com) die „in der Nähe suchen“-Funktion angeklickt C:geo findet mehr als 40 Cache „Eigene und gefundene Cache ausblenden“ ausgewählt und Suche noch einmal gestartet C:geo findet nur 40 Cache Datenbanksicherung wieder hergestellt und noch einmal getestet C:geo findet nur 40 Cache Funktion „Eigene und gefundene Cache ausblenden“ deaktiviert C:geo findet wieder mehr als 40 Cache

report.summary: Menu items missing in popup
report.label: Bug
report.description: Current NB: The menu item Log visit (and others?) Are missing in the overflow menu of the cache popup on map.

report.summary: Storing filtered list results in crash (IndexOutOfBoundsException)
report.label: Bug
report.description: Hi, I have a crash that can be reproduced (at least on my phone). Running 18/9/2014 (latest from playstore) on Galaxy S3 Cyanogenmod 11 M11. I tried https://github.com/cgeo/cgeo/wiki/Send-log-to-developers but it doesn't generate any log output. Just some few lines about an activity starting: --------- beginning of /dev/log/main I/Timeline( 5904): Timeline: Activity_idle id: android.os.BinderProxy@41c450a8 time:375560 W/InputEventReceiver( 5904): Attempted to finish an input event but the input event receiver has already been disposed. I/Timeline( 5904): Timeline: Activity_idle id: android.os.BinderProxy@41e248b0 time:405629 I/Timeline( 5904): Timeline: Activity_idle id: android.os.BinderProxy@41e248b0 time:416735 I/Timeline( 5904): Timeline: Activity_idle id: android.os.BinderProxy@41e248b0 time:739101 If I go to /dev/log to see what's in the logs, there are only empty files there. The google crash report does show the stacktrace nicely, but it seems impossible to store this report somewhere? To reproduce I do the following: Open a pocket query in c:geo with more than 20 caches in result. First 20 are showing. Apply filter: Status=Not Stored. Observe less than 20 result remaining, for example 19. Select Store Offline from menu. Select create new list. Observe crash after a few seconds. There's an IndexOutOfBoundsException in CacheListActivity.java:286. Please note that when I rerun the scenario above, there are less than 19 caches not stored. For example 16. Next run: 14 not stored, etc. So it does store some caches before crashing. It does not show any progress in the bar before crashing. So maybe it tries to update the progress bar and crashes? If I try the exact same pocket query with no filter, I can store it fine. I tried with different pocket queries, so it looks like it doesn't matter which pocket query I use. Anything else I can provide?

report.summary: Wrong image title in TB-log
report.label: Bug
report.description: I have just seen with 2014.10.27-NB that the image title for the second latest log entry for this TB seems to be malformed. http://www.geocaching.com//track/details.aspx?tracker=TB121TG To be verified.

report.summary: Wrong distance for „nearby“ caches when setting WP as cache coordinates
report.label: Bug
report.description: I have one saved solved mystery (in a list) where i set the calculated final WP coordinate as new cache coordinate, locally and on the web site. When doing a search for nearby caches, i see the cache listed with (and sorted by) the distance to the publish coordinates, not the new saved coordinates. When i go to the cache details, i see the correct (bigger) distance to the final. When returning to the list of nearby caches, now that cache is listed with and sorted by the correct (bigger) distance. This can be reproduced by closing the list of nearby caches and opening it again. I expect to see the distance to the cache to be correct upfront. Version: 2014.10.28-NB-935444e

report.summary: Jumping "solved mystery" on live map
report.label: Bug
report.description: While reading #4441 I remembered a similar issue on the live map which I experienced with 2014.10.25-NB: Have some caches with modified coords saved in c:geo Open the live map of this location (it might be important for this issue, that the listing coords and the modified coords are both within the map view) While the live map is loading the solved mytery are already shown at their modified coords (including the flagpost overlay icon) as it should be After loading it might happen (but not always) that the solved mystery jumps to the listing coords (but still showing the flagpost overlay) This situation can be corrected by moving or zooming the map which makes the caches jump back to their modified coords @samueltardieu As you are assigned to #4441 maybe you can take a look at this one as well. I assume the wrong positioning comes from a similar source = The nearby search performed during live map loading

report.summary: URL change on gc.com
report.label: Bug
report.description: According to the latest gc.com release note some URLs have changed. Currently they are forwarded to the old URL but we might need to update: Update your bookmarks! The following URLs will be changing: www.geocaching.com/myaccount will now be www.geocaching.com/account This acffects the URL for the preference page we are requesting. Update your bookmarks! The following URLs will be changing: www.geocaching.com/adventures will now be www.geocaching.com/play This is probably not used by c:geo ?!

report.summary: Still OOM crashes on rotation of offline map
report.label: Bug
report.description: Today I attended an event, where a user showed me the following crash scenario on his Samsung Galaxy Note 2 (running Android 4.4.2) with c:geo version 2014.09.18: Open live map using OSM:Offline map Rotate 3 times On fourth rotation c:geo crashes The specific play report shows only this: java.lang.OutOfMemoryError at android.graphics.Bitmap.nativeCreate(Native Method) at android.graphics.Bitmap.createBitmap(Bitmap.java:928) at android.graphics.Bitmap.createBitmap(Bitmap.java:901) at android.graphics.Bitmap.createBitmap(Bitmap.java:868) at org.mapsforge.android.maps.overlay.Overlay.changeSize(Overlay.java:411) at org.mapsforge.android.maps.overlay.Overlay.run(Overlay.java:246) This can not be the multiwindow bug as it should be disabled in that version. I can contact the user. What else would we need to find the reason? Possibly a memory dump...but AFAIR this is not automatically created in the release version isn't it?

report.summary: Show "found dates" in logbook page
report.label: Bug
report.description: When showing cache details and swiping to the logbook page, some recent logs are shown. The name of the logger, the logtype (e.g. found it, didn't find it) and the number of found caches are shown with the logtext, but I am also interested in the log dates. Was the cache found recently, was the cache found every day or only once a month. When showing the dates this gives you more information about that.

report.summary: Caches not loading with 2014.03.11
report.label: Bug
report.description: Three reports on Google Play saying that the new verison does not open caches and get stuck while loading in "Loading Details" (or similar). Unverified.

report.summary: Login failure always reports "Unkown error"
report.label: Bug
report.description: As the login error message on gc.com changed we currenlty always report "Unknown error". Seems they now alway report Either your username or password is incorrect. Please try again. If you've forgotten your information, click here. So we might now be unable to distinguish between username or password failure and should always probably give the same message as above.

report.summary: Favorite status and button missing for Charter Members
report.label: Bug
report.description: From support mail: I user is missing the button for adding a cache to his favorites. He send along a screenshot which seems to confirm, that the whole favorite line is missing. Login is checked OK, all other functions normal. Any idea? I asked him to crosscheck another device and another user on his device. Waiting for answer. To only "unusual" thing I noticed up to now is, that the user has a 5-digit find count. Might this influence the parsing at that point?

report.summary: Waypoint limit not working
report.label: Bug
report.description: to be completed after the weekend. not at home currently I can see the wp for thr original coords of my saved caches with corrected coords even on a map with an amount of caches which is above the limit.

report.summary: Cache rendering has massive delay or leads to ANR
report.label: Bug
report.description: Opening this cache Geocache GC49CQC - Das Nest der Hedwigeule - zum 5000. - http://coord.info/GC49CQC is obviously problematic. On my Galaxy S4 the whole app gets quite unresponsive and sometimes runs into an ANR.

report.summary: Cache size info lost on refresh
report.label: Bug
report.description: Three users reported this via support mail: Version: 2014.11.04 All users are PM Have a list of offline saved caches Refresh the list of caches After refresh some caches are missing the size info in the list view as well as in the details (line is missing) Doing another refresh either solves the problem or other random caches loose the size info One user reported, that after a fresh reboot of the device (probably a fresh start of c:geo would be enough) the problem disappears for some time to happen again after some hours. With current master I can not reproduce this. I will test the market version later and report back.

report.summary: Wrong date shown for cache/TB log if logged with past date
report.label: Bug
report.description: In detail view, date when cache was found is displayed after the status "found". This must be rather new feature, i guess, i never noticed that before. Anyway, when logging a cache from c:geo one day later, setting the date to „yesterday“, the date shown after the cache status is today, not „yesterday“. So caches found 8th of november but logged on 9th of november with log date „yesterday“ are displayed as found on 9th of november. Interestingly enough, gc.com has a similar bug: I logged my first cache from Saarland one day late and manually set the date to one day before. Cache found date is correct, but the date i aquired the Saarland souvenir is wrong, it's the date i entered the log. But that is unrelated. I forgot: Nightly 2014-11-10-NB1-e0afb7

report.summary: Choose map directory in preferences not readable with light theme
report.label: Bug
report.description: When you have selected the light theme (Android 4.4.4), the button 'Choose directory' in the map selection in the preferences is black on black...

report.summary: Various crashes during usage
report.label: Bug
report.description: With todays NB Details later

report.summary: Gcvote not always shown in logging window
report.label: Bug
report.description: 2014.11.09-NB (newer version not tested yet) When logging a cache sometimes the gcvote selector is not shown below the text window. Sometimes it works, sometimes not. Need to puzzle it out later.

report.summary: Mass-refreshing caches won't refresh stale images
report.label: Bug
report.description: If onlySave is true, the image will never be refreshed even if it is not fresh enough. It is only refreshed if we intend to display it immediately.

report.summary: Lint warnings are shown as new instead of fixed
report.label: Bug
report.description: In http://ci.cgeo.org/job/c-geo/3007/androidLintResult/new/ Lint warnings appear as if they were new, while in fact they have been fixed.

report.summary: send2cgeo for opencaching.de does no longer work
report.label: Bug
report.description: As the website removed the button which is our anchor point, the send2cgeo button is no longer shown (cross-check other oc-nodes as well!)

report.summary: Cache with many repeated images may corrupt the on-disk copy
report.label: Bug
report.description: As reported originally in a followup to #4481, rendering of GC5GMTZ leads to corrupted on-disk copies because the same image is fetched and tentatively cached multiple times simultanously.

report.summary: Unnecessary error message when starting logging activity for OC caches
report.label: Bug
report.description: From support mail (not yet verified): OU077B Saved cache description ok. I am using offline logs. Saved a basic "found" OK, but when adding to the log offline, it gives unable to retrieve needed info, or similar. Hit send log arrow. It gives a popup, "loading log page OK" Expected behavior: Work like GC.com.

report.summary: Reference to geocaching.com when any cache log fails to be sent
report.label: Bug
report.description: Even if a cache comes from an opencaching site, an error to post the log invites the user to check if the log has been posted on geocaching.com.

report.summary: Sygic voucher edition not recognized
report.label: Bug
report.description: From support mail: Sygic is not enabled as navigation method although Sygic is installed. Further investigation shows, that the users uses another Sygic app called "Sygic voucher edition". The only difference should be an included activation code from some promotion. However I can reproduce that Sygic stays disabled in our navigation menu after the voucher edition has been installed like the user reports. I only don't know whether it is related to a difference within the different Sygic apps or just us by having a too strict check method?

report.summary: Save PQ-list of caches fails
report.label: Bug
report.description: From Facebook for version 2014.12.09: Viewing caches of a PQ is working, but batch saving them fails since the update. You can only save one by one but not the whole list. The program crashes then. Original: Das anzeigen der caches von PQs funktioniert, aber das speichern leider nicht mehr seit dem neuesten update. Es geht nur noch ein einzelnen speichern der caches, aber nicht mehr der gesamten liste. Da hängt sich das programm auf.

report.summary: "Loading cache details" window shown when trying to open a saved cache
report.label: Bug
report.description: This is not reproducible but botheres me the whole day today: Version 2014.12.12 Slow network connection Caches are saved offline I entered a search term in the search function on the main screen which matches an offline saved cache I selected one of the results shown At this point sometimes a windows "Loading cache details" comes up and stays for 10-20 sedonds. As the caches are all offline I dont understand what kind of activity is going on here. Not reproducible, either it depends on the specific cache or the speed or availability of the network connection?!

report.summary: Blue arrow does not appear on map
report.label: Bug
report.description: This has been reported by a user using a Wiko Cink Peax2 running Android 4.1.2 with cgeo 2014.12.12. The arrow does not appear when the user rotates the device.

report.summary: Fuzzy scale
report.label: Bug
report.description: Hey, I have a problem with the c:geo app. Every time I use the map the scale is fuzzy. Sometimes, in the caches description there are fuzzy letters or numbers, too. See http://www.directupload.net/file/d/3837/6d6svt4k_png.htm Is it a bug? Thanks for helping, melawe (I use samsung galaxy duos gt s7582, android 4.2.2)

report.summary: Can't set English language for c:geo if using Android in home language
report.label: Bug
report.description: Set my Android in Latvian to see translations and test them, it seems to me, that it should be possible to select language set as English by default, if I want. I use Options - Appearances - Use English language (restart needed), but still app lang stays Latvian, for example.

report.summary: Favorite points not updated in cache details after adding it to your favorites
report.label: Bug
report.description: 2014.12.16-NB Have a saved found cache Open caches details and select "Add to favorites" The online operation is succesful but the shown amount of favorite points is not increased After refresh the correct number is shown This used to work fine in some past version, but is reproducibly not working in the current NB

report.summary: No current position since the last update.
report.label: Bug
report.description: After the last update (2014.12.12) c:geo doesn´t display the current Position with the blue marker. C:geo show a wrong position far from the correct one. Moreover the blue aim and the map are stuck even if you move. Samsung Galaxy Tab7

report.summary: Illusion running 2.3.x does not support `SENSOR_DELAY_NORMAL` for rotation
report.label: Bug

report.summary: Amount of favpoints no longer shown for own caches
report.label: Bug
report.description: Starting with 2014.12.17-NB the line showing the amount of favorite points is empty in cache details of owned caches. In list view the amount of favpoints is shown normally.

report.summary: c:geo crashes when entering waypoint coordinates
report.label: Bug
report.description: Since yesterday, after installing the android update on my Device: Samsung S4 Mini Android: 4.4.2 Kernel: 3.4.0-3173303 c:geo: 2014.12.12 it is not possible to enter coordinates at the waypoint dialog anymore. When touching the coordinate field, the app crashes. When touching one of the other fields, I can edit them. On a different device, same model, different kernel the app works fine Device: Samsung S4 Mini Android: 4.4.2 Kernel: 3.4.0-3011164 c:geo: 2014.12.12

report.summary: Log statistics sometimes missing when downloading from live-map
report.label: Bug
report.description: This issue was raised by SammysHP. It is not fully deterministic, but I was able to produce at least one affected cache with every try with the following recipe: Start c:geo, open live-map, switch off 'live' move to a region where no caches are stored, select a zoom level so that you expect >~20 caches in the view switch on 'live', wait for the caches to be displayed select 'store offline' to a new list when the download is finished, the caches are still displayed as unreliable (I would have expected an update here) directly start opening caches and checking the log page for missing statistics I assume some sort of timing, but couldn't find any clues to that in the log

report.summary: Own position not shown on devices without compass
report.label: Bug
report.description: App still worked on Saturday after last update, but on Monday the blue arrow of the own Position is missing and neither the map nor the compass adjusts to the current position. I am not sure but I suppose it was the display rotation I activated on Monday. Since then I have this issue. I think These issues are already reported: #4533 and #4540

report.summary: Log entry of trackable shown as "today"
report.label: Bug
report.description: After logging a trackable taken 3 days ago the log is shown on top with "today". Going back to search and again enter trackable log list the entry is correct. So just a problem how we add it to the list.

report.summary: Compass shows random direction
report.label: Bug
report.description: We have some users on support mail which have problems using the compass starting with 2014.12.09: The distance is correct but the direction is randomly changing. "Use GPS and Compass" is active. If the users select "Use GPS only" the direction gets stable and correct (while moving) Disabling GooglePlayServices makes no difference Compass in other apps (Groundspeak, GPS Status, etc.) works without a problem Devices: Sony Xperia SP (C5303), FW.205, Android 4.3 other model informations requested (will be added later)

report.summary: "Scan Barcode" menu is gone
report.label: Bug
report.description: From support mail and I can reproduce it: The main menu of c:geo is missing the option "Scan Geocode" although the barcode scanner app is installed.

report.summary: opencaching: use language instead of country to retrieve descriptions
report.label: Bug
report.description: In the OKAPI you can set your preferred langauge for retrieval of various strings, because e.g. cache descriptions can be availabel in many languages. We currently use locale.getCountry() for that, instead of locale.getLanguage()...

report.summary: c:geo crashes constantly on HTC Wildfire S with Android 2.3.5
report.label: Bug
report.description: I have HTC Wildfire S, HTC Sense 2.1, Android 2.3.5 with c:geo 2014.12.22 installed and 1196 caches in offline storage. The update section says (in German) "No updates available for this phone. This phone is at the most recent status". The SQLite c:geo database seems to be OK (no errors reported with PRAGMA integrity_check) but I have used c:geo for quite a while so it may be that some entries do not comply with the current version's requirements... I use a prepaid card so c:geo is used exclusively offline (except when having a WiFi around and loading new caches). However, using c:geo I get crashes ("Tut uns leid! Die Anwendung c:geo...") almost everywhere: opening the offline map (using OSM maps) logging in when first starting c:geo (rare and difficult to reproduce) when starting c:geo and Wireless has recently been disabled but c:geo still thinks it's logged in (shown in the bottom line "login OK") when moving the map around or starting map view for a cache waypoint that had been opened from the map view already most importantly: when downloading one or several caches for offline use The last issue is very reproducible: Downloading more than three caches at once is a gamble with less than 5% chance of luck. More than four hasn't happened more often than once or twice in the last two years. It seems to increase when the GPS is on but this may only be a subjective impression. Downloading a single cache from the map view also leads to a definite crash in few cases, the most recent one being GC4Z71P (Jura-Höhenweg Teil 1). Map movement crashes are also easy to cause: Zoom out until more than ~200 caches are shown at once and simply move the map around a few times. Crash guaranteed. After a crash, sometimes c:geo reopens the map view automatically (rare case) or reopens itself automatically (frequent) or doesn't reopen at all (also frequent). Nothing else (except for sometimes BatteryBot Battery Indicator and sometimes Llama) is running in the background. I have debug logging enabled so there should be a few memory dumps. Is anyone interested in solving this issue so that I can send them in? I reject Google Play Services so reporting doesn't work (unfortunately). Best regards, Eingehirner

report.summary: Inconsistency of pictures in image tab
report.label: Bug
report.description: I was happening to me recently and two users on support mail reported that: Opening a saved cache and looking at the image tab sometimes shows pictures of a different saved cache. On next access (or on next refresh) it is solved (not sure about the conditions).

report.summary: GCVote not stored locally
report.label: Bug
report.description: Found during the voting dialog implementation: When logging a cache with voting, then the voting is not stored locally for the cache.

report.summary: Map Themes
report.label: Bug
report.description: In the past, downloaded maps and themes from openandromaps with no problems. Now, the maps are OK but selecting any theme other than the default theme causes no map to be visible. Just caches and current location are visible.

report.summary: Bug:NM attribute not cleared
report.label: Bug
report.description: If a cache do not have any attributes except the Need Maintenence flag, that attribute is not removed on refresh after the attribute is cleared on the geocaching site. #3370 is closed but the bug is still there.

report.summary: White theme: Suggestions in search field not visible
report.label: Bug
report.description: From support mail: Galaxy GT-I9000 with Android 2.3. White theme in c:geo 2014.12.22 Search menu - GC code search (and others?) Enter some digits Suggestions are shown but not readable (white on white).

report.summary: Sort order lost if negative sorting is active
report.label: Bug
report.description: When viewing my list of stored caches, if I select to sort by "Date stored on device" this works, and shows the oldest stored cache at the top of the list. If I then choose the menu option again to sort by "Date stored on device" the list is reversed, so that the most recently stored cache as as the top of the list (which I find more useful). However, if I then drop a cache from this list, the sort order is lost - specifically, the caches are sorted again with the oldest stored cache at the top of the list. Please allow my preference of having the most recently stored cache at the top of the list to be remembered.

report.summary: Import loading bar changes colour
report.label: Bug
report.description: The bar goes from blue (where I'm at) to a shade of grey to another shade of grey. This hasn't existed in any previous release

report.summary: New phone unable to log in
report.label: Bug
report.description: Hi, I acquired a Samsung Galaxy S5 mini today and I have downloaded cgeo but it is not recognising my login details. It told me they were fine but is unable to log me in. Any ideas?

report.summary: Refreshing without progress and ANR afterwards
report.label: Bug
report.description: 2015.01.06-RC1 Open a list of saved caches (50 caches in my case) Select Menu - Refresh all Progress will get stuck at some point, no more messages in the debug log Abort the refresh Trying to open a saved cache afterwards => Stuck on loading cache-details and ANR short after Trying to start another refresh of the list => No progress and ANR short after As discussed on IRC this might be caused by a possible race condition introduced in cdf5c65

report.summary: Socket timeout is too long (90 seconds)
report.label: Bug
report.description: While working on another issue yesterday, I noticed that one cache read from geocaching.com ended only after a 90 seconds timeout. This is too long, the read timeout should be similar to the connect timeout (30 seconds).

report.summary: Delay just after selecting "Refresh all"
report.label: Bug
report.description: With version 2015.01.07-RC I can see a new behavior: When selecting Menu - "Refresh all" I experience a short delay before the refresh starts and the progress window is shown. Subjectively (I have to test) it rises with the amount of caches on the list to be refreshed. For a list of 100 caches it is a noticeable delay of approx. 1 second.

report.summary: HTC One (M7): Compass rotates in 180° steps
report.label: Bug
report.description: Split up from #4552 Following the above mentioned issue and the reports we get on support mail and Facebook we can break down current compass problem to this specific one: Device: HTC One (M7) Android: 4.4.3 Description: When rotating the phone the compass does not turn steady but will jump by 180° as soon as this angle is reached Same bevavior with the arrow on map Independently of Google Play Service settings Not yet tested if Low-power mode On/Off makes any difference At the same time other compass apps are working normal (i.e. the sensors itself seem to work fine) Current RC-version 2015.01.07-RC does not solve the problem I sent a video from a user showing that issue to the cgeo-dev mailing list on 07.01.2015. @arteos Can you kindly test if enabling "Low power" in c:geo Menu - Settings - System makes any difference for this issue? Can you please fall back to version 2014.11.04 (Download from here: https://github.com/cgeo/cgeo/releases/tag/market_20141104) and check if the compass is normal in this version? There are also reports with HTC One Mini, Android 4.4.2 but sadly without a clear description whether it is the same problem (jumping by 180°). I will ask those users via support mail to describe in more detail.

report.summary: Sony Xperia SP (C5303): Compass rotatation sluggish
report.label: Bug
report.description: Split up from #4552 Device: Sony XPeria SP (C5303), FW.205 Android: Android 4.3 Description: If the phone is rotated normally the arrow is only reacting very sluggish and never reaches the correct direction. If the phone is rotated fast the arrow aso moves really fast but also ends up in a totally wrong direction. Independently of using "Google Play Services" It is currently unclear whether this happens with and/or without "low power mode". I asked via support mail but got no feedback up to now.

report.summary: Compass problems solved by pure reinstallation
report.label: Bug
report.description: In #4552 and also on support mail an unusual amount of people are describing that a pure deinstallation + new installation of version 2014.12.22 solved their compass problem. All of them had the problem, that the compass was randomly moving or fixed to a random position and it was working normal in other compass apps at the same time. I was wondering if there is any "default value", "compass state" or alike we store somewhere which is incorrect / out of range and might only get cleared on a new installation. This is the only reason I could imagine where a reinstallation could make any difference.

report.summary: Do not query the magnetic field sensor
report.label: Bug
report.description: We should not test the presence of the TYPE_MAGNETIC_FIELD sensor to check whether we can use either the TYPE_ORIENTATION or the TYPE_ROTATION_VECTOR sensors.

report.summary: Test current master branch on 2.3.x
report.label: Bug
report.description: For me, a class is not found as soon as the application is launched, due to commit d3dc2be: rx.android.view.OnSubscribeViewDetachedFromWindowFirst$SubscriptionAdapter This can be tested with the existing NB.

report.summary: System information can not be copied
report.label: Bug
report.description: While on my Samsung S4 I can copy the system information to the clipboard using 2015.01.08-RC I am unable to do so with an HTC One Mini using 2015.01.08-NB3. Not sure whether it is caused by the different c:geo versions or just a bug of the HTC?

report.summary: Own rating is also saved if placing the vote was not succesful
report.label: Bug
report.description: 2015.01.08-RC1 Be sure your gcvote password is wrong in settings Open a saved found cache Select Menu - Vote Select a score (in case it already has an own vote, select a scrore different to the existing) and send it An error toast is shown about the wrong password but still the new own rating is saved to the cache

report.label: Bug

report.summary: Spoiler picture link missing
report.label: Bug
report.description: 2015.01.25-NB (also present in 2015.01.20 as reported on support mail). Happens also in other scenarios where the cache is opened directly from map. Not sure whether it is a regression, but I think so as I never noticed it before. Search for GC5K2A1 Open the cache details Note that the cache has a spoiler pic which is correctly indicated on the description tab Open the spoiler picture, is is shown normally. It is also visible on the image tab Select Navigate - Map Click on the cache to open popup Select more details Result: The link to the spoiler pic is missing on the description tab and the picture is not shown on the image tab. Selecting "refresh" will show it again until the next test cycle (unless the cache is saved).

report.summary: Cache count missing in new restore dialog
report.label: Bug

report.summary: Compass reversed on Nexus 6
report.label: Bug
report.description: I`m running the latest version 2015.01.20 but I had this problem since getting my Nexus 6 the compass is always reversed when using cgeo a temp fix I have found is open Google maps then cgeo and it seems to correct it until next time i use it

report.summary: Bad sort in caches filter
report.label: Bug
report.description: Hello, In french, the list of caches in the filter is wrong. It's not a natural order and the type "Event Cache" (Événements in French) is at the bottom of the list. Here a screenshot:

report.summary: Compass on MotoG (XT1068) not working
report.label: Bug
report.description: From support mail: Compass starts spinning around until c:geo is killed and restarted. I would interprete: It starts malfunctioning at some point during usage and is working again for some time after a restart. --- System information --- Device: XT1068 (titan_retgb, motorola) Android version: 4.4.4 Android build: KXB21.85-23 Cgeo version: 2015.01.20 Play services: present Use Play services: yes Low power mode: inactive Compass capabilities: yes Rotation sensor: present Geomagnetic rotation sensor: present Orientation sensor: present --- End of system information --- @samueltardieu This is the case from support where you asked for more information.

report.summary: Crash on export GPX from imported benchmark *.loc
report.label: Bug
report.description: From support mail: A *.loc file of US benchmarks as selected and downloaded from Geocaching.com, with no modifications, will import fine. But then try to export, c:Geo crashes and an empty export file is created. Version 2015.01.20

report.summary: Amount of logs for OC caches
report.label: Bug
report.description: Looking at OC10CB8 only 10 logs are showing up in c:geo. The cache however has quite some more logs available.

report.summary: Both navigation options are compass
report.label: Bug
report.description: Just noticed that on my new phone the primary and secondary navigation are both the compass. I'm not completely sure, but very much that I did not touch that setting yet.

report.summary: deletion of offline log not in context menu
report.label: Bug
report.description: An offline log can only be deleted when in selection mode, but not directly from the context menu. Edit: This bug only happens, if there is an offline log, but the cache has already been deleted.

report.summary: MapQuest geocoder returns a 403 error
report.label: Bug
report.description: As of 2015-02-10, the MapQuest geocoder started to return 403 errors. It looks like this may be a larger issue as shown in: http://developer.mapquest.com/web/products/open/forums/-/message_boards/message/1327001 As of 2015-02-11, the GeocoderTest.testMapQuestGeocoder test has been annotated with @Suppress. This annotation should be removed when the problem is solved, or when the MapQuest geocoder is removed from cgeo. Note that the unavailability of MapQuest does not impair the behaviour of cgeo in any way when other geocoders (Android, GC) are available.

report.summary: No reaction if hint is requested but cache has no hint
report.label: Bug
report.description: @Bananeweizen Looking at the code I would assume that if the cache has no hint the toast should be shown with the string="cache_hint_not_available". However if i select the hint menu on compass nothing is shown if the cache has no hint.

report.summary: Caches marked as offline logged by theirselves
report.label: Bug
report.description: This is unreproducible right now, but while caching today I realized two times, that caches I was currently dealing with suddenly got marked as "stored log" while I did not actively do this. The offline logs contained my autoinserted signature. Trying it lateron I could not reproduce it. 2015.02.15-NB Option "Log offline" activated. Did anything change which could cause that?

report.summary: First Waypoint shows text of second waypoint
report.label: Bug
report.description: Sometimes (unfortunately i cannot reproduce it), the text of the second waypoint is duplicated into the first for saved caches. Screenshot for GC4E28K: „Der Yogi bewacht C und D“ belongs to the second WP, Stage 1. Text for first WP (Start) is gone. This is different from #3420. The error is permanent and persists across refreshes of the saved cache. Also WP detail view shows the wrong text. Unfortunately, the error appears infrequently, and the circumstances are unclear to me. I noticed it 4-5 times during the last months, but never was annoyed enough to open an issue. Version 2015.02.16-NB, but i suspect the error occurs during saving of the cache, which was quite a long time ago now, and thus happened with an older version.

report.summary: [NUMBER] off by one in Twitter backend
report.label: Bug
report.description: The [NUMBER] placeholder is off by one in Twitter. I suppose that results from the way the value is formed in the tag engine, which I suspect to be $count+1 because the soon to be published log is one number higher than the current found count. The Twitter backend is called after logging, when $count was already incremented, resulting in the off-by-one bug.

report.summary: spoiler images parsed wrongly
report.label: Bug
report.description: Spoiler images seem to be delivered via img.gc.com as well as imgcdn.gc.com. Our parser does not handle both.

report.summary: Cache not removed from history after offline log deleted
report.label: Bug
report.description: 2015.02.21-NB Log a cache offline Verify it is added to the history Open the cache again and delete the offline log by Menu - Log offline - Delete (or whatever the menu is called in english) The cache keeps showing up in the history permanently (also after app restart)

report.summary: new version (2015.02.23) won't open on Samsung Galaxy SII
report.label: Bug
report.description: Installed the new version yesterday and it won't work at all

report.summary: Caches not visible in TB log entries
report.label: Bug
report.description: 2015.02.22-NB If I am not completely wrong the TB logbook normally contains the geocache name alongside with dropped, retrieve and visit logs. However for me the TB TB4TXR0 does not show them in the logbook. Did not check if only this one or all TBs are affected. Maybe a website change or I just remember incorrect.

report.summary: Adding to favorites fails
report.label: Bug
report.description: 2015.02.24-NB I tried to add several found caches to my favorite using the button in the cache details. For all of them it does not work, I get the error toast. I checked and have 10 favorite points available on the site. I can not provide a log at the moment, but I fear this could be a change on the website.

report.summary: live state not remembered on switching map provider
report.label: Bug
report.description: Open a map for a stored list of caches. Enable "live" from the menu. Switch to another map provider. Live is disabled again (which can lead to no caches visible at all, if you scrolled out of the area of stored caches).

report.summary: ActionBar tooltip bubbles on main screen have wrong size
report.label: Bug
report.description: Hold your finger on any button in action bar and the tooltip appears with wrong size. On other screens, the tooltip seems ok.

report.summary: Smilies in waypoint description shown incorrect
report.label: Bug
report.description: 2015.02.23: Open GC5NBMH Swipe to the waypoints Waypoint "Cafe Times" shows a block instead of the smilie.

report.summary: Reproducible ANR with OSM:Offline map
report.label: Bug
report.description: I wonder If you experience the same 2015.03.06.-NB using OSM:Offline map Open list of saved caches Open a saved cache Select Navigate -> Map Press back to return to cache details Select Navigate -> Map Result: c:geo freezes I am not using two instances of the map in this case, am I?

report.summary: Phone seems halted after canceling multiple contacts selection
report.label: Bug
report.description: Open a contact from a logbook, which is multiple times in your contacts list. Cancel the selection of the right contact. The phone now behaves like not reacting anymore. Actually, an acitivty is open, without any displayed contents.

report.summary: Search bar should close on selection
report.label: Bug
report.description: When selecting a cache from the search bar of the main activity, the the search field should be deactivated and the keyboard should go away. Otherwise users may be very confused when returning from the cache and finding the keyboard opening suddenly.

report.summary: Embedded images in short description not shown in image tab
report.label: Bug
report.description: @samueltardieu added the ability to view and open embedded images under the "Images" tab after my posted issue #3661 Really great and useful! But far from all caches shows the image under the "Images" tab. These does include the image: http://coord.info/GC5NHA1 http://coord.info/GC4TZMH These does not include the image: http://coord.info/GC1EH4K http://coord.info/GC5NV7Q I suspect it has something to do with the file size of the image. That it does not show images below a certain file size to filter out language flags, smileys and other "unwanted" images. If I'm right that filter should be removed so that all images are shown. Or the file size threshold should at least be lowered.

report.summary: Search function broken
report.label: Bug
report.description: The new advanced search just went live. some functions seem broken by this.

report.summary: Search result filter
report.label: Bug
report.description: I can't use filter to searched results it always return me to saved cache instead of search results. Steps to reproduce: Open c:geo Click search Type ex. Warszawa in address Display results Use filter Result: Filtered stored cache not searched cache --- System information --- Device: LG-D802 (g2_open_com, lge) Android version: 4.4.2 Android build: KOT49I.D80220h Cgeo version: 2015.03.16-NB-bab02fe Google Play services: enabled Low power mode: active Compass capabilities: yes Rotation sensor: present Geomagnetic rotation sensor: present Orientation sensor: present Hide own/found: false Map strategy: detailed HW-acceleration: enabled (Disabled by default: no) geocaching.com: logged in (Login OK) / Basic Member System language: pl_PL Installed cgeo plugins: none --- End of system information ---

report.summary: Missing lobook or wrong dates in logbook
report.label: Bug
report.description: On support mail we have two users reporting issues: Logbook is completely missing Dates in logbook are wrong I am on the way to collect system information and the date format those people are using on the website. Do we know, if e.g. during the site change they might have changed or added new date formats?

report.description: 2015.03.17-RC: A user on FB reported that loading his owned caches using the "Show owned caches" function in the search menu does return nothing. I can not reproduce this but asked for more details about what is showing up and the step-by-step.

report.summary: No coords in Nearby search for PM
report.label: Bug
report.description: 2015.03.25-NB: After the recent changes we once again miss the coordinates on the nearby search results. So most likeley something changed in the LOC download.

report.summary: Pocket Query menu no longer available
report.label: Bug
report.description: From support: Since website change the menu "Pocket Queries" is no longer available. I suspect this is caused by #4763, still I open a dedicated issue to track if this problem is also solved after solving #4763.

report.summary: Showcase in compass is missing the circle
report.label: Bug

report.summary: Wrong GC TB inventory
report.label: Bug
report.description: With 2015.03.28-NB1 (incl. Geokrety PR) I see the following problem: Each cache does only list one TB in the inventory list independently if GK connector is active or not. For example: GC3TCGP contains 2 TBs (as of 28.03.2015 - Might change!) Open it with 2015.03.28 --> 2 TBs shown in list, both TBs are shown in Inventory-Tab Open with 2015.03.28-NB1 --> 2 TBs shown in list, only one TB shown in inventory Another example (with mixed TB/GK): GC3FJ5F contains 2 TB and 1 GK (as of 28.03.2015 - Might change!) Open it with 2015.03.28 --> 2 TBs shown in list, both TBs are shown in Inventory-Tab Open with 2015.03.28-NB1 --> 2 TBs shown in list, only one TB and one GK shown in inventory It seems that now only 1 TB is shown

report.description: 2015.03.28-NB1: Open OC10E19 Save it for offline use In the list of caches 7 TBs are shown Open the cache Look at the inventory --> 6 GKs are listed for this cache.

report.summary: GK requests to GC
report.label: Bug
report.description: Looking at the debug logs I saved yesterday (2015.03.29-NB) I have now seen requests like this http://www.geocaching.com/track/details.aspx?tracker=GKA301 in the c:geo log in parallel to the correct request to geokrety.org. Today 2015.03.30-NB1 I cannot reproduce this anymore. @kumy Was that solved by recent changes or an unreproducible behaviour?

report.summary: Login failed on main screen
report.label: Bug
report.description: Login failed on main screen but all feature working fine. In settings login shows up as OK Strange behavior, but all is working so bug is not important 😉 --- System information --- Device: LG-D802 (g2_open_com, lge) Android version: 4.4.2 Android build: KOT49I.D80220h Cgeo version: 2015.03.31-NB-d137393 Google Play services: enabled Low power mode: active Compass capabilities: yes Rotation sensor: present Geomagnetic rotation sensor: present Orientation sensor: present Hide own/found: false Map strategy: detailed HW-acceleration: enabled (default state) geocaching.com: not logged in (Login failed) System language: pl_PL (cgeo forced to English) Installed cgeo plugins: none --- End of system information ---

report.summary: excludeMine parameter is always false
report.label: Bug
report.description: Analysis by IntelliJ IDEA shows that the excludeMine parameter in SearchResult#filterSearchResults is always false. This is likely a bug. If this is not, the parameter can be removed and the code can be simplified.

report.summary: NPE on compass

report.description: From Google Play with version 2015.03.28 (not sure if maybe 6165ec4 fixed that already) User comment: the new hint feature shuts down the app before I can go from the compass the the map Stack trace: java.lang.NullPointerException at cgeo.geocaching.CompassActivity.onOptionsItemSelected(CompassActivity.java:217) at android.app.Activity.onMenuItemSelected(Activity.java:2250) at android.support.v4.app.FragmentActivity.onMenuItemSelected(FragmentActivity.java:372) at android.support.v7.app.ActionBarActivity.superOnMenuItemSelected(ActionBarActivity.java:244) at android.support.v7.app.ActionBarActivityDelegateBase.onMenuItemSelected(ActionBarActivityDelegateBase.java:352) at android.support.v7.app.ActionBarActivity.onMenuItemSelected(ActionBarActivity.java:130) at android.support.v7.app.ActionBarActivityDelegateBase.onMenuItemSelected(ActionBarActivityDelegateBase.java:357) at android.support.v7.internal.view.menu.MenuBuilder.dispatchMenuItemSelected(MenuBuilder.java:777) at android.support.v7.internal.view.menu.MenuItemImpl.invoke(MenuItemImpl.java:158) at android.support.v7.internal.view.menu.MenuBuilder.performItemAction(MenuBuilder.java:922) at android.support.v7.internal.view.menu.ActionMenuView.invokeItem(ActionMenuView.java:544) at android.support.v7.internal.view.menu.ActionMenuItemView.onClick(ActionMenuItemView.java:105) at android.view.View.performClick(View.java:2532) at android.view.View$PerformClick.run(View.java:9277) at android.os.Handler.handleCallback(Handler.java:587) at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:92) at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:143) at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:4196) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invokeNative(Native Method) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:507) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:839) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:597) at dalvik.system.NativeStart.main(Native Method)

report.summary: Navigation with Sygic no longer working
report.label: Bug
report.description: From support mail and confirmed by a test with 2015.03.30-NB: Open a cache Select Navigate -> Sygic Sygic will open but no navigation action is started According to users info it was working before and stopped with the recent feature release 2015.03.28.

report.summary: Bad menu item label
report.label: Bug
report.description: Just installed a new emulator. In the cache list menu I see "Export: %1$s" as last item.

report.summary: Write note for GC trackable no longer possible without tracking code
report.label: Bug
report.description: 2015.04.03-NB Open any GC trackable (for me it was a TB listed in a cache and I opened it from the inventory) Select log type NOTE Enter log text Try to send the log Result: Toast is displayed, that the tracking code is missing. It seems the tracking code is needed for GKs but it is not needed for GC TB (and was working without before implmentation of GK support)

report.summary: Filter lost after opening cache details
report.label: Bug
report.description: Hi, Steps to reproduce: open stored caches list apply a filter (in my case Status > With trackable) open a cache to display the cache details when going back from cache details to the list of caches ... the filter is gone (ie all caches are displayed). It seems to be a regression link to the introduction of the new "categorized filters". best regards,

report.summary: List not updated after deletion
report.label: Bug
report.description: Delete a cache from the details screen. Afterwards go back to the list. It is still there. Did someone modify the notifychanged code?

report.summary: wrong find count when logging something else than found
report.label: Bug
report.description: From facebook: I like c:geo a lot, but why does it (usually temporarily) count a NM log or a note as a find? Hi. It's strange, it's only a short term thing, but it increases the number of finds on the front page by one. It usually rectifies after logging out and in a couple of times. It obviously doesn't register on the gc.com site, as the count remains correct on there. Thanks for a great app though, and thanks for looking at a very minor niggle! Actually, we increase the find count on logging, independent of the type of the actual log. See GCParser 1176.

report.summary: "Auto visit" not always working for GKs
report.label: Bug
report.description: 2015.04.07-NB: Have TBs and GKs in your inventory Activate "AutoVisit" in Settings - Logging Open a saved cache Select "Log visit" On the logging view sometimes the GKs are set to No Action instead of Visit This seems to depend on the time needed to load the inventory from GK. I have seen that sometimes the AutoVisit also works for GKs, it seems to fail only if the answer from GK is coming in quite late.

report.summary: error when using support library v21
report.label: Bug
report.description: I've downgraded again after using support lib v21 for a short test. We are hit by this directly on start of the app: https://code.google.com/p/android/issues/detail?id=81215 I have no idea what that is related to, so I didn't see any way to fix this. If someone is more friends with the theme stuff, maybe you can find a workaround.

report.summary: Search bar should close properly on back key (Android 5.0+)
report.label: Bug
report.description: I open a new issue instead of commenting on the closed issue #4725. Is this the right way to do it? I think that the fix by @Bananeweizen did only solve half of the problem though. The behavior is still illogical when trying to deselect the search bar by pressing the back key. When you first press the search bar, the last shown caches are shown in the dropdown and the keyboard is shown, allowing you to enter a search query. When you select a cache from the list the search bar gets deselected in the correct way. Showing the default controls in the action bar next time you come back to the home page. Perfect! But when you press the back button instead, the first state is like the below screenshot, This step is unnecessary since you cannot enter anything in the search field anyway when the keyboard is hidden When you press the back button a second time this action bar is shown: ...instead of the default action bar setup below that should be shown instead: So my suggestion is that you should only have to press the back button once to deselect the search field.

report.summary: trail is on by default
report.label: Bug
report.description: contrary to the change from #4243 the map trail is still on by default. This is because our default values come from the XML file, not from the default values we pass into the getters.

report.summary: Heading line has wrong target when started from compass
report.label: Bug
report.description: Somehow linked to #4684 but another scenario which I consider a bug: 2015.03.31: Open cache details of a saved cache with waypoint Open waypoint tab Start compass for a waypoint Use title bar map icon to switch to the map Result: Heading line is targeting to the cache coordinates but not to the waypoint previously selected for Navigation

report.summary: TB log has wrong date on website
report.label: Bug
report.description: 2015.04.16-NB We had such an issue on support mail (or even here as an issue) but I was not able to reproduce or find a hint in our code: This morning at approx. 06:30am CEST I logged two TB (retrieve log) I am quite sure that the log date shown in c:geo was 17.04. (which would be correct) but I did not explicitly verify it , at least I did not change it manually Looking this evening at the website I see that those logs have the date 16.04. (e.g. http://www.geocaching.com/track/log.aspx?LUID=58d79e3f-56d5-4595-bbbe-326b8add5390) The time zone settings of my device (Galaxy S4, Android 5.0.1) is set to factory value, i.e. derive from mobile network. Checking the world clock app it confirms the timezone used as GMT+2 (which is correct). Can someone check if we send the log with just the absolute date or do we try to transmit a time and time zone info as well?

report.summary: C:geo always exporting blank field notes
report.label: Bug
report.description: I use c:geo for offline caching, but lately I've been having an issue where any field notes it exports are blank. At first I thought it was an error in uploading to geocaching.com, but I checked the field notes folder on my HTC's drive, and all the recent ones are blank. At the moment I am just logging my caches offline, then going into history and exporting them. This has been working perfectly for several months, but on my last holiday it stopped and I have had to log everything manually, which has been a huge hassle. Is this a bug, or do I need to be doing something different?

report.summary: huge empty space on devices without compass
report.label: Bug
report.description: Small screen devices without compass have a huge empty space instead of the compass switch button.

report.summary: cgeo not offered for opening coord.info links
report.label: Bug
report.description: 2015.04.18-NB ...if gc code is in small letters e.g. http://coord.info/gc77

report.summary: Store from live map - highly unstable
report.label: Bug
report.description: open few caches in Livemap goto "store offline" and select/create a container --> now the caches are starting to get downloaded Here it becomes highly unstable, many actions one does with the process stops: turn phone, move to a different app etc . few of the situations should be handled but not all

report.summary: Problem GPS Coordinates
report.label: Bug
report.description: The GPS coordinates in the details pages is note good. In the description is the right one but when you try to navigate or look on google map, with the GPS coordinates you had locked, it's wrong. This problem happened in the geocaching place made by Braconne Charente in the web site https://www.geocaching.com/ Can you fixe it? Thank you

report.summary: Geocache details page crashes occasionally
report.label: Bug
report.description: For some months, c:geo sometimes crashes when displaying the geocache details page. Unfortunately, this bug is not reproducible (can't trigger it directly) but still happens quite often during normal use. I'm running Android 4.4.4 (Samsung S3 LTE, not rooted) with recent releases of c:geo (from Google Play store). I've send a couple of those automated bug reports (usually like "crash while viewing cache details"), but today's crash (5.5.2015) starts with the (hopefully unique) label "AMK4711A", just in case you want to debug this specific crash. There are two ways the crash happens. (1) When I'm on the map screen (OpenAndroMaps locally stored) and touch a geocache icon (traditional, geocaching.com), a small overlay window opens. There I can touch "More details" to launch the geocache details page. And this is when the crashes happen. (2) When I'm editing the "Personal note" of a geocache and touch "OK" to return to the geocache details page, then c:geo also is likely to crash. It doesn't matter if GPS, WLAN or Mobile networks (or any combination of it) is switched on or off. There's plenty of memory and disk space available (usually, c:geo is the only app actively running). Rebooting the phone doesn't change anything. The only common thing of all the crashes is that they always happen when the geocache details page(s) is going to be displayed. There's no crash by just switching back and forth between the sub-pages of the geocache details (like waypoints, overview, description, logs etc.) If you need additional information, please let me know. If it helps I can assign the same "unique" label (see above) to future crash reports so they can be referenced easily.

report.summary: Refresh option not avaible from menu in history
report.label: Bug
report.description: When I go to history and open any cache from there I don't have refresh option in menu (3 dot menu).

report.summary: Refreshing stored list resulted in incorrect display
report.label: Bug
report.description: Summary: Refreshing all caches in a list caused repeated caches to be displayed on screen with different information. I had 14 caches stored in my "Found List" and I was logging them on my computer. When I completed my logging (on the computer) I did a "Refresh All" in c:geo and the caches refreshed. (I wanted to verify that I hadn't missed logging any.) What was displayed after that was a combination of "unfound" caches and "found" caches of the same name. It appeared to have not cleared the previous state properly before reloading the cache. To clarify: Some caches were displayed twice, once with the "Cache Found" green bar, and once without. See attached screen shot. Exiting the list and re-entering refreshed the display correctly.

report.summary: Inconsistencies between lists
report.label: Bug
report.description: Starting with 2015.05.22-NB1 I seem to have extreme inconsistencies on my lists of saved caches. Example: I open a list named GdH with 15 caches I open one of them and close it again Returning to the list I do see that all caches shown belong to the history list but not my list The header still shows GdH as name but a count of 81 caches (which is the amount of caches in the history list) Leaving and reentering the lists solves it Trying to explitcitly reproduce it was not succesfull, but it keeps happening in various ways.

report.summary: Description page in detail activity is created more than once
report.label: Bug
report.description: Open a cache, go to the description page. For demonstration immediately decrypt the hint. One or two seconds later the detail page is recreated and the hint is encrypted again (and the long description is hidden). Maybe setDataSetChanged() is called a few seconds after the first creation of the page.

report.summary: Cache not added to history when logged in a particular scenario
report.label: Bug
report.description: Version 2015.03.31. I was not able to reproduce it with 2015.05.26-NB although I am not aware that anything changed in that area. Here is a video showing the problem (provided by a user and published with his approval): https://www.dropbox.com/s/1v2i0xtq5z9ti8a/Offline.mp4?dl=0 Could be related to #4086

report.summary: Avatar no longer shown on "Check Login" on some devices
report.label: Bug
report.description: Strangely with 2015.05.29-RC the user avatar is no longer loaded when using the function "Check Login" in Menu - Settings - Services - geocaching.com. With production release 2015.03.31 it is working normal (also tested today...so not website change related) Edit: Test with production release was done on another device (see comment from 03.06.2015). Log does not show any error.

report.summary: Cache list shows inventory but no TB/GK in cache
report.label: Bug
report.description: I installed 2015.05.29-RC and restored a backup of 2015.05.28-NB. After that I do see some caches on my list which have inventory icons (one or several TB numbered) but If I open the cache the inventory tab is not shown. The GC website confirms, that there are no TBs listed in this cache, still it keeps showing in the list even after refresh of the cache. Note: Tested for me with GC50HFV

report.summary: EC terrain rating misses stars in cache details
report.label: Bug
report.description: extremcaching.com uses a 7 star terrain rating. AFAIR c:geo also shows seven star icons in the cache details on EC caches. With 2015.05.29-RC open EC1043, it shows T5/7 but only five red stars, no grey stars.

report.summary: WP note field note field gets text from previous note
report.label: Bug
report.description: 2015.05.29-RC but also in 2015.03.31: Open saved cache Go to WP tab Add a new WP and add a note to it Save it Add another WP without adding any note Save it Result: On the WP tab you will see that both WPs have the same note (which was only entered for the first WP)

report.summary: Sharing has unexpected results
report.label: Bug
report.description: Similarly to a bug we discussed long ago I again experience funny stuff when using the share menu. When I select the "show all" from the android share menu provider then locus opens with the cache. This is surely a faulty way through the switch case of the onOptionsItemSelected of the cache details activity.

report.summary: Navigate -> WhereYouGo option missing if cache is found
report.label: Bug
report.description: Unverified, taken from FB: wherigo option is available when the cartridge is not yet completed. Else this option is not there.

report.summary: Regular crashes on Sony Xperia devices on Android 5+
report.label: Bug
report.description: There seem to be many users (judged by the amount of support mails and bad GooglePlay ratings) having stability problems with c:geo after upgrading their devices to Android 5.0.x. This seems to be an issue which is maybe independend of #4921 For some of them the problem seems solved after a factory reset, but a lot others keep having problems. I have the chance to get a Sony Xperia Z3 tomorrow and will try to see if I can reproduce the general instability. @rsudev What was that device you are using? Did you see any regular crashes of c:geo on it?

report.summary: Crash on Google Map
report.label: Bug
report.description: This is another round of crashes which might be contrary to initial believe something new (the only older report is from an NB version) java.lang.NoSuchMethodError: org.apache.commons.lang3.reflect.MethodUtils.invokeMethod at cgeo.geocaching.maps.google.v1.GoogleMapView.displayZoomControls(GoogleMapView.java:83) at cgeo.geocaching.maps.CGeoMap.onCreate(CGeoMap.java:503) at cgeo.geocaching.maps.google.v1.GoogleMapActivity.onCreate(GoogleMapActivity.java:37) at android.app.Activity.performCreate(Activity.java:5248) at android.app.Instrumentation.callActivityOnCreate(Instrumentation.java:1087) at android.app.ActivityThread.performLaunchActivity(ActivityThread.java:2162) at android.app.ActivityThread.handleLaunchActivity(ActivityThread.java:2247) at android.app.ActivityThread.access$800(ActivityThread.java:141) at android.app.ActivityThread$H.handleMessage(ActivityThread.java:1210) at android.os.Handler.dispatchMessage(Handler.java:102) at android.os.Looper.loop(Looper.java:136) at android.app.ActivityThread.main(ActivityThread.java:5050) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invokeNative(Native Method) at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:515) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit$MethodAndArgsCaller.run(ZygoteInit.java:806) at com.android.internal.os.ZygoteInit.main(ZygoteInit.java:622) at dalvik.system.NativeStart.main(Native Method)

report.summary: Additional waypoints in GSAK GPX not recognized on import
report.label: Bug
report.description: Follow up of #4733. Will complete details next days.

report.summary: Inventory Order when logging a cache
report.label: Bug
report.description: Previously Inventory was in alphabetical name order when you were logging a cache. Since the last update, a new little icon is next to them, but it is no longer in alphabetical order. This makes it very time consuming to scroll thru and find the ones you want.

report.summary: Floating point coordinates not accepted
report.label: Bug
report.description: We can parse longitude OR latitude from double. But we cannot parse two doubles as coordinate. Found because the copy from clipboard button was disabled after copying such a coordinate from the browser.

report.label: Bug
report.description: From support mail for 2015.06.19: Open TB3CNBH Swipe to "pictures" tab to verify that pictures are shown Press the "Refresh" button Result: Picture tab is empty

report.summary: Child waypoints of exported GPX missing on reimport
report.label: Bug
report.description: I got several independent users on FB and support who report, that they export a GPX from c:geo for caches with waypoints and some (or all) of these waypoints are missing when reimporting it on another c:geo installation. Both versions 2015.06.19 Did not have time to retest this yet.

report.summary: Owner related log types not always available on own caches
report.label: Bug
report.description: I have found on several occasions that I cannot post a Owner Maintenance log on my own caches. The log types Archived and Disabled are also missing in the log type dropdown list. But sometimes the log options are available. I have not figured out yet when they are available and when they are not.

report.summary: Many crashes on map
report.label: Bug
report.description: Each time i want to open a cache from the map cgeo crashes. No further details as I am on the road. At least nighty users are affected. No idea if release is also affected.
