report.summary: Export GPX - pass through gpsbabel - import GPX - fail
report.label: Bug
report.description: I think the XML parser is a bit on the strict side: If I export a GPX run "gpsbabel -i gpx -o gpx -f export.gpx -F import.gpx" try to import the resulting file I get the famous XML parsing error. gpsbabel 1.5.0-3 (Debian Jessie)

report.summary: Unavailable picture URL blocks cache refresh/loading
report.label: Bug
report.description: This is somehow similar to #4074: 2015.07.18-NB Open GC2G9AJ or OCF19C "Render view" takes 30 seconds to complete because of: 11:44:55.261 Warning cgeo 22067 [network-5] Failure (30162 ms) GET http://team-jerichow.de/uploads/kurzlog4.JPG (ch.boye.httpclientandroidlib.conn.ConnectTimeoutException: Connect to team-jerichow.de:80 timed out) Couldn't we do this in the background not blocking the UI? Looking back at #4074 I tend to remember that the unavailable pictures was not blocking the UI in the past but did "only" prevent all other pictures from beeing shown. So I would assume (although I did not explicitly test this before) that the blocking behaviour is new.

report.summary: Refreshing of caches stored on list failed
report.label: Bug
report.description: Today after installing latest Nightly build found error, when trying to refresh all stored caches on selected list. c:geo stopped working. Today after installing latest Nightly build found error, when trying to refresh all stored caches on selected list. c:geo stopped working. My device info from app: https://www.dropbox.com/s/1vnmr7wok5y8vts/2015-07-24%2013.13.21.png?dl=0 https://www.dropbox.com/s/pd2uyw03dqpqnjr/2015-07-24%2013.13.38.png?dl=0 My device info from app: --- System information --- Device: HTC One X (htc_europe, htc) Android version: 4.2.2 Android build: JDQ39 Cgeo version: 2015.07.24-NB-d4367c5 Google Play services: disabled Low power mode: active Compass capabilities: yes Rotation sensor: present Geomagnetic rotation sensor: absent Orientation sensor: present Hide own/found: false Map strategy: auto HW acceleration: enabled (manually changed) System language: en_US Geocaching sites enabled: geocaching.com: logged in (Login OK) / Basic Installed cgeo plugins: none --- End of system information ---

report.summary: Log counts not updated
report.label: Bug
report.description: Gc5w7ag. We have just refreshed this cache on 3 devices. Only on one of them the log counts at the to of the log book were correctly updated.

report.summary: Fieldnote-Upload to gc.com shows "successfull" even if there is no connection
report.label: Bug
report.description: When I export and upload my fieldnotes to gc.com I always get the popup-mesage "upload to geocaching.com successfull" - even if there is no internet-connection and nothing could be submitted. Sometimes the mobile data connection is not so good and I lost my fieldnotes this way. I can reproduce the bug when I disable wifi and mobile-data and try to upload the fieldnotes! Even an error-message-popup displaying for one second would not be the best solution because it is easy to overlook and there is now possibility for a second try because the last-upload-date was updated. But an success-message in case of failure is really bad.

report.summary: Overlay not changed while logging from lists
report.label: Bug
report.description: Open a list long press a cache, choose "log" select a logtype ex: found save offline. Activity "list" shown again, and good overlay is displayed. Without quitting "list", start the procedure again, just change the log type. When back in " list", overlay is not refreshed. Quit "list", or open a cache, then back to " list". Good overlay is shown.

report.summary: Color of "Note" log type changed
report.label: Bug
report.description: With 2015.08.22-NB I just realized that "Note" logs are no longer shown with a grey color strip in a cache logbook but with a somehow white strip with grey ends. As i did not closely follow the changes of last weeks I am not sure if this was intended or a side effect of another change.

report.summary: Filter could not be removed
report.label: Bug
report.description: My list is filtered by type "Earth cache". Clicking onto the recycle bin does not clear the filter settings. Setting another condition will not change the filter.

report.summary: TB logging does not remember last log type
report.label: Bug
report.description: This was implemented in the past, but now the default log type does always seem to be ¨Retrieve¨ although I posted a ¨Note¨ log for another TB before. 2015.08.26-NB

report.summary: Wrong progress prompts when sending log
report.label: Bug
report.description: 2015.08.26-NB After implementing the new log sending progress prompts, there seems t obe an issue either in programming or at least in (german) translation: When sending a log with picture and GCVote I doo see: Sende Log und Bild (or similar) Bild wird gesendet Sende Bewertung It seems in step 1 only the log is sent, so the string or the general calling of this string should be adapted.

report.summary: Location not updated properly
report.label: Bug
report.description: It seems that c:geo does not update what it thinks it my current location after it has been started. Two things that happened yesterday: Start c:geo wth location still turned off Turn on location Wait until OsmAnd sees me in my current location Select "Nearby", "Current location" in c:geo c:geo selects caches on the wrong continent, it seems to use the previous location I have been searching... Later, I restarted c:geo. Then at least it had me in the right city, but Select a cache Click the circle with the four bars at the top, so that there's a circle filling it Walk around c:geo does not update my current location The "location service" icon does not even appear in Android's status bar. When I switch to OsmAnd, it does appear, and the blue spot follows my walking. This is using c:geo 2015.08.03 on a device without play services, but with open-source replacements for some of them. (Not that I think that matters, but who knows^^).

report.summary: Logging progress: GEOKRETY should not be all uppercase
report.label: Bug
report.description: but instead we should use one of the localized strings we already have (was unable to find the uppercase version in the strings... hard coded?)

report.summary: GK name truncated while logging cache
report.label: Bug
report.description: I've seen that multiple times, in LogCacheActivity with, say, long list of GK in inventory. Some GK have their name truncated, most of the time this happens with the first characters. This not always happens on the same item. Here, the name is "Mickey plane".

report.summary: Two parallel background operations prevent user feedback
report.label: Bug
report.description: This one is hard to describe, so I give you the sequence: 2015.08.28-NB Open a found mystery cache Create a new final WP and activate "Set coords on webpage", save it Immediately go to the cache details page and press "Add to favorites" before uploading the coords to the website finished I can't exactly remember the reaction of c:geo but it was not OK. This leads to either a failure message for setting the favorite point or no feedback to the user for both actions. Sorry, happend already some days ago, and I wasn't able to reproduce as it needs quite a slow network connection. After refreshing the cache I have seen, that both operations have been sucesfull (coords set and fav point added). Not a big deal as the occurence will be quite rare.

report.summary: Add to calendar missing for past events?
report.label: Bug
report.description: 2015.08.30-NB1 It seems either there is a problem with event cache GC60RZK or it is not possible to add an event which is in the past? If this is intentional I vote for removing that restriction. The missing option is not really intuitive and it should be up to the user whether he wants to add an event in the past. Additionally there seem to be problems with users on some timezones (maybe erratically set on their phone) leading to fail to add it due to the missing menu.

report.summary: Nearby search result lost after c:geo was in background
report.label: Bug
report.description: 2015.08.30-NB1 Perform nearby search Result contains unsaved and saved caches Press home button to ¨exit¨ c.geo Open c:geop again The shown search result is now only containing the saved caches. Unsaved caches are no longer shown. I am not sure how it was in the past, but the fact that only saved caches are left is new to me. I assume, that either the list was still there or a the search equest was repeated.

report.summary: Duplicate filter for offline logs
report.label: Bug
report.description: As noticed by one of our translators, the filter for offline logs is actually implemented twice. https://crowdin.com/translate/cgeo/80/en-hu#14917:drl:531:kia71

report.summary: Cache icons in lists on low res device mispositioned
report.label: Bug
report.description: While testing the RC version I do see some mispositioning of the icons. Also the orange circle looks a bit clustered. This is from a HTC Wildfire S510 (Android 2.3): Sorry, only pictures of the device as it has no built in screen capture.

report.summary: Icons in lists have inconsistent sizes
report.label: Bug
report.description: Icons without overlays are smaller than icons with overlays in lists. cc @rsudev @kumy

report.summary: oc.de: Ignored caches displayed in c:geo
report.label: Bug
report.description: When ignoring a cache on oc.de and searching e.g. at the coordinates, the cache is shown nevertheless. While this could be a bug in the OKAPI, we should ensure that we properly authenticate (level 3) in this case, to enable filtering of ignored caches.

report.summary: Multicaches are not displayed on map
report.label: Bug
report.description: From support mail (related to cgeo 2015.09.23): I received the latest update to c:geo last night and immediately noticed one problem: when I use the "Live Map" to view caches, even though I have all cache types selected, multi caches that I haven't found are not displayed . There are several night cache (which display as multis) that I have not saved for off-line use. None of these caches are displayed. I normally do not save night caches for off-line unless I intend to attempt them in the near future. Let me know if others have had this problem. I am using an Android phone (Samsung Galaxy S5). I cannot reproduce this (launch cgeo without any filter, live map, I can see multicaches, including in areas where I have no caches stored). Can other developers check if they can reproduce this problem?

report.summary: Spoiler images of owned caches are missing the description
report.label: Bug
report.description: From support mail (but not yet verified): With Version 2015.09.28 you fixed "Spoiler image descripritions". This is working now for each Cache of other Cachers. But descriptions of OWNED caches are still missing. I think the reason is that the HTML-code of owned caches is slightly different the following code is additional for owned caches:

report.summary: Icon overlay for "final defined" not shown in lists
report.label: Bug
report.description: 2015.10-04-NB (and also 2015.09.28): Store a multi or mystery cache to a list Open cache and go to waypoint tab Add a waypoint of type "Final" with valid coordinates Save the waypoint Return to the list Expectation: Cache icon should be shown with overlay icon on lower right for "defined final" instead of no overlay. The overlay does only seem to work if the function "replace listing coords by final waypoint" has been used while creating the waypoint. This should not be necessary for the overlay to appear in the list. I assume the bug was introduced with recent changes to the overlay design in lists as it used to work with older c:geo versions.

report.summary: Broken string in progress bar for moving caches
report.label: Bug

report.summary: Found status not refreshed in list after one-click offline log
report.label: Bug
report.description: 2015.09.28: Activate one-click offline log in Settings - Logging Open a list of saved caches Long click a cache and select "One click offline log" - Found it Result: When returning to the list the cache is not marked as offline logged (orange bar, orange smiley) Only after scrolling the list or close/open the list the new status is shown Expectation: The status change should be visible when returning to the list without further action required. Note: In case "One click offline log" is not active, it works as desired.

report.summary: User name for GCVote can not be deleted
report.label: Bug
report.description: 2015.10.08-NB: Open Settings/Services Open GCVote settings Click on username and replace the existing user by an empty field Select OK Select "Verify login" This will return "Check OK" and I do see in the log that the previously stored username is still in use Close c:geo / Force close Start c:geo again Go to Settings/Services/GCVote You will see, that the previous username has been restored. As the username of GCVote and geocaching.com need to be identical we most probably derive it from the settings for geocaching.com. However couldn't we just disallow editing of the username in the GCVote settings and just show it for informational purposes.

report.summary: GGZ import fails or is slow
report.label: Bug
report.description: Tried the new GGZ format and it takes forever to load into c:geo. It cycled through 0-100% numerous times. It loads into my Oregon super quick, so is there an issue? Currently, I will revert to a GPX format for c:geo as I can only see a disadvantage.

report.summary: Moto G compass fails completely
report.label: Bug
report.description: From support mail. A user performed an upgrade to Android 5.2 which was offered by Motorola for his device. Afterwards the compass of c:geo stopped working. I first advised to try the setting of using the orientation sensor...He reported back that it is not selectable. Other compass apps are working all the time before and after the upgrade. The sys info is as follows: --- System information --- Device: XT1032 (falcon_retde, motorola) Android version: 5.1 Android build: LPB23.13-56 Cgeo version: 2015.09.28 Google Play services: disabled Low power mode: inactive Compass capabilities: yes Rotation sensor: absent Orientation sensor: present Hide own/found: false Map strategy: detailed HW acceleration: enabled (default state) System language: de_DE Geocaching sites enabled: - geocaching.com: logged in (Login OK) / Premium Installed cgeo plugins: none --- End of system information --- @samueltardieu Is it really possible that the device does not provide rotation sensor but only orientation?

report.summary: All suport mail end up in spam on gmail.com
report.label: Bug
report.description: We got replies from several users (all gmail) that our replies to them are always sent to their spam folders on gmail. I suspect it has something to do with the identification of the host (like the one we had with IPV6). @mucek4 Can we do something about that?

report.summary: Log can be sent but doesn't appear on geocaching.com
report.label: Bug
report.description: I can send a "found"-log, but this log doesn't appear on geoacaching.com same problem for a friend on another device. Maybe groundspeak made a change on the API? (PS: on www.geocaching.com it works...)

report.summary: Coordinate dialog broken in landscape mode
report.label: Bug
report.description: 2015.10.31-NB on my tablet Samsung SM-P600 as well as on my Samsung Galaxy S4: In landscape mode the new input dialog is missing the OK/Cancel and the buttons "Cache Coordinates" and "My Coordinates". Switching to portrait mode it looks ok.

report.summary: Amount of favorite points not updated when awarding a favorite point in logging view
report.label: Bug
report.description: 2015.10.31-NB: Open a cache Select "Log Visit" Post your log and select (the new) checkbox for "Add to your favorites" When returning to the cache details afterwards the state is not updated: The amount of favorite points for the cache is not incremented The button still shows "Add to your favorites" Expectation: If posting the log was OK, the information of the (stored) cache should be updated in cache details accordingly to avoid user confusion. @madankb

report.summary: Ignored cache may persist in DB
report.label: Bug
report.description: When you select ignore cache from the cgeo menu on the selected cache, it states that if you need to see this cache again you need to restore it from Geocaching.com. However, this doesnt work - i have chose two different caches to ignore, but they still appear on my map and nearby list.

report.summary: Coord handover to mapy.cz no longer working
report.label: Bug
report.description: A lot of people contacted support mail because of this. The problem started after update to a newer version of this mapy.cz app, however I sill want to share this here as I don't know whether mapy.cz has a bug or we do use a special implementation for this app which is no longer valid for some reason now. Here is a good problem description from support. I have set as secondary navigation external source - application mapy.cz. The connection between c:geo and mapy.cz worked well until last big update of mapy.cz. Now, when I want to show cache in mapy.cz, it doesn't work. Through c:geo is opened application mapy.cz, but coordines are no shown (this worked before). It only works when I copy coordinates in format DD.DDDDD from c:geo to mapy.cz and I have to change "," for "." because it is copied from c:geo with ",", but it doesn't work in mapy.cz with ",".

report.summary: Wrong sorting after continously loading more caches in search results
report.label: Bug
report.description: From support mail: Basic user Perform search Load more results Load more results Repeat until you notice that some caches are no longer properly sorted as selected (by distance as default) Video: https://www.dropbox.com/s/yfb28mm3xqdri7f/SCR_20151108_101144.mp4?dl=0

report.summary: Personal note doubled
report.label: Bug
report.description: Folllowing info from support mail (and I have also seen this happening once in a while). It seems that the process is triggered which should merge the notes between local and server although there is no server communication involved. Here is the info from support mail: Problem's scenario: save a cache offline, add a personal note, save it and leave the cache return to the cache with the previously saved personal note re-edit the note (change some stuff, perhaps use copy 'n paste) and save it --> the personal note is duplicated, with a "--" line between the copies Most sadly this is not deterministic. And although I tested and checked a lot, I cannot say which steps lead to this behavior, nor which conditions "must" be fulfilled to let it happen. Moreover it does not happen with every cache, but if it happened once, it happens every time I change the note of this cache. What I can say: It does not matter if I have previously uploaded the personal note or not; it does not matter where the cursor stands in the text; it seems to not matter if I use copy 'n paste or not.

report.summary: Watchlist total not visible on own caches
report.label: Bug
report.description: So nice to get another of my feature requests (#4058) fulfilled! Thanks a lot @ThibaultR for the coding! But I just discovered that the feature is missing on caches that you own.

report.summary: PlayServices Android 6.0 compatability?
report.label: Bug
report.description: Does anyone have experience with c:geo on an Android 6.0 device? From support mail: My "guess" is that "something" within my recent update to Android v6.0 Marshmallow has changed how the state of Google Play Services "appears" to the C:Geo app. (appears to be disabled). [...] MAPS and CALENDAR seem to work fine...........but C:Geo still displays "GPS disabled" when I have your System/Use Google Play Services enabled (checked). So I'm "guessing" that Play services may well be active, but it appears to C:geo to be disabled. Alternatively, there may be something unique about my Android v6.0 and Nexus 7 (2013) which is disabling c:Geo's access to that service. Who knows?

report.summary: Crash when adding personal note from WP or Images tab
report.label: Bug
report.description: Found this strange issue during Russian localization testing. Here is the test case: Store a cache for offline use. Open Cache details Slide to page with Waypoints or Images Press button with 3 dots Press 'Personal notes" Enter some text Press "OK" Application will crash. Some notes: The case is not reproducible from Description or Details or Logbook pages, only from Images and WP I found that I cannot add a personal note to a cache if it wasn't stored. Button "Personal notes" just does nothing. I assume this as a separated FR to allow to write personal notes for non-stored caches (or add error message for such case) My phone is Xperia Z3 Compact, Android 5.1.1 C:geo 2015.11.29-NB1-a4faa8b

report.summary: Wrong error toast after deleting cache from list
report.label: Bug
report.description: Market version 2015.11.29: After selecting delete on cache detail page some users see a toast message "cgeo could not find the cache" (or similar) when returning to the list.

report.summary: Bug: Suggestion to delete filtered list with empty result
report.label: Bug
report.description: Small glitch in the implementation for #5226: If I have a filtered list (e.g. 'Status -found') and I remove the caches that are in the result (e.g. moving those to another list or deleting them), I get the suggestion to delete this allegedly empty list in spite of the number of filtered out caches still present on it.

report.summary: List not updated after import of cache from GPX
report.label: Bug
report.description: Today I experienced the following issue: open a list select import - gpx select the file to import A popup tells that one cache was successfully imported go back from the file selection to the list - number of caches unchanged leave the list and re-enter - the new cache is there

report.summary: Unable to load a certain trackable with secret code starting with GC
report.label: Bug
report.description: Open the search function and search for the secret code GCxxxx (TB4W8Y6). An error message is returnes almost immediately, although the code is known (refer to search on gc.com) Could it be the fact, that it is starting with GC?

report.summary: Improve coord parsing from personal note
report.label: Bug
report.description:
..or improve it to make it more reliable. Several users contact us regularly having problems with strange waypoints automatically created by parsing of the personal note. There seem to be cases, where we parse nonsense. One example I received today: Personal note content: A=6 B=0 C=5 D=4 E=13
N 48° 53.(A*C*E)+194 E 009° 11.((D*71)-0)-1 N 48° 53.(6*5*13)+194 E 009° 11.((4*71)-0)-1 N 48° 53.(390)+194 E 009° 11.((284)-0)-1 N 48° 53.584 E 009° 11.283 c:geo creates the following waypoint as parsing result: N 48° 53,000 E 006° 00,000 This means users might see a lot of incorrect waypoints on their map without a possibility to permanentely remove them. So I suggest to either improve the parsing or add an option to disable it in general so that affected users have a solution.

report.summary: Maps.me no marker
report.label: Bug
report.description: For me when opening a cache in maps.me it shows the right area, but no marker. And it seems to be in a search mode somehow. Not sure if we changed something or maps.me did...

report.summary: Trackable icon no longer displayed
report.label: Bug
report.description: Seemingly has the trackable icon url on gc.com changed from an absolute to a relative format (see failing test CgeoApplicationTest.testSearchTrackable). The icon is consequently also no longer displayed on the trackable activity.

report.summary: Waypoint description added automatically
report.label: Bug
report.description: Create a new waypoint (e.g. stage of a multicache) with a description. Create another waypoint without a description (description field is empty). After the waypoint was stored, it has the description of the first waypoint. Edit the description of the second waypoint. Create a third waypoint without a description. It will get the description of the first waypoint as well. Create another waypoint with a description. It will keep its description. Master from today morning.

report.summary: opencaching.org.uk: cache download fails
report.label: Bug
report.description: Due to the addition of short_description does the cache download from oc.uk fail, as the site is sitting on a very old okapi version.

report.summary: Watchdog tests: Website test stops after the first failed connector
report.label: Bug
report.description: The tests WatchdogTest.testGeocachingWebsites and WatchdogTest.testTrackableWebsites fail after the first failing connector. E.g. does the current fail of oc.es hide the similar failure of oc.it

report.summary: Switch to english not working
report.label: Bug
report.description: There are multiple reports on our facebook page where people can login, but their cache counter remains at zero and the live map only shows question mark caches. A local friend of mine says this is since 3 days (Thursday 2016-01-14) for him. I can't reproduce the issue myself. Did anyone notice similar strange behaviour or a website change related to that date?

report.summary: Text missing in dialog
report.label: Bug
report.description: 2016.01.17-NB1: Enter c:geo Settings - Services - geocaching.com Deactive that connector Activate it again. A window titled "geocaching.com" opens but contains no text, just the selectors "More" and "OK".

report.summary: OC.org.uk: Attribute icons wrong
report.label: Bug
report.description: 2016.01.17-NB1: Activate opencaching.org.uk and autorize Search for OK02A4 On the cache details page the attribute icons are all a red "?!" If you click on the icons to see the textual version this looks OK Not reproducible on opencaching.de caches Picture

report.summary: Search result cannot be saved
report.label: Bug
report.description: 2016.01.17-RC3: Search nearby caches Press menu button on search result list -> No "Save for offline" option Also you can trigger the selection mode, select caches but there is no menu option what to do with this selection anymore.

report.summary: Storing some caches from search result lead to a "refresh all" popup
report.label: Bug
report.description: When using store Offline menu from CacheListActivity, a popup called Refresh all is shown. I'm not refreshing any caches, but storing new ones. This is a bit confusing. The message is displayed even if I choose to store only one cache. I think it's related to PR #5381. Subject: Refresh all Message: This action may lead to high network traffic. Are you sure you want to batch refresh all caches?

report.summary: Showcaseview for hint on compass even when hint menu item is missing
report.label: Bug
report.description: If you happen to open the compass first time after an upgrade or new Installation, and it happens to be one without hint menu item (e.g. from the 'go to' main menu item, the showcaseview is tried to show nevertheless and fails (as expected).

report.summary: Refresh all warning also for low amount of caches on list or selected caches
report.label: Bug
report.description: With version 2016.01 19 I consider this as small issue to be fixed with the next bugfix release

report.summary: Crash in PocketQueryListActivity

report.summary: Progress indicator missing in Log activities ActionBar
report.label: Bug
report.description: Following #5406, the calls to super.onCreate() in LogTrackableActivity and LogCacheActivity call a constructor which doesn't initialize progress indicator. Moreover, progress indicator in LogCacheActivity is never shown.

report.summary: Import complete message for PQ import
report.label: Bug
report.description: When importing a PQ I get this message: 447 Caches von downloadpq.ashx importiert It should contain the PQ name instead of the download URL.

report.summary: Found status no longer detected on gc.com
report.label: Bug
report.description: On master (only) currently it is not correctly detected if I have found a cache. @Bananeweizen Can that be related to your work on the detection patterns?

report.summary: Error while write a note for a travelbug
report.label: Bug
report.description: Im on 2016.01.25-NB-66ed060 and I get an error message when I want to write a note for a tb. It says that the note might not be sent, and that I should check the website. When I do so -or when I reload the tb site in cgeo the log exists. Can anyone reproduce that? When I discover a tb with the trackingcode I dont get any error.

report.summary: language problems
report.label: Bug
report.description: Some people on FB report again problems of cache count not loading and some cache information missing. After manual login on the website and switch to english it was solved. People already using 2016.01.19

report.summary: Selection for adding to fsvorites no longer shown
report.label: Bug
report.description: 2016.02.04-NB The logging view does no longer show the option to add a cache to your favorites, although I am PM and favorite points are available. Already noticed this some days (nightlies) ago...or a site change?

report.summary: Cache type Earthcache not recognized in search result
report.label: Bug
report.description: 2016.02.04-NB Perform nearby search with no caches stored/cached Earth caches returned in the list have unknown type icon

report.summary: Hidden date missing
report.label: Bug
report.description: 2016.02.09-NB Open previously unsaved cache Hidden date is misisng in cache detail screen Older saved caches do show the hidden date and it is kept also after refesh With 2016.01.21-NB on my other device it is working.

report.summary: Hide Export menu on list of unsaved caches
report.label: Bug
report.description: 2016.02.03: Have no caches stored Search nearby caches Select Export -> GPX The resulting GPX is empty as non of the caches on that list has data in our database. Thus the export menu should only be available on saved lists but not on search results if technically possible.

report.summary: Compass freeze when talking compass is active
report.label: Bug
report.description: 2016.02.03 (reported on support mail and reproducible for me): starting compass starting talking compass function switching to another app or blanking the screen by pressing the power button switching back to c:geo now the compass is frozen and does not react when changing the bearing of the device the compass and talking compass react to changes in distance but not to changes in bearing This behaviour ist 100% reproducable but does NOT appear, when using compass wihtout the talking function leaving the compass screen on while using talking compass (i.e not switching to another app) downgrading c:geo to v2015.11.29

report.summary: Locus export limit?
report.label: Bug
report.description: Can someone with more insight on this feature help to get an answer on this support mail: Hallo, I have small problem if I want to show or export them into Locus (Menu / Show on map / Locus or Menu / Show on map / Export to Locus). If I use it for ie 10 caches all is OK. If I use it for ie 200 caches, I haven't tab Listing in Locus. I guess there is some limitation in the amount of data we can hand over?!

report.summary: Back button in spoiler view leaves the app
report.label: Bug
report.description: 2016.02.03: Open a cache which has spoiler pictures Open spoiler pictures by clicking on the icon in cache details Use the action bar back button to leave the spoiler picture view Result: Instead of returning to the cache detail screen c:geo is ended.

report.summary: move cache from dynamic list shall not refresh
report.label: Bug
report.description: Expected behavior and actual behaviour: cgeo refreshes the current list after moving the cache to another list. For dynamic lists this leads to an empty list after the move operation. Steps to reproduce the problem: search nearest, with some of the results already being stored move a stored cache from the results to another list via context menu

report.summary: Twitter authorization does not work
report.label: Bug
report.description: While the signatures are correct, the authorization process fails right at the beginning, at least on Android 6.0. It might be due to the use of HTTP/2 (h2).

report.summary: red flag missing on map for mystery caches, where the listing itself includes final coords

report.description: For mystery-caches, which include final coords already in the listing, which is sometimes the case for challenge-caches, the additional red flag over the cache symbol is displayed in the list view, but not on the map view. Example: http://coord.info/GC5AZ68 Version: latest nightly, but noticed this already few months ago.

report.summary: Scrolling broken after selection

Only after refreshing the cache (thus getting the log from the server) it is shown in a normal way.

report.summary: Crashes when opening cache description with image from dropbox
report.label: Bug
report.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Search for and open GC5XBKZ, GC5NVYK or GC68R58 and many more with the partial name Bild af Piteå. Actual behaviour after performing these steps: After a second the app crashes and sends you back to the start page. It just happens with some caches, not all. One common thing with the ones that causes the crash seems to be that they all have linked images from dropbox in the description using the short url format https://db.tt/U7YqJqwN.Don't know if it is a coincident or not. Version of c:geo used: 2016.03.05 NB The bug has been present in the NB:s for maybe a week by now. Is the problem reproducible for you: Yes

report.summary: Own coords not updated in waypoint screen
report.label: Bug

Expected behaviour after performing these steps: The button "Own coordinates" should update the fields with the actual coordinates. Version of c:geo used: 2016.03.10-NB (but probably since we introduced the new input dialog) Is the problem reproducible for you: Yes Attach system information if available (see c:geo menu -> About c:geo -> System): Other comments and remarks:

(Not sure if it worked before) Else the upload button should be shown and the user should be asked to save the cache before uploading the note (like in other places if data is added). Version of c:geo used: 2016.03.15-NB Is the problem reproducible for you: Yes

report.summary: HW acceleration switched off on Android 6.0
report.label: Bug
report.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: There are numerous users on support mail, who have graphical problems and stability problems. All of them have in common: They either have a new device with Android 6.0 or recently upgraded to Android 6.0 In all system informations I do see that HW-acceleration is switched off (HW acceleration: disabled (manually changed)) After enabling it, the problems are gone Expected behavior after performing these steps: The users do say that they did not manually change this setting before. Is there any problem in the code, which may lead to the effect, that it is disabled on Android 6.0? Is this setting contained in any (google) backup and might be wrongly restored on a users new device? Version of c:geo used: 2016.03.06.

report.summary: Cause string missing on login failure
report.label: Bug
report.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Go to Menu -> Settings - Services - geocaching.com Try to authorize with correct username but wrong password Actual behavior after performing these steps: The following prompt is shown: Expected behavior after performing these steps: The cause string "Wrong username and/or password should be shown" Version of c:geo used: 2016.03.29-NB Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes System information: not relevant Other comments and remarks: Happens since the implementation of the new authentication menus

report.summary: Wrong username kept in authentication screen
report.label: Bug
report.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Be logged in as user A for geocaching.com with c:geo Go to Menu -> Settings -> Services -> geocaching.com and authenticate sucesfully as user B Go back to the main screen Go to Menu -> Settings -> Services -> geocaching.com again Note that the authentication status is correct (correct user and avatar) Open the authentication screen Actual behavior after performing these steps: The username of user A is still shown Expected behavior after performing these steps: The username of user B should be shown as he is currently authorized Version of c:geo used: 2016.03.29-NB Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes Other comments and remarks: During my tests I also had the connectors for opencaching.de, extremcaching.com also active with user A. MIght be relevant if there is some mix up between the connectors here.

report.summary: Caches from EC shown as saved once opened
report.label: Bug

Entering the details again it is shown to be saved to the default list, but it can not be found there and it should not be saved at all. Expected behavior after performing these steps: Don't show it as saved. Version of c:geo used: 2016.04.03-NB Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes Other comments and remarks: Does not happen for GC or OC as far as I could test but I am not sure.

report.summary: Doubled point at string end

Assigning myself

Yes Other comments and remarks: We might also decide to remove the "Ask for list" setting as it is contrary to the desired tag/multi-list feature

report.summary: Send2cgeo PIN not showing up (finish locale)

report.summary: Wrong geochecker link in cache details menu
report.label: Bug
report.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Open GC69K36 Select Menu -> Open Geochecker Geocheck.org is opened for GC5YH05 Actual behavior after performing these steps: It opens a geocheck link for another cache (this cache should not have any checker as it is a traditional type and does not contain such a reference/link in its description AFAICS) Expected behavior after performing these steps: No geocheck menu Version of c:geo used: 2016.04.11-NB Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes

report.summary: Add the possibility to allow personal notes waypoint import after changing the personal notes
report.label: Bug
report.description: This is a feature request for the possibility to allow personal notes waypoint import after changing the personal notes. Use case example: Go on a multi cache hunt Store the cache locally Write down A, B, C, etc. in the personal notes section of the multi cache Calculate the final coord by switching between personal notes and a calculator app back and forth. When done, you have the final coord written down in your personal notes. Now you have to swipe left twice and hit the "Add waypoint" button to add the final coords. The little window opens and you have to put in the numbers. My personal problem here is that I can't kepp more than 5 numbers in mind, so I enter the North coordinate, hit the tick symbol, go back to personal notes, read the East coord, go back to waypoints and enter the East coordinate. (You see, this workflow works and the app does what it should, but it could be easier for the user I think.) Expected behavior: I personally see two possible improvements: Expect the app to parse my personal notes after saving for something like "Final: N 47.123 E 8 33.123" and create the waypoint accordingly. Highlight the coord in the personal notes and allow the user by clicking on it to choose "Add to waypoints" or "Update existing waypoint"... something like that Version of c:geo used: Not relevant System information: Not relevant Other comments and remarks: I love caching and your app since 2011 - big thanks to you guys!

report.summary: Cannot select folder for _themes in setting section.
report.label: Bug
report.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: I can select maps source folder in section offline map sources But i cannot select folder _themes. Only options for creating a new folder is available. Version of c:geo used: 2016.04.12 Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes System information: Huawei Mate 8, Android 6.0. , allowing apps to access SD card (installed as external storage)

report.summary: New map: Filter info missing
report.label: Bug
report.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Have new map active as default Apply global type filter (e.g. Traditional only) Open live map Actual behavior after performing these steps: No filter info shown below the action bar Expected behavior after performing these steps: The notfication about an active filter should be shown directly below the action bar (compare to old map) Version of c:geo used: 2016.04.27-NB Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes System information: Attach system information here if available (see c:geo menu -> About c:geo -> System) Other comments and remarks:

report.summary: Manage lists button not working
report.label: Bug
report.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Disable the setting -> Offline-Data - Ask for list Open saved list Open cache details of a cache Click on "Manage" Actual behavior after performing these steps: If the cache is not on the standard list it will be moved to standard list. No list selection dialog is shown. Expected behavior after performing these steps: The "Ask for list" setting should not have any influence on the "Manage" function but should always open the list selection dialog Version of c:geo used: 2016.04.27-NB Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes

report.summary: Freeze in cache details without network
report.label: Bug
report.description: Enable debug mode Start c:geo and wait for login completion Disable all network connections Open live map Open a saved cache from map Result: App freezes 2016.04.29-NB Edit: Updated steps

report.summary: Spoilers not recognized
report.label: Bug
report.description: Seems like they are now delivered by https. 👍 1

report.summary: New map: Title for heading line not updated
report.label: Bug
report.description: Open map (new mapsforge implementation) Click on a cache to open the popup Activate the new heading line function (by clicking on the correponding icon on the top right of the popup) Heading line is shown and title is the correct geocache previously selected Click on the waypoint of a another cache (but not on the cache itself) Activate the new heading line function (by clicking on the correponding icon on the top right of the popup) Result: The heading line is updated correctly but the title still shows the cache which was selected in the first step (Problem does only occur for waypoint icons but not for cache icons)

report.summary: Many exceptions in log in offline case
report.label: Bug
report.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Have new map as default Be without network connection when starting c:geo Have debug mode active Open live map Actual behavior after performing these steps: The loading indicator is flickering on the action bar indicating loading activity in rapid cycles The log shows nearly endless exceptions Expected behavior after performing these steps: Offline condition should have no negative effects, comparable behaviour to old map Version of c:geo used: 2016.05.08-NB Is the problem reproducible for you? report.summary: Target display lost when turning the phone
report.label: Bug
report.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: select a target cache the target cache name is displayed in the upper left turn the phone, lock and unlock it, open cache details from pop-up and return to map, ... Actual behavior after performing these steps: the target display vanishes (but the cache is still selected as target) Expected behavior after performing these steps: target cache name still displayed Version of c:geo used: developer version 20160509

report.summary: New map: Overlays not updated
report.label: Bug
report.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Open live map (new map) Click on unsaved cache Select Save Actual behavior after performing these steps: Disk icon overlay not shown for the cache Expected behavior after performing these steps: Disk icon overlay shown. Working with old mapsforge implementation. Version of c:geo used: 2016.05.17-NB Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes Other comments and remarks: Same may apply for deleting a cache or updating icon after posting found log

report.summary: List not refreshed properly after import GPX
report.label: Bug
report.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: creat an empty list import GPX file (with any number of caches, I tested with 100+) after import successful dialog, press ok press BACK from GPX files panel to return to list panel Actual behavior after performing these steps: list is shown empty click on lists dropdown shows an update for the "all caches" counter switching lists to all caches shows proper contents switching lists and then back to list into which I imported shows proper content Expected behavior after performing these steps: list to be properly populated after GPX import without the need of further user interraction. Version of c:geo used: 2016.05.09 Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes, always System information: Android 4.4.2 (Huawei Ascend P7) Android 4.2.1 (Allview P5 Quad; MTK cpu with JIT issues) (tested on 2 different devices, same behaviour) Other comments and remarks:

report.summary: New map: "Store Offline" not shown
report.label: Bug
report.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Enable new map Open live map wait till all visible caches are loaded Open menu Actual behavior after performing these steps: No "Store Offline" menu entry is shown Expected behavior after performing these steps: Menu "Store Offline" is shown Version of c:geo used: Reported via `2016.05.29-NB-fb50e95 Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes System information: Attach system information here if available (see c:geo menu -> About c:geo -> System) Other comments and remarks: Reported by a user via c:geo Fanpage on Facebook. I can reproduce it.

report.summary: cancelling storing leads to wrong markers
report.label: Bug
report.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Start downloading an online search result list Cancel at some point in between Actual behavior after performing these steps: The online search result list is refreshed and all caches have the offline marker. But in fact, not all have been stored. When randomly clicking caches from the list now, some open immediately, and some will be downloaded first (the ones we cancelled).

report.summary: Interworking problem with Maps.me 6.0.7
report.label: Bug
report.description: From support mail: All worked well until I upgraded to Maps.me 6.0.7 Looking at a list of 40 caches and selecting "Show on a map", then Maps.me There are 40 green dots around where I am standing, GOOD. I tap a dot. It comes up with box and words c:geo and the co-ordinates. I tap the arrow labelled "Back", it then quickly shows a message that it cannot download cache details, and return to the list. The one nearest is top of the list. But I want to research other around and have no idea which is which Previously (before the Maps upgrade) it came up with the cache name, and if I did a back arrow, it then opened that cache's description. So it seems that the interchange parameters to Maps.me has changed with this new version. Please can you look into it? Android 4.1.1 C:geo 2016 05 09

report.summary: Caches shown as found although not found
report.label: Bug
report.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Open GC6HP1Y Actual behavior after performing these steps: Cache is shown as found altghough it is not found by the user Expected behavior after performing these steps: Correct found state should be shown Version of c:geo used: 2016.05.09 as well as current master Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes Other comments and remarks: Reported via support mail and reproducible for me

report.summary: In offline list, stay at the last position after moving a cache in another list
report.label: Bug
report.description: Hi c:geo team, Detailed steps causing the problem: Go into an offline list with tens of caches Go to the end (for example), select a cache, move the cache in another list by using the "move" button (or long press the cache, select "move in another list" choice in the menu) Actual behavior after performing these steps: After moving the cache, we are back to the beginning of the list Expected behavior after performing these steps: Stay to the last known position in the list before moving the cache Version of c:geo used: 2016.05.09 Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes System information: Attach system information here if available (see c:geo menu -> About c:geo -> System) Other comments and remarks: Thanks, Tof

report.summary: Numeric trackable secret code or five digit code not working
report.label: Bug
report.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Select Search Enter tracking code which is numeric only and has five digits Actual behavior after performing these steps: Immediate response toast "c:geo konnte diesen Trackable nicht finden" Expected behavior after performing these steps: Open trackable page Version of c:geo used: 2016.05.09 Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes Other comments and remarks: From support mail and verified Secret code available on request

report.summary: Wrongly detect 2 digit numbers as geocode in lab cache gpx
report.label: Bug
report.description: Import the 3 lab cache GPX files from GC55555. Cache number 10 will always overwrite the existing cache number 10. This is because our GPX parser wrongly thinks that the "10 - some name" indicates the geocode 10, therefore overwriting the previously existing cache.

report.summary: Embedded pictures not shown
report.label: Bug
report.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: open GC61EE3 the listing contains embedded pictures (at the end) Actual behavior after performing these steps: For me only a placeholder is shown (small rectangle with OBJ in it) Expected behavior after performing these steps: Pictures should be shown Version of c:geo used: 2016.06.10-NB1 Is the problem reproducible for you? Not clear but happening on several caches for me System information: Attach system information here if available (see c:geo menu -> About c:geo -> System) Other comments and remarks:

report.summary: Searching certain TB code freezes app
report.label: Bug
report.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Debug mode active Search for (possibly wrong) tracking code CMPRNP via main screen search field Actual behavior after performing these steps: Progress windows opens but freezes immediately Expected behavior after performing these steps: TB opened or correct error message shown Version of c:geo used: 2016.06.10-NB1 Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes System information: ##### Other comments and remarks:

report.summary: New map: Map from list opens at current position
report.label: Bug
report.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Open live map Activate to center own position Leave live map Open list of caches which are at another location Map the list Actual behavior after performing these steps: Map opens at own position (no cache shown as out of view) Expected behavior after performing these steps: Map should cover the coords of the listed caches Version of c:geo used: 2016.06.10-NB1 Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes Other comments and remarks: Not tested explicitly if this also happens with old map but I never before experienced the problem on old map

report.summary: Wrong date when logging trackables very early?
report.label: Bug
report.description: I logged a trackable this morning at 6:10 German time. When I refreshed the trackable afterwards, it was shown logged yesterday. I had not changed the date selector, so I'm somewhat sure it was not set to yesterday. Might this be a problem with the time offset of -7 hours that we use somewhere? I can't verify this behaviour at the moment, since I have no private tracking code available. Will re-test one of the next days with my own trackables.

report.summary: Stuck in batch refresh
report.label: Bug
report.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Have a list of 100+ caches Select to refresh all Actual behavior after performing these steps: At some unreproducible point of time no more network traffic can be seen and there is no more progress indicated. Happend to me since some weeks in nightly on mobile network as well as on wifi. Expected behavior after performing these steps: Normal progress Version of c:geo used: 2016.06.15-NB Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes Other comments and remarks: We had this in the past and it was solved...something with DB access or static maps (cant remember exactly...have to search the issue). The symptoms now look the same.

report.summary: History list not refreshed after clearing
report.label: Bug
report.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Open history Menu → Clear history Actual behavior after performing these steps: The caches in the history list are still shown. Expected behavior after performing these steps: The list should be empty. If you go back to the start screen and then again to the history, it will be empty. Version of c:geo used: 52db0cc

report.summary: Confused strings in connector setup
report.label: Bug
report.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Start c:geo Go to Menu -> Settings -> Services Note: No "Active" subtitle for geocaching.su Enter menu for geocaching.su Note: Subtitle of Activate item shows "Load caches from geocaching.su" Activate the item Actual behavior after performing these steps: Subtitle now shows "true"/"false" depending on the active state of the checkbox Additionally on leaving the menu the service list does not show "Active" for geocaching.su Only on leaving and reentering the settings menu the behaviour is correct again. Expected behavior after performing these steps: The subtitle within the geocaching.su setup should remain unchanged "Active" should be shown in the services overview menu Version of c:geo used: 2016.06.27-NB Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes Other comments and remarks: @Bananeweizen

report.summary: Checker menu missing
report.label: Bug

report.summary: Cannot open cache from GK LogEntry waypoint
report.label: Bug
report.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Having GKM proxy enabled Open a GK which has been placed in a cache (like GKB988) Swipe to the Logbook tab Tap one of the geocode just behind the date Actual behavior after performing these steps: A toast say "c:geo failed to download cache details" Expected behavior after performing these steps: The corresponding cache should be opened (like done for TB) Version of c:geo used: master w/ #5847 Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes System information: N/A Other comments and remarks: The LogEntry only store cache name and GUID. In the case of GeoKrety, we don't know the GUID, only the geocode (or coordinates). This will also be necessary if cache is from opencaching (no guid info there?)

report.summary: wheryougo downloads wrong cartridge
report.label: Bug
report.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Have Wheryougo installed open GC21X0F Select Navigation - Whereyougo Actual behavior after performing these steps: Whereyougo opens, logs in and offers to download a cartridge The downloaded cartridge is not matching to the cache but belongs to another cache (of the same owner?) Expected behavior after performing these steps: Should trigger download of correct cartridge Version of c:geo used: Current nightly Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes for this cache System information: Attach system information here if available (see c:geo menu -> About c:geo -> System) Other comments and remarks: Might also be a problem within WhereYouGo??

report.summary: GK wrong log author for logs with attached comment
report.label: Bug
report.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Open GKB3F8 Swipe to Logbook Actual behavior after performing these steps: Log from 2016/01/30 is authored by "kumy" Expected behavior after performing these steps: Real author is "nocybe1810" Version of c:geo used: master Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes System information: N/A Other comments and remarks: This log has comments attached to it.

report.summary: History sorted incorrectly
report.label: Bug
report.description: History is sorted by the time when the offline log was created, not the date that was set for the log.

report.summary: Cache doubled after refresh
report.label: Bug
report.description: New beta feedback (will translate later) Hallo. Ich habe einen Cache in 2 Listen gespeichert. Anschließend habe ich ihn in Liste A aktualisiert mit der Folge, dass er in Liste B zwei Mal erscheint. Einmal mit Speicherzeit und einmal mit der Zeit der Aktualisierung.

report.summary: Attribute filter does not list all attributes
report.label: Bug
report.description: Only attributes listed in res/values/cache_attributes.xml are shown, but there are more attributes defined in src/cgeo/geocaching/enumerations/CacheAttribute.java (e.g. OC only).

report.summary: Coords not sendable to mapy.cz
report.label: Bug
report.description: From support mail: I would like to describe you a small problem with sending coordinates to external applications (in this case mapy.cz). The problem is that when you send those coordinates, mapy.cz will only show a label (picture) without a pin with exact position (picture). And I would like to point out that it has to work offline as well. It would really make user experience better not only for me, but for many Czech geocachers. Keep up the good work! Thanks. 2016.06.09

report.summary: Maps.me interworking broken
report.label: Bug
report.description: From FB and support mail: Navigating using maps.me from cgeo is no longer working (no target shown in maps.me). Happens if both apps are on latest available release, works again when downgrading maps.me to previous official version. So either an API change on maps.me which we need to follow or simply a bug of maps.me.

report.summary: Live caches vanish when disabling updates
report.label: Bug
report.description: When you open the (new) live map, wait for caches to load and then switch to offline, the downloaded caches are removed from the map. They should stay, obviously.

report.summary: Modified coords not shown
report.label: Bug
report.description: Beta feedback: Mapsforge BETA glitch? Sunday entered corrected cords for a puzzle cache but didn't move the cache marker just kept it as the red reference point mark. When flipped back to original maps and cache location had moved to new corrected coords but going back the icons had swapped again. PS love the new Mapsforge much clearer detail.

report.summary: Live map crashing
report.label: Bug
report.description: Sine this morning we get complaints about freezing/crashing live map. I can reproduce this after short usage of the live map. As it wasnt the case last days I assume we have a server issue one again (or still) where cgeo crashes instead of catching the error and giving a proper error message. Maybe someone can reproduce and provide a log. IMHO we should urgently fix this because people blame cgeo for this.

report.summary: Duplicate classes
report.label: Bug
report.description:
The current invocation used on the CI to build and test cgeo appears to trigger various (maybe severe) warnings, such as duplicate definitions for almost every class in proguard. […] Note: duplicate definition of library class [cgeo.geocaching.maps.CGeoMap] Note: duplicate definition of library class [cgeo.geocaching.maps.DefaultMap] Note: duplicate definition of library class [cgeo.geocaching.maps.MapActivity] Note: duplicate definition of library class [cgeo.geocaching.list.StoredList$UserInterface$1] Note: duplicate definition of library class [cgeo.geocaching.list.StoredList$UserInterface$2] Note: duplicate definition of library class [cgeo.geocaching.list.StoredList$UserInterface$3] Note: duplicate definition of library class [cgeo.geocaching.list.StoredList$UserInterface$4] Note: duplicate definition of library class [cgeo.geocaching.list.StoredList$UserInterface$5] Note: duplicate definition of library class [cgeo.geocaching.list.StoredList$UserInterface$6] Note: duplicate definition of library class [cgeo.geocaching.list.StoredList$UserInterface$7] Note: duplicate definition of library class [cgeo.geocaching.list.StoredList$UserInterface$8] […]
Assigning to @Bananeweizen in case this is due to recent Gradle upgrades and he knows how to fix this.

report.summary: Nightly not building since 15.09.16
report.label: Bug
report.description: CI says: 00:30:26 > You have not accepted the license agreements of the following SDK components: 00:30:26 [Android SDK Platform 23]. 00:30:26 Before building your project, you need to accept the license agreements and complete the installation of the missing components using the Android Studio SDK Manager. 00:30:26 Alternatively, to learn how to transfer the license agreements from one workstation to another, go to http://d.android.com/r/studio-ui/export-licenses.html

report.summary: Refresh caches on history will store them to default list
report.label: Bug
report.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Log some caches from different lists Delete some of them from all lists, let some remain on the different lists Open the history Select "Refresh all" Actual behavior after performing these steps: All refreshed caches are now stored on the default list (whereas caches still stored on a random list will additionally appear on the default list and no longer stored caches will also appear on the default list) Expected behavior after performing these steps: Refreshing the history should neither store no longer stored caches, nor add them to the default list Version of c:geo used: 2016.08.27 Is the problem reproducible for you? From support mail (only partly retested by myself)

report.summary: Dont show final marker (on map) for final waypoints without coords
report.label: Bug
report.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Open GC4C67W It has a final waypoint without valid coords (as the owner probably decided to make it visible but hide its coords) Store the cache Open the (live) map of that region Actual behavior after performing these steps: The cache is shown with the final marker on the map Expected behavior after performing these steps: The final marker should not be shown, as the final waypoint has no valid coords Version of c:geo used: 2016.08.27 Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes Other comments and remarks: Up to approx. March 2016 this was implemented as suggested but changed thereafter. Users are complaining as they are no longer able to differentiate between real modified mystery final coords and those "dummy" caches. I have in mind, that I already have seen such an issue but can't find it.

report.summary: Cache name rendered multiple lines in cache list
report.label: Bug
report.description: Have GC6T86J in a cache list. You will notice that its name is rendered in 2 lines (the second clock of that name is visible partly). Probably that happens for all caches, we just did not notice yet.

report.summary: Save for offline from map not working
report.label: Bug
report.description: Short version as I am on mobile only: Current nightly Searched for an address Mapped the result Selected "Save for offline" from map menu Result: Toast is shown with something like "Nothing to save" although unsaved caches are on the map Might be related to new map (did not test old map/google map)

report.summary: wrong icon when navigating to parking lot
report.label: Bug
report.description: Have a cache with a parking lot waypoint. Open the map for the cache and look at the final and the parking lot icons. Everything fine. Now open the map from the parking lot waypoint instead. The icon is no longer a parking icon, but a reference point icon.

report.summary: Broute lost on changing map source
report.label: Bug
report.description: Map route to a cache Change map source e.g. from Google to OSM Result: Line changes from route to straight line

report.summary: WhereYouGo not listed in Navigtion for a specific cache
report.label: Bug
report.description: Open GC6B4TH Although it contains a link to the cartridge the WhereYouGo option is missing in the navigation menu.

report.summary: Log picture upload ends with error message although OK
report.label: Bug
report.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Log a cache find and attach picture with the log (GC.com) Send the log Actual behavior after performing these steps: An error message is shown, that sending seems failed and user shall check on website (retry/cancel/offline). Expected behavior after performing these steps: This occured to me on the last 14 days for each picture I attched, so something seems wrong while checking the result. In all cases log and picture had been uploaded correctly. Version of c:geo used: Master Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes (at least it seems like that to me...can't do extensive tests right now) Other comments and remarks: Feel free to test with my owned caches to check whether reproducible

report.summary: "Make list unique" menu makes cgeo crash in nearest cache list
report.label: Bug
report.description: Hello Cgeo team !! Detailed steps causing the problem: Launch the app Click on "Nearest cache list" Click on menu (top right) Click on "Make list unique" Actual behavior after performing these steps: CGeo crashes Expected behavior after performing these steps: CGeo doesn't crash Version of c:geo used: Master Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes, systematic System information: Device: SDK build for x86 Android version 6.0 Android build: sdk_google_phone_x86-userdebug 6.0 MASTER 3287151 test-keys Cgeo version: 2016.10.08-14bbb90 developer build ... Other comments and remarks: No Many thanks in advance ! Morice

report.summary: Listing background not shown in gallery if hosted externally
report.label: Bug
report.description: Feature request Hi guys, thanks for your great job! It is possible to display the background-image of a cache-listing in c:geo? If the picture is in the gallery than its shown in cgeo. But often the background is not in the gallery and in this case it will not be shown. I hope that will be possible. Thanks and best regards king-ton

report.summary: URL in hint gets convertet to "visit link" but it is not clickable
report.label: Bug
report.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Some Cacheowners, especially in the US, are writing URLs in the hints of their listings. Here is an example: https://coord.info/GC4W4BP cgeo recocnise this links and shows a blue "visit link" instead. But its not clickable. if you click on the link the whole hint is only getting en/decrypted Actual behavior after performing these steps: "visit link" in hint not clickable Expected behavior after performing these steps: "visit link" should open the link, not en/decrypt it like normal hint-text alternativ: dont convert it to "visit link" so that it can be read or copied Version of c:geo used: 2016.10.13 Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes

report.summary: Home coords parsing broken?
report.label: Bug
report.description: FB reports tell, that people are located in Iran by default when GPS is not available. I can reproduce by switching off GPS and starting c:geo twice (because home coords are only used after second login AFAIR). It seems either the home coords are not working on the website or we fail when parsing them.

report.summary: Mapsforge beta - missing tiles
report.label: Bug
report.description: Moved to new issue from #6032 When rendering, some tiles are missing. And they stay missing even after scrolling/zooming in/out. The missing tiles never load (during current session).

report.summary: Mapsforge beta and route as straight line
report.label: Bug
report.description: New map active (mapsforge beta) Open live map Enable live Select a cache to show its popup Press the "route button" (circle with angled arrow) A direct line is shown from current position to cache. Top shows distance, I presume it is direct distance. No route seems to be calculated. BRouter is installed and configured for car-test and started in server mode. BRouter has appropriate data already downloaded. Tested and confirmed working using it within OSMAND. in c:geo there is no indication that BRouter is detected, or even if there is such depedency. User has no way of determining if c:geo and BRouter work together or not. Line visual theme (simple red with slight alpha) shown from position to cache (or presumably would be route) is visually not well represented. Assume it is shown as route properly, in sample screen, it would almost be indistinguishable over the red primary roads there. Could be related to #6017 Parts of this issue were conceptually defined here #6033 before being discovered.

report.summary: Add to Favorite box nit shown for webcam cache
report.label: Bug
report.description: When logging "webcam photo taken" thenlog page does not show the tickbox for adding the cache to your favorites. Current nightly

report.summary: cannot open OC.FR links
report.label: Bug
report.description: Open a cache link from opencaching.fr. Cannot read cache details.

report.summary: Glitch in personal note coord parsing
report.label: Bug
report.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Cache saved with empty personal note Edit note and insert (note the accidental empty space between minutes and seconds in latitude): N12 34. 567 W001 23.456 Save the note Swipe to the waypoint tab Actual behavior after performing these steps: A waypoint is created from the personal note but uses N12 34.567, E007 00.000 Expected behavior after performing these steps: Wapoint coords should be identical to those in personal note Version of c:geo used: 2016.11.05 Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes

report.summary: Rounding error near "minute confluence"?
report.label: Bug
report.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Open a cache Move to East xx° yy'.998 from West Swipe to waypoints "Add Waypoint", select DD MM.MMM format Now move further to East Actual behavior after performing these steps: Display will eventually show xx yy.000 (and a WP taken will be >1 km off) Expected behavior after performing these steps: Expected: yy gets incremented (and WP reflects current position) Version of c:geo used: 2016.07.09-NB.34c95b1 Is the problem reproducible for you? It's a bit tricky because is apparently only happens at xx yy.999[5-9] and with very good GPS reception System information: OnePlus (A0001, bacon) 6.0.1 MHC19Q Other comments and remarks: This looks quite similar to Issue #2624 - but this time, for minutes

report.summary: Static maps error
report.label: Bug
report.description: enter cache details Select Navigate - Save static maps Maps are loaded but display a yellow error marker and something seems incorrect (did not look in detail) According to https://developers.google.com/maps/documentation/static-maps/error-messages#warnings this means an error in the request.

report.summary: StaticMapsActivity modifies reads and writes adapter outside the main thread
report.label: Bug
report.description: Noticed in master. This should be modernized to use RxJava to benefit from fine scheduler control, parallelism, and ability to cancel requests properly, instead of using a thread. The StaticMapsProvider is already reactive. Also, some operations (such as the refresh operation from the menu) appear to block on the UI thread. This should be adressed as well. 11-11 22:16:29.489 E/cgeo (29111): [Thread-2] StaticMapsActivity.LoadMapsThread.run 11-11 22:16:29.489 E/cgeo (29111): android.view.ViewRootImpl$CalledFromWrongThreadException: Only the original thread that created a view hierarchy can touch its views. 11-11 22:16:29.489 E/cgeo (29111): at android.view.ViewRootImpl.checkThread(ViewRootImpl.java:6855) 11-11 22:16:29.489 E/cgeo (29111): at android.view.ViewRootImpl.requestLayout(ViewRootImpl.java:1040) 11-11 22:16:29.489 E/cgeo (29111): at android.view.View.requestLayout(View.java:19657) 11-11 22:16:29.489 E/cgeo (29111): at android.view.View.requestLayout(View.java:19657) 11-11 22:16:29.489 E/cgeo (29111): at android.view.View.requestLayout(View.java:19657) 11-11 22:16:29.489 E/cgeo (29111): at android.view.View.requestLayout(View.java:19657) 11-11 22:16:29.489 E/cgeo (29111): at android.view.View.requestLayout(View.java:19657) 11-11 22:16:29.489 E/cgeo (29111): at android.widget.AbsListView.requestLayout(AbsListView.java:1988) 11-11 22:16:29.489 E/cgeo (29111): at android.widget.AdapterView$AdapterDataSetObserver.onChanged(AdapterView.java:840) 11-11 22:16:29.489 E/cgeo (29111): at android.widget.AbsListView$AdapterDataSetObserver.onChanged(AbsListView.java:6351) 11-11 22:16:29.489 E/cgeo (29111): at android.database.DataSetObservable.notifyChanged(DataSetObservable.java:37) 11-11 22:16:29.489 E/cgeo (29111): at android.widget.BaseAdapter.notifyDataSetChanged(BaseAdapter.java:50) 11-11 22:16:29.489 E/cgeo (29111): at android.widget.ArrayAdapter.notifyDataSetChanged(ArrayAdapter.java:310) 11-11 22:16:29.489 E/cgeo (29111): at android.widget.ArrayAdapter.add(ArrayAdapter.java:200) 11-11 22:16:29.489 E/cgeo (29111): at cgeo.geocaching.staticmaps.StaticMapsActivity$LoadMapsThread.run(StaticMapsActivity.java:100)

report.summary: Trackable log page not loading
report.label: Bug
report.description: Search for TB private code from main screen search bar TB page opens normally Start logging It seems cgeo cannot load the needed data: The progress spinner keeps spinning continously...waited for 1 minute. No debug log available at the moment from my side Loading the TB log page in browser works normal Current nightly

report.summary: Crash when trying to initially select an offline map
report.label: Bug

Actual behavior after performing these steps: No log entries are shown, even after refreshing the cache. Expected behavior after performing these steps: Log entries should be dislayed Version of c:geo used: 2016.11.16-NB-d2c2bc9 Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes System information: Galaxy Note II, Galaxy Tab 10.1 214 Edition, Android 4.4.2 Other comments and remarks: none

report.summary: Cannot authenticate to opencaching.pl
report.label: Bug
report.description: Current master. OAuth authentication process cannot start as www.opencaching.pl is not known.

report.summary: Queue offline personal note updates
report.label: Bug
report.description: It would be nice when caching in remote areas where cell reception is on again off again, that when you hit upload on the personal note page, that it is queued up to send when you get back into cell reception. Currently, the only way to know if it was sent or not, is if GC.COM is missing a personal note.

report.summary: Login failed or stuck for OC sites
report.label: Bug
report.description: Started after upgrading from two days old nightly. In settings authentication is ok but still shown failed on main screen. Will provide log later.

Yes

report.summary: SSL related login error on geocaching.com

However my client and CI website tests show, that we fail to login at 23:54MET today while my PC browser has no problems: 23:52:57.394 Warning cgeo 20609 [OkHttp] Failure (370 ms) GET https://www.geocaching.com/login/default.aspx (javax.net.ssl.SSLHandshakeException: java.security.cert.CertPathValidatorException: Trust anchor for certification path not found.)

report.summary: History not working reliably
report.label: Bug
report.description: This is more or less a reminder to myself (and others who would like to test): Some user reports for the current RC version (2016.11.28-RC) tell, that there are problems in the history: Offline logged caches not visible History cannot be emptied History is emptied but cache count in title bar still shows x caches on list I cannot reproduce any of them right now, but as we had a change in this area I think there might be some leftover bug under special conditions. I will try to gather more information from users and try to test some things myself. 👍 1

report.summary: Non-detailed caches incorrectly counted for amount of stored caches
report.label: Bug
report.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Remember the amount of saved caches on your lists as shown on the mainscreen as X Open live map Click on a non-detailed cache (with orange circle) From the popup select Log Visist Enter log text and press back to save the log Actual behavior after performing these steps: Cache icon has now markers for offline logged and saved(?) Saved caches amount on main screen is now x+1 Cache is not visible in lists Cache is visible in history Opening this cache in history will show the non-detailed status: Empty description, Empty logbook Cache details screen shows "Saved on device 11746 days ago" Expected behavior after performing these steps: I don't know enough about the DB structure to judge the best way of fixing this. However from a user perspective: It should show up in the history (as it does) It should not count to the amount of total caches stored in lists as it is not part of any list contained there It should not show up with saved icon on map Version of c:geo used: 2016.12.10-NB Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes Other comments and remarks: This seems to be not caused by the change of @pstorch (ded3fb7) as the behaviour is the same with this fix (fresh RC) and without this fix (current nightly).

report.summary: History cannot be emptied
report.label: Bug
report.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Start with empty database Save some caches to your lists Enter list, open a cache and write an offline log for one of the saved caches Offline log status is visible in lists Cache is shown in history Open history and select "Clear history" Actual behavior after performing these steps: Nothing happens Expected behavior after performing these steps: Hsistory is emptied Version of c:geo used: 2016.12.11-RC (including ded3fb7) Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes Comment: Related to #6181

report.summary: Crash when opening logbook of certain cache
report.label: Bug

No Happend for a user on FB. I can reproduce it on 1 out of 5 devices, sadly only on the one which offers no logging. Can someone reproduce and provide a log?
