report.summary: Waypoint description not updated if new description is shorter
report.label: Bug
report.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Open a GC cache which has a waypoint that contains a description Check that the waypoint is identical to the listing on the website Ask the owner to change the description of the waypoint Refresh cache in c:geo Actual behavior after performing these steps: Waypoint will keep showing the old description Expected behavior after performing these steps: Waypoint should be updated with the new description Version of c:geo used: 2016.12.28 Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes Other comments and remarks: I can volunteer with my owned cache to help debugging this Set to "High" as this might be not the standard case but still can make it impossible for users to find a cache (e.g. given they stored a cache long time ago and don't get the updated info Similar to #3650

report.summary: Non-detailed saved caches show wrong saving date
report.label: Bug
report.description: Not sure if this might be a duplicate...wan't there an issue about saving a non-detailed cache Detailed steps causing the problem: Open live map, set strategy to "Fast" Select an orange circled (= non-detailed) cache From the popup select "Log Visit" and store the log offline Actual behavior after performing these steps: In the popup you can now read "Saved on the device 17174 days ago" Expected behavior after performing these steps: The correct saving date should be used Version of c:geo used: 2016.12.28 Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes

report.summary: One-click offline log does not save cache
report.label: Bug
report.description: I found a difference depending of whether or not "One-click offline log" is active. Can someone explain: Detailed steps causing the problem: Enable "One-click offline log" in Menu - Settings - Logging Open live map, set strategy to "Fast" Select an orange circled (= non-detailed) cache From the popup select "One-click offline log" and select found Actual behavior after performing these steps: Cache does not get stored Expected behavior after performing these steps: Should be treated in the same way as when using the online log function (see #6231)

report.summary: List not refreshed after deletion of a cache
report.label: Bug
report.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Open a list with many caches on it (enough to allow scrolling) Don't scroll but delete a cache from those visible on the screen by long press -> Remove Result 1 Scroll down and remove a cache from those visible on the screen by long press -> Remove Result 2 Actual behavior after performing these steps: Result 1: Cache is not removed from the list / list is not refresed Result 2: Works as it should / list is refreshed Expected behavior after performing these steps: List should always be refreshed after modification Version of c:geo used: 2016.01.14-NB1-6e9a53e Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes Other comments and remarks: Seems the problem only occurs if the list is not scrolled down @pstorch: AFAIR you changed something related to remember position on the list after deleting from history. Might you have changed the genereal bahviour unintentionally?

report.summary: Extract waypoints menu only visible for saved caches

Yes

Yes (on the mentioned cache) Other comments and remarks: @pstorch I guess this is a side effect of your latest waypoint handling changes?

report.summary: CloseQuitely not supported below API 16
report.label: Bug
report.description: While investigatin #6413 we found that we use CloseQuietly() although it is only supported starting with API level 16 (our minsdk is 14 now). There are only rare crash reports on Google Play however we have like 30 occurences in the code. So either we remove it or raise minsdk again to 16 which would close out all Android versions below 4.1.

report.summary: Crash in settings if SD card was removed
report.label: Bug
report.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Have GeocacheData moved to external SD card Close and kill c:geo Remove SD card from device Start c:geo Log shows Warning (see first sdb log attached) Try to enter Menu -> Settings (e.g. if you plan to set the storage to internal again) Actual behavior after performing these steps: Crash Expected behavior after performing these steps: Detect absence of GeocacheData dir and e.g. fallback (to be discussed) to internal dir in that case. Also without a fallback c:geo should not crash when entering settings menu allowing the user to manually adjust the dir setting. Version of c:geo used: 2017.03.25-NB Is the problem reproducible for you? report.summary: RunTimeException (doInBackground)

report.summary: Consecutive move of geocache data has problems
report.label: Bug
report.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Move geocache data from external to internal In the dialog before moving it shows "xMB used" (x=282,2 in my case) Move geocache data again from internal to external In the dialog before moving it shows "yMB used" (y=192,4 in my case) Move geocache date again from external to internal Actual behavior after performing these steps: In the dialog before moving it now shows "0B used" Actually also the progress is getting much faster now (almost instantly). Expected behavior after performing these steps: First we need to find out what actually happens here. Is the data still moved or do we count less data and also move less data? Version of c:geo used: 2017.03.29-NB1 Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes System information: Samsung Galacy S7 with Android 7.0 and external SD 64GB

report.summary: Rework CI build to recognize all errors
report.label: Bug
report.description: Currently, the CI doesn't run the unit tests. Hence, it doesn't find errors that are covered by the unit tests or that are in the unit tests itself (see 919c415#commitcomment-21778589). Thus, we should also run the unit tests during CI. 👍 1

report.summary: Backup not found

Actual behavior after performing these steps: Backup not found. File /.cgeo/cgeo.sqlite exists. Expected behavior after performing these steps: Backups from both old and new locations should be found, since this is a rather normal migration use case.

Still the user should be able to drop or change the filter when clicking on it.

report.summary: Call to maps.me app not working
report.label: Bug
report.description: We have some users on support mail using 2017.05.22 telling us, that the interworking with maps.me fails since some time. They select Navigate -> Maps.me on a cache and nothing happens. Using maps.me to map a list of caches works normal. I will try to test this as soon as time permits, but maybe someone has a clue.

report.summary: Sort by favorite percent is wrong
report.label: Bug
report.description: I see a web cam cache first when sorting by favorite percent with only 70 favorite s but 1800 photos taken. Looks like we take only found counts, which are near zero for the webcam cache, instead of aggregating all logs which represent finds, e.g. photo, attended etc.

report.summary: Error although log posted successfully
report.label: Bug
report.description: Using c:geo I have encountered (for unknown reasons) errors while submitting logs (with all my trackables set to "visited"). The message was smth like "error posting log, please try again". Today I looked into my GC account from a PC and found that for caches where I encountered such errors I discovered that I actually posted several logs to that cache, instead of just one. In fact, there was a log posted for each attempt I made. Clearly posting a cache log and then posting a log for each trackable is done in the same thread (as regard to error handling) and the error message I got was erroneous, by that I mean: actual cache log was successfully posted the error happened for one of the trackables log ("visited") I was left in the situation to retry to post the cache log, even though it was successfully posted the first time. I worked around by not visiting my trackables. Also note that it happened for many caches, but never for "found logs". I encountered the problem with DNF and Needs maintenance.

report.summary: Variable field vanishing on certain input
report.label: Bug
report.description: Just built a new nightly to take a first look at the waypoint calculator. I had no time to test in details, so just a short try where I either found a bug or still have a misunderstanding of the working mode. Detailed steps causing the problem: Start with a new calculation Assign A to F to the last lat and lon digits Enter formulas for A to F where A=a , B=b, C=c-b Actual behavior after performing these steps: When entering B=b the variable input field for b is shown, when entering C=c-b a new variable field for c is shown but the field for b is gone Expected behavior after performing these steps: Variable input b should stay Version of c:geo used: 2017.07.29-NB1 Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes System information: Samsung Galaxy Tab S2 Android 7.0 Other comments and remarks: I added a new label "WP Calc" to get a better overview for issues regarding the new WP calculator.

report.summary: Offline Map on "real" ext sd card not choosable (Android 7)
report.label: Bug
report.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Put an offline map on a "real" ext sd card Try to find it in c:geo or choose directory Actual behavior after performing these steps: Map not found Directory on ext sd card not choosable Expected behavior after performing these steps: Scan "real" ext sd card, too or let the user choose a directory manually on it Version of c:geo used: 2017.07.24 Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes System information: Huawai P10 Plus with Android 7 Other comments and remarks: Got this issue reported from a friend. After moving the map to the internal storage c:geo found it. In the last refactoring with the new storage concept we haven't touched the Maps directories. There is some special logic (device dependent?) to find the mounted devices. Maybe this needs some rework.

report.summary: Username no longer shown on main screen
report.label: Bug
report.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Start c:geo Wait for completion of login on geocaching.com Actual behavior after performing these steps: At the bottom of the main screen it shows: GC * (finds) * Login OK Expected behavior after performing these steps: GC * Username (finds) * Login OK Version of c:geo used: 2017.07.24 as well as nightly Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes Other comments and remarks: Most likely related to a website change I could imagine, this might affect also other functions like (owned caches selection, own logs selection) but I did not yet test this.

report.summary: Description of GC15GV4 unreadable
report.label: Bug
report.description: Some weeks ago I stored GC15GV4 on my device using an older nightly of beginning of August. I noticed no problem reading the description. Meanwhile I use a newer nightly 2017.09.03 and noticed the still stored cache had now black text on black background. As the caches was not refresehed since original storing it, it might be the visualization might have a bug in newer version. I might be wrong though. Can someone check this cache with the current market release?

report.summary: parse error for coordinates on integer longitude/lattitude
report.label: Bug
report.description: Try to store OC0054 or OC533E. Both throw a parse exception. The commonality is that they use coordinates exactly on full longitude/lattitude. https://forum.opencaching.de/index.php?topic=4912.msg61348#msg61348

report.summary: Log picture not attached to log immediately after posting
report.label: Bug
report.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Log an OC cache incl. picture After log is posted, swipe to logbook Actual behavior after performing these steps: No picture shown attached to the log Expected behavior after performing these steps: Picture should be shown Version of c:geo used: 2017.09.30-NB Is the problem reproducible for you? Only tested once Other comments : Compare to GC picture upload with c:geo. Picture is shown there after log has been posted

report.summary: Calculator Crashed on Screen Rotation
report.label: Bug
report.description: This was probably introduced with #6759 and seems to be caused by a change to the 'Plain Format' text field. The change gets triggered sometime between when the 'textListener' is added in onCreateView(...) and when the calculator's state is loaded in onResume(). The actual crash is caused by accessing the currentFormat variable before it is initialised but I can't for the life of me workout what is causing the text to be changed prior to the onResume() call. In any event simply protecting the reference to currentFormat with "if null" checks alleviates the problem but I would have preferred to isolate the cause of the text changed event in the first place but can't seem to find it.

Yes, but only with one waypoint. System information: TODO Other comments and remarks: Maybe introduced with tri-state button change. If an older nightly is still available I can check how the calculator is configured in this waypoint.

report.summary: Cannot store from history
report.label: Bug
report.description: I deleted some caches (with offline logs) and wanted to restore them from the history. But there is no menu item to store/move/copy all/selected caches to another "real" list. 2017.10.27-NB-ea62d13

report.summary: Save for offline from map now also visible if all visible caches are already stored
report.label: Bug
report.description: Reported on support mail for current beta version (2017.11.01-RC2): On the map, with some caches visible, when opening the menu there's an option to save them for offline use. Before, that menu option appeared only if there were at least one cache not yet saved. Now it appears allways, even if all visible caches are already saved on c:geo lists. @Bananeweizen Could this be related to your change 7c79739 ?

report.summary: Calculator does not save state on pause
report.label: Bug
report.description: Add or edit waypoint, open calculator dd mm.mmm format, add some variables type some numbers press home or switch to another app go back to c:geo calculator still visible, but all variable buttons are numbers again when you tap the buttons, they will turn into variables again and still have their assigned content that you typed previously. Nightly from today.

report.summary: Duplicate waypoint does not duplicate calculation
report.label: Bug
report.description: Create a waypoint with calculation. When you long-press on it and select "duplicate waypoint" then it duplicates the waypoint with the calculated coordinates, but not the calculation itself. So when you edit the copy and open the calculator, it will start without variables.

report.summary: Waypoints of caches not parsed
report.label: Bug
report.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Open e.g. GC6Y8T8 Open the waypoint tab Actual behavior after performing these steps: Waypoints of the cache not shown Expected behavior after performing these steps: Waypoints shown Version of c:geo used: All Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes Other comments and remarks: Seems to be related to a recent website change

report.summary: Archived/Disabled status not recognized
report.label: Bug
report.description: Due to recent layout changed the archived and disabled state of a geocache is not recognized anymore.

report.summary: Calculator state lost if device rotation is involved
report.label: Bug
report.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Create new waypoint Open calculator Assign some variables and enter values to have valid coords Leave calculator by clicking "Tick" icon After returning to waypoint screen rotate device (e.g. portrait to landscape) Open waypoint calculator again by clicking on coordinates and selecting "Calculate Coordinates" Actual behavior after performing these steps: Variables and values are lost Expected behavior after performing these steps: Variables and values should be saved Version of c:geo used: 2017.12.06 Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes/No System information: Attach system information here if available (see c:geo menu -> About c:geo -> Swipe right to System) Keep the apostrophe at beginning and end to have it properly formatted Other comments and remarks: e.g. Reference to other issues, projects, sources, etc.

report.summary: Save for offline saves also already stored caches
report.label: Bug
report.description: From support mail (translated by myself): Since this version (2016.12.06) I have the problem, that if I e.g. see 50 caches on the map and I select "Save for Offline" all 50 caches are saved but not only those currently not yet saved. This worked in previous versions.

report.summary: GC search doesn't work anymore
report.label: Bug
report.description: Parsing of the GC search result page doesn't work anymore. First thing I found is that the parsing of if (!row.contains("images/wpttypes")) { because it is mixed case now. Checking for if (!row.contains("images/WptTypes")) { gives a search result, but all cache types are wrong (unknown).

report.summary: Waypoint type not parsed correct
report.label: Bug
report.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: GC19EE6 should have a parking waypoint It was correctly stored some weeks ago on my device After updating it today the waypoint type changed to reference point Looking at other freshly loaded caches nearly all waypoints seem to be parsed as reference point. Version of c:geo used: 2017.12.16-NB1 (incl. latest site change fixes) Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes

report.summary: Changing only notes in waypoint calculator does not set the dirty state
report.label: Bug
report.description: Detailed steps causing the problem: Open waypoint calculator; the calculator must be in "incomplete" state where the disc icon is displayed Press Save (disc button); disc button gets disabled Edit notes within the waypoint calculator Actual behavior after performing these steps: Disc button stays disabled; saving is not possible Expected behavior after performing these steps: It should be possible to edit only calculator notes and to save it. Version of c:geo used: 2018.01.04-NB Is the problem reproducible for you? Yes
